Smallholder regions are characterized by low living standards, high rates of illiteracy and low agricultural productivity. Yara's mission is "Responsibly Feed the World and Protect the Planet". Key to achieving this is enabling thriving Smallholder Communities.In 2017, Yara created the business unit, Digital Farming. At Yara Digital Farming, we are building solutions for farming communities, constructing hardware and sensors, crunching satellite data, applying artificial intelligence, and turning research results into services, products and solutions, all aimed at achieving this mission.Our team is made up of designers, software engineers, hardware developers, data scientists, services and solution managers and product owners. Digital Farming is a strategic priority within Yara. Each year we significantly grow our global Digital Farming team and country coverage. With hubs in Europe, Latin America, Asia and North America, Yara Digital Farming is shaping the future of farming by building new digital solutions solving critical problems within agriculture.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with the rest of the software development team to execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure solutions’ qualityHelp create test strategy, plans, approach, scripts and any other deliverable necessary to achieve high level of qualitySupport the tracking and creation of quality assurance metricsHelp with continued development and promotion of QA guidelines, best practices and standardsSupport the promotion of QA goals and approach are well understood and ultimately secures buy-in by all relevant team membersDesign, develop and execute automation scriptsProfileStrong personal/professional interest in the LSM segments (developing countries, low-income markets, etc) and agriculture in general.Basic experience with coding, testing and quality assurance. title: Research Officer (Ref:DMSMC)
description: We are looking for a highly motivated and talented individual with passion in cancer genomics, biology and radiation research to join the Tan Chin Tuan Laboratory of Optical Imaging, Photodynamic and Proton Therapy - Precision Radiation Oncology Programme (PROP). The scope of the projects conducted under the premise of PROP includes 1) early- and late-phase clinical trials; 2) cancer genomics and data science; and 3) translational cancer and radiation biology. For this role, you will be mainly working with the Principal Investigator (PI) and the research teams under Themes 2 and 3. The projects include studying the efficacy of novel therapeutic modalities such as proton beam therapy and photodynamic therapy versus conventional radiotherapy in head and neck cancers and prostate cancers. Additionally, in vitro human cancer cell lines and in vivo mouse tumour models will be used for evaluating therapeutic efficacy and mechanisms underpinning the drug response outcomes. In parallel, clinical studies will be conducted with patient-derived samples. You will be involved with inter-departmental collaborations with oncologists, pathologists, scientists, and local and international collaborators. For this role, you will be directly supervised and mentored by a Ph.D. Research Fellow (RF) and other senior staff with extensive experience.You will participate in the following activities:Design experiments to evaluate biological response of cancer cells/tumours following radiation.Test novel therapeutic modalities, including photodynamic therapy and proton therapy.Generate immunodeficient/immunocompetent mouse models of cancers.Process patient samples to obtain DNA and RNA for sequencing.Maintain biobank of collected patient samples.Mechanistically validate genetic discoveries from next generation sequencing experiments.Assist PI/co-investigators in preparing annual reports, conference presentations, manuscripts and reviews for publication, and grant/patent applications.Work with other researchers and doctors in research and clinical teams, as well as external science collaborators and other administrative teams.Auto req ID7180BRJob RequirementsB.Sc. Degree/Diploma in Biomedical/Life Sciences, or related fields.At least 1 to 2 years of research experience in radiation biology is necessary.Skills in molecular and cellular biological techniques, such as western blot, PCR, DNA/RNA extraction for next generation sequencing are necessary.Comfortable working with mouse models. Experience in in vivo mouse tumour models will be a plus.Strong organizational, interpersonal and presentation skills.Analytical, self-confident and mature personality.Responsible and passionate about oncology and translational research.Able to work both independently and with other team members under pressure.Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Interested candidates should send in your curriculum vitae with full contact information of three referees.Job CategoryResearchJob FunctionLaboratory, Life Sciences, Research & Development, Research / Survey ServicesEmployment TypeContract Full TimeLocationSingaporeEducation LevelBachelor’s Degree (Hons), Bachelors Degree

title: Photophysics Research Engineer
description: Job Opening ID: 123478Singapore, SingaporeFull-TimeRegularCompany OverviewCalling the adventurers ready to join a company that's pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling. At KLA, we're making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen.Who are we? We research, develop, and manufacture the world's most advanced inspection and measurement equipment for the semiconductor and nanoelectronics industries. We enable the digital age by pushing the boundaries of technology, creating tools capable of finding defects smaller than a wavelength of visible light. We create smarter processes so that technology leaders can manufacture high-performance chips—the kind in that phone in your pocket, the tablet on your desk and nearly every electronic device you own—faster and better. We're passionate about creating solutions that drive progress and help people do what wouldn't be possible without us. The future is calling. Will you answer?Group/DivisionThe Office of the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) plays a critical role in developing advanced long-range technology in collaboration with product divisions and strategic marketing, working on future technology like light sources, lasers, and sensors. We are engaged in the research and development process, and once the technology is mature, we partner with product engineering groups who then build products based on the technology we’ve developed.The Office of the CTO also provides technical input into KLA’s strategic planning process, program reviews and Product Life Cycle (PLC) phases. We provide our broad technology expertise and cross-division experience to ensure we leverage the collective knowledge within our company.ResponsibilitiesThis position requires a solid understanding of interaction mechanism between photons and materials, and its application to photochemistry, photocontamination, and materials selection under high power ultraviolet light exposure. The candidate must have high proficiency in experimental and data analysis, demonstrate the ability to extract clear results from complex data sets.The candidate will provide guidance and leadership in the following areas:Surface analytical and data analysis; Extraction of clear results and conclusions from data sets.Making actionable plans from analysed data and discussions with subject matter experts.Failure analysis while working closely with other engineering groups, such as material research scientists, optics engineers, opto-mechanical engineers and laser systems engineers to ensure the feasibilities of new material/process to KT productsStrong team building with CTO team in Milpitas and other groups involved in the projects.Understands UV driven photo contamination, and implementation of control via materials selection, cleaning processes and purge control. Establish the reliability model of optics under certain UV radiation conditions.Provides guidance to opto-mechanical engineers to meet reliability and performance specs of our next generation opto-mechanical sub-systems.Guiding the design teams on proper contamination control packaging/materials selectionConducting laser damage test and analysis as neededOptical coating improvementsBulk opticsNon-linear opticsSupplier qualification and developmentQualificationsPh.D. in physics, optics or related with at least 2 years of experience. OR Master's Level Degree with at least 5 years of experienceStrong fundamental knowledge in chemistry, material science and surface science.Analytical instruments: optical interferometer and other surface analytical techniques (GCMS, SEM, AFM) a plusStrong knowledge on optics crystal and thin film optics coating technologyComfortable with hands on mechanical work and design of experiments. Experience in setting up optical bench for conducting opto-electronic measurementsExcellent communication and presentation skillsMust be a good team player

Its mission is to deliver market-leading cost of ownership in defect detection for a broad range of applications in the production of semiconductors. Customers from the foundry, logic, memory, automotive, MEMS, advanced packaging and other markets rely upon high-sample wafer inspection information generated by LS-SWIFT products.LS (Laser Scanning) systems enable cost-effective patterned wafer defect detection for the industry’s most sophisticated process technologies deployed in leading-edge foundry, logic, DRAM, and NAND fabs. SWIFT (Simultaneous Wafer Inspection at Fast Throughput) systems deliver all-wafer-surface (frontside, backside, and edge) macro inspection that is critical for automotive IC, MEMS, and advanced packaging processes as well as foundry/logic and memory fabs.LS-SWIFT operates from a global footprint that includes the US, Singapore, India and Germany, and serves a worldwide customer base across Asia, Europe and North America.ResponsibilitiesTrainee to be involved in:Solving complex system integration issues on an optical wafer inspection toolDeveloping product specifications based on system requirementInvolve in product development through release and will be expected to champion his/her technical solutionProviding feedback on design changes by working closely with Development Engineering teams (M.E., E.E., and S/W Eng.) and creating ECO and documentation as neededProviding fix support on field escalations for analysis/resolution on any issue requiring in-depth design know-how on the product and support beta testing at customer sitesReviewing marketing requirements, develop system critical design specifications and design test methodsAbility to read technical drawings, understand BOMs, and use a variety of precision testing and measuring InstrumentsGain strong troubleshooting and analytical skills to support technical issues, set-up experiments, and perform data analysisDevelop In-depth understanding of optical, mechanical, electrical, and software components involved in the design and development of optical-based, semiconductor inspection equipmentQualificationsMaster’s/Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering or related fields with 5 or more years of experience in System Engineering

title: QA Manager - Singapore
description: At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us. It's a commitment. This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have the potential to change the world.We enable scientists to advance their research, allowing them to address scientific questions they didn't even know they could ask. Our tools have enabled fundamental discoveries described in over 1000 peer-reviewed publications across multiple application areas, including cancer, immunology, and neuroscience.Our teams are empowered and encouraged to follow their passions, pursue new ideas, and perform at their best in an inclusive and dynamic environment. The innovations and discoveries that we enable together will lead to better technologies, better treatments, and a better future. Find out how you can make a 10x difference.QA Manager - SingaporeAbout the role:10x is seeking an QA manager to establish, maintain and improve the Quality systems to assure compliance and continuous improvements. This position works indirectly and directly with multiple functions and global quality to assure understanding of quality process, tracking metrics. Additionally, the QA manager functions as a subject-matter resource for quality systems, compliance and validation systems and primary site quality contact for business leadersWhat you will be doing:Appointed person as the site Quality Management Representative.Lead the site quality program that ensures that the quality system meets all applicable regulatory and quality standard, and customer expectationsSupport product quality and manufacturing activities and is accountable for driving change, establishing effective and sustainable business processes (nonconformity, customer complaints and CAPA), improving product quality, and providing senior management with actionable data mining/analysis and status updates.Provide quality support for NPI activities including process and product transfer, and QC method validation, equipment and process qualification and facility validation, and product lifecycle management.Responsible for the internal audit program to ensure the site is compliant to procedures and quality standards.Oversee compliance audit activities, ensure findings response completed within timeline & oversee the implementation of response commitments.Oversee site product quality & customer complaints/feedback. May involve in leading investigations & resolve potential product quality issues.Able lead ISO13485 certification & sustenance for the site in the designated future timeframe .Define and implement the consistent application of best practices across manufacturing processes. Drive the culture of quality in all aspects of daily activitiesTo be successful in this role, you must have:An engineering or biological science discipline. Advanced degree preferred.8+ years' experience in a manufacturing environment of Life Sciences or Pharmaceutical /Medical Device industry.GMP Quality leadership experience will be advantageous.Extensive & hands on experience in internal & external audits and CAPA management.Experience in leading within a matrix environment.At least 7 years' experience in direct Quality Assurance including at least 3 years' experience in Quality Systems Management and 3 years of supervisor experience.Strong collaboration and communication skills with colleagues and external collaborators,Nice to have skills:Quality certification (CQA/ASQ/ISO9001/ISO13485)Experience with operations and supplier quality management, and risk management.About 10x Genomics10x Genomics (NASDAQ: TXG) is building tools for scientific discovery that reveal and address the true complexities of biology and disease. Through a combination of novel microfluidics, chemistry, and bioinformatics, our technology is enabling researchers around the world to more fully understand the mechanisms behind cancer, the immune system, and the fundamentals of biology at the single-cell level. 10x is one of the fastest-growing biotech companies of the decade, growing from $3M in revenue in 2015 to over $200M in 2019, and has backed over 900 scientific publications in the past five years. For more information, visit www.10xgenomics.com.#LI-LN1

liquid bulk commodity markets.For this role, you will need to possess the ability to:Develop global supply and demand balance models for refined products by leveraging your strong understanding of the refining industry and margins, freight dynamics and trade routes and the supply and demand outlook for refined products.Deliver clear, concise and actionable analysis and insight through both prepared and improvised client-facing meetings (via web conferences, phone calls or in person) and through written analysis, commentary and interpretation of market events and developing trends.Support sales people and product managers in sales meetings by providing commercial, actionable insights to prospects and clients through live demonstrations that leverage your understanding of our suite of commodity analytics products.Collaborate with and advise our technical teams on ways to further improve our automated systems’ commodity voyage identification and classification rules and intervene product managers. title: Project Officer (Earth Sciences/Geography/Environmental Studies/Public Policy/Engineering)

In addition, Senior Consultants are an integral part of the Financial Crime Compliance (FCC) Advisory practice in the delivery of high-quality products and services to clients. Senior Consultants have developed a sound understanding of the different fields in FCC including Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud and Investigations, Anti-Bribery & Corruptions as well as other criminal offenses affecting an organization.Do you have a passion for serving a global operation, organizing multiple complex engagements, investigating and combating financial crime and market abuse around the world? Exiger’s team includes former bank regulators, federal law enforcement officials, financial institution compliance offers, researchers, engineers, data scientists, and more. As a Senior Consultant, you will have the opportunity to help our clients mitigate their risks related to money laundering, terrorist financing, sanctions violations, collusion, insider trading and market abuse using a cutting-edge toolset. You will build your professional skills in a variety of ways, including building and managing global teams, assisting the Regional Leader with M&A and partnership activities and contributing to some of the largest FCC monitorship assignments in history.Key ResponsibilitiesResponsible for executing engagements in the following areas: Compliance Program Assessments, AML Technology Validation, AML Transaction Analysis (Look Back), AML Know Your Customer Due Diligence, AML Enterprise-Wide and Customer Risk Assessments, AML and Sanctions Training, AML and Sanctions Independent Testing and Technology Consulting. This includes undertaking thorough analysis and research, leading small teams of colleagues responsible for conducting client work, and helping to develop proposals, reports, recommendations and other deliverables with the use of technology.Identify capability gaps and create a business case to fulfill gaps in client’s AML program. title: $6000-$8300 Staff R&D Optical Engineer
description: Summary :This is a R&D position within a dynamic and innovative technology development team, focusing on illumination source technologies required for next generations of wafer inspection and metrology equipment.The main responsibility of this position is to manage all aspects of optical module designs from evaluating initial specifications to validating performance of finished prototypes, including tasks listed below:Responsibilities:As a critical part of Singapore team, work with scientists in US to gain deep understanding of technology and engineering challenges of illumination sources, such as lasers and broadband plasma. Replicate the proven system from US, run reliability tests and characteristic measurements and use the learnings towards a more robust design.Work closely with the systems group to develop the fundamental specifications of illumination system and drive down to requirements for optical design, with the consideration of desired system performance, achievable optics capability and other factors.Design lenses and optical subsystems in ZEMAX or equivalent optical modeling software, including lens elements, multi-lens systems, or other optical components, systems or subsystems. Conduct optical tolerance, aberration, stray light, and sensitivity analyses of optical designs, as necessary.Design and execute multi-disciplinary experiments, create detailed test plans and summary reports for system performance validation. Analyze experimental data and compare with simulation model for design correlation and optimization.Create and review specifications, concepts, and design documents throughout the development cycle.Be an effective communicator and team player while working with other engineering groups, such as laser systems engineer, mechanical design engineer and electric design engineer, to ensure flawless design, integration and test at the subsystem and system level.Requirements:Master's level degree in optics engineering or related with at least 8 years of experience orDoctorate (Academic) in optics engineering or related with at least 5 years of experienceExperience as a direct contributor in optical system design and tolerancing (in Zemax OpticStudio and/or CODE V) from concept to fieldable prototype or product.Must have experience of aligning, debugging and characterizing optical systems.Experience with beam shaping design is a plusExperience with thermal management in high power laser system is a plusMust be a good team playerAll Successful candidates can expect a very competitive remuneration package and a comprehensive range of benefits.Please email your resume in a detailed MS Word format to statingExpecting SalaryDate AvailableReason to Leave each job:We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notifiedJoyce Koh Ai LengPeople Profilers Pte Ltd,10 Anson Road #09-01/02 International PlazaSingapore 079903Tel: 6805 0868www.peopleprofilers.comEA License Number: 02C4944EA Personnel Reg nos R1110618Job Id:6R3Y75Bachelor's / Honours, Masters / PhDMinimum of 6 year(s) experience needed for this position

title: #SGUnitedJobs GIS - Research Scientist (Laboratory of Precision Oncology and Cancer Evolution)
description: [CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE WORK PASSES NEED NOT APPLY]Job duties & Responsibilities:The main role of this Post Doctoral Fellow will be to implement the OncoMiMIC GAP-funded project and ensure that the project’s primary objectives are fulfilled while simultaneously contributing towards the KPI’s of the Precision Oncology Laboratory. In this capacity the main responsibilities will include:Responsibility(Research Related)Realization of a functional, scalable, multiplexed microfluidic testing platform, which is suitable for future commercialization and which can be used for screening and experimentation with commercially available and patient-derived immune-tumor cell pairs in the presence and/or absence of combinations of immunotherapeutic and cytotoxic (standard of care treatment) drugs.Continue to improve and oversee the fabrication of the physical OncoMiMIC chip design with an emphasis on an eventual transition to an industrial-scale level of production. Develop different multiplexed devices (based on the basic OncoMiMIC chip design) which can be integrated into an automated process for massive scale-up. Design and fabricate and/or acquire of any peripheral equipment necessary for automated processing of multiple cell samples.Provide meaningful suggestions regarding the biological experimental design aspect of the project. This includes but is not limited to the specific steps in the experimental protocol (cell seeding, cell pairing, static cell culture conditions, and the design of the microenvironment) as well as specific steps in the data acquisition process and timing.Develop and implement project-specific Deep-Learning and Machine Learning algorithms to automate/improve the data analysis of massive amounts data generated for OncoMiMIC. Provide engineering assistance, computer-vision data analysis assistance, or any relevant consultation necessary to the project PI or any member of the Precision Oncology Laboratory, while prioritizing work that is related to or tangential to the OncoMiMIC project.(Administrative and Management Related)Assist the project PI in any capacity necessary to advance the commercial goals of the GAP-funded project, to develop and protect any intellectual property arising from the project, and to reach any fundraising milestones to eventually form a spinoff enterprise. Assist the project PI in the responsible management and expeditious spending of the GAP budget within the project’s set time frame.Provide periodic updates with the project’s progress, and be willing and able to communicate the current state of the project, it’s future direction, as well as provide explanations as to why particular decisions were made and how they contribute to the realization of a fully commercialized platform. Be willing and able to communicate and provide context regarding the platform’s commercial value. This includes providing market potential and size, an overview of the competitive landscape, manufacturing challenges and raising capital. Be willing and able to “pitch” the platform in order to raise funds to support the project and/or business in the future.Assist the project PI in guiding any staff involved with the project in terms of understanding the platform design, scope, engineering challenges and/or automation of data analysis.Requirements:PhD in Biological/Chemical Process Engineering with at least 6 years of experience with microfluidic device platforms/multiplexed platformsIn-depth experience with computer vision analysis and deep learning algorithms for biological systems, excellent knowledge of automation and fabrication processes for microfluidic platformsOutstanding communication skills and experience with project/grant management.A proven track-record of innovation and development of commercializeable platforms.The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.minimumYearsExperience : 6

title: Logistics Admin Support
description: About usDyson offers a unique opportunity for talented individuals for a permanent position in our Philippines Advanced Manufacturing and RDD facility.Being part of a small but growing team working on the Dyson Digital Motor in the Philippines, this role combines supporting the existing family of Dyson Digital Motors and associated products with the analysis and validation of new motor projects in the run-up to the start of production. The DDMD team form part of the wider Motors and Power Systems Group and is a significant part of Dyson RDD with a growing team of more than 100 highly skilled engineers, scientists and technicians in its UK, Singapore and Philippines offices. The Group focuses on researching and developing cutting-edge electric motors, drives and control systems for integration into existing and future Dyson products from concept design to fully automated productionAbout the roleThis role will be a Logistics Executive and will focus primarily on Inter-Plant / Inter-PEZA transfers of both finished goods and semi-finished goods from Dyson to Contract Manufacturer and vice versa.About youRequirements: Build relationships with Contract Manufacturers (CM) and Freight Forwarders, and act as liaison between our CM and the Dyson Supply Chain for any day to day operations issues and escalation to group when it comes to Sea or Air freight shipments Ability to resolve and escalate critical issuesWill focus on the inter-PEZA / inter-plant transfers from Dyson to CM and vice versa but will also have opportunities to handle outbound and inbound shipments. Contributes or even leads specific (simple) continuous improvement projectsResponsible to own specific responsibilities on behalf of the logistics operations team Ensures goods are shipped out on time and receipted on time and in good conditionEnsures Dyson systems (paperwork) are accurate and updated on time Management, development and reporting of Key Performance Indicators (associated with Ocean Freight traffic globally)Maintains tracking of (air) freight spend, reporting and managing costs to minimum and providing reporting to exec team Manages ad hoc quotesSystems - SAP / EDI / Elementum Process / continuous improvementProjects Interacts with CM, Dyson markets, planning and freight forwarders on frequent basis Familiarity in Logistics operations (outbound, inbound and inter-PEZA shipments) and in the local regulations (i.e. BOC, PEZA, etc…) Has experience in handling inter-PEZA / inter-plant transfersEnergy, integrity, positive attitude, self-directed Personal drive, delivers strong operational results and specific projects under pressureCommunicative, and able to build cross-functional relationships Set structure, drive data analysis with team to support the categoryExcellent Analytical skills to drive cost down, organise ad-hoc quotes, support simple negotiations Customs documentation awareness preferableSimple negotiation / procurement experience would be preferred Experience of SAP ERP and APOCommercial bias Experience of working in multi-national / multi-lingual teams minimum 3yrsExcellent understanding of Supply Chain Dynamics Excellent communication skills in English written and verbalBenefitsDyson Philippine monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realizing ambitionInterview guidanceWe are following the government guidelines regarding COVID19. title: Laboratory Technician
description: We are a leading chemical company, with the best teams developing intelligent solutions for our customers and for a sustainable future. Today, BASF Philippines, Inc. is a leading supplier of chemicals for industries including construction and coatings, automotive, health and nutrition, personal and home care, chemicals and plastics, and agriculture. BASF also operates an agricultural research station which conducts research, laboratory studies and field testing of novel technologies as part of BASF’s global research effort in the field of agricultural solutions. In 2018, BASF posted sales to customers in Philippines of approximately €113 million and employed 95 people as of the end of the year. Further information on BASF in the Philippines is available at www.basf.com/ph.Objective of the Position:To assist Research Assistant in tropical screening and advance testing of the Insecticide Research Team. .Main Areas of Responsibilities:Assist during assays in the screening laboratory, which include the conduct of necessary pre and post-inoculation, and preparation of other assay materials for the smooth implementation of screening for both tropical screening and advanced testing.Serve as spray-man in the absence of the Research Scientist or Research Assistant during assays ensuring errors are minimized to avoid re-tests.Assist in the preparation of host plants for both bioassays and insect cultures.Assist in data gathering for tropical screening, advanced testing and microplot (as needed) to generate data on characterization of early phase compounds.Assist in mass rearing of insects used for Advanced, Non-crop and Microplot trials ensuring consistent and adequate supply for the laboratory trials.Assist in the development of new and/or improvement of current rearing methodologies to cater the requests of internal customers.Practice good housekeeping to maintain cleanliness and orderliness at the nursery.Follow safety and security regulations and procedure of the company.Minimum Education and Qualification Required:Graduate of high school; Degree in Agriculture is a definite advantage.With at least 3 years of related work experience in insecticide research: insectary, screening, host plant production and field trials.Knowledgeable of crop production and is proficient in insect mass rearing techniques.Possess strong attention to details.Can express self well in the local language; being able to communicate well in English is an advantage.Proficient in using computers.Demonstrate professionalism and integrity at work.Demonstrate high level of energy and maintain stable performance under pressure.Proactive, can work independently and in teams.Residing or willing to work in Bay, Laguna.

This will help to make wealth management advice not just accessible to wealthy individuals, but to the general public at large.The team will also examine ways to enhance banking services through the adoption of blockchain technology and develop new means of digital marketing for banking services using the Internet-of-Things (IoT) and machine learning technology. title: Research Scientist / Senior Research Scientist (High-Resolution Ensemble Numerical Weather Prediction)
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAppointments will be for a 2-year initial period with a prospect of a permanent position.The Centre for Climate Research Singapore (CCRS) is the research arm of the Meteorological Service Singapore (MSS). Formally launched in 2013, the centre has two research branches: Climate Branch and Weather Branch. The centre’s focus is on weather and climate research areas of importance to Singapore and the wider Southeast Asian region. The centre is well supported with a dedicated super-computer. CCRS is expanding its efforts to develop state-of-the-art Numerical Weather Prediction (NWP) capabilities for operational prediction, as well as to become a regional centre of expertise in high-resolution NWP research and development. In addition to the in-house resources, we also have an extensive collaboration with the UK Met Office that is developing a high- resolution tropical forecast system.We are seeking a highly motivated scientist with a strong background in meteorology, mathematics, physics or a related discipline to join the weather model development team and be the CCRS lead for the high-resolution ensemble NWP. Ideally, the candidate will have experience with ensemble prediction systems. The specific job responsibilities of this position will include:Keeping abreast with the latest international developments in ensemble prediction techniques and strategies including data assimilation;Carrying out research to improve the quality of ensemble forecasts produced by the high-resolution ‘SINGV’ NWP system, for the benefit of Singaporean stakeholders;Performing diagnosis and verification of ensemble forecasts, in terms of relevant high impact weather parameters, e.g. heavy rainfall, wind gusts, etc.;Providing scientific/technical advice to other team members on some work aspects to improve the effectiveness of the team;Presenting results at international meetings and publishing the research in peer-reviewed journals.Candidate Requirements:PhD in a relevant field such as meteorology, fluid dynamics, mathematics or physics;Experience with NWP and/or computational fluid dynamics;Demonstrate ability to undertake research work both individually and as part of a team;Proficient in scientific computing;Proven record of success as demonstrated by publications in peer-reviewed journals;Good written and verbal presentation skills;Able to supervise and coach less experienced team members in conducting research projects (for Senior Research Scientists).5 years exp

title: Senior Scientist, Molecular Biology
description: How Will You Make an Impact? The Senior Scientist, Molecular Biology will take a leading role in integration, verification and validation (V&V) of instrument systems new product introductions (NPI) with the emphasis on molecular biology, biochemistry and sample prep methods. Projects will include both research use only (RUO) and in vitro diagnostics (IVD) products. The candidate will provide technical expertise on a project and department levels and will be expected to integrate into a dynamic and multidisciplinary team.The successful applicant is required to exhibit a results-orientated attitude with the ability to thrive in fast paced environment of biotechnology. The Senior Scientist will be expected to represent V&V function on a project core team. Successful candidate will possess good practical knowledge of molecular biology techniques, such as PCR, qPCR, capillary electrophoresis or NGS. Work hours: Mon-Fri, 8am - 515pm Location: Marsiling, Singapore (8-10 mins walk from Woodlands MRT/bus interchange) Reporting to: Manager, Molecular Biology What will you do?Leads V&V activities for new instrumentation based on PCR, qPCR, electrophoresis and other molecular biology methods. * Represents verification and validation function on a project core team. * Personally conducts experiments using molecular biology methods * Champions development of novel and improvement of existing test methods. * Authors test protocols, reports and other project lifecycle controlled documentation.Problem solves using knowledge of technical product details, design control and basic regulatory issues. * Designs and conducts experiments independently and maintains laboratory notebook. * Exercises independent judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. * Utilizes statistical tools in experiment planning and analyzing complex data sets.Leads training and guidance of scientists and engineers; may review and approve other scientist’s work. * Adheres to internal policies and procedures, as well as external quality standards (e.g., ISO 13485:2016). How will you get here? I.Education * Ph.D in Biomedical Engineering, Molecular Biology, Chemistry, or similar. * Lower degree is acceptable for candidates with at least 5 years of relevant work experience. II. Experience * At least 3 years of biotechnology industry experience with a track record of product development and design control.Sound knowledge and experience in common molecular biology and biochemistry methods. * Working knowledge of biostatistics techniques and tools (e.g., JMP, R). III. Knowledge, Skills, Abilities * Understands biotechnology product lifecycle and roles of key project team members.Understanding of ISO 13485 and ISO 9001 quality standards. * Effective verbal and written communication skills. * Ability to work well in diverse teams. * Self-motivated, results oriented individual who is able to work with minimal supervision.Familiar with design of experiments (DOE) principles is desired. * Knowledge of IVD process for MDx will be an advantage.

You will perform some of the following roles: machine learning, mathematical/statistical analysis, coding, data ingestion/engineering, and system engineering to meet asset management and maintenance outcomes over lifecycle of the assets.You will work closely with teams from different disciplines within LTA, rail operators, system manufacturers on the data and interfaces of rail assets, as well as set out/explain rail asset management business use cases using data. title: Intern, Test and QA
description: Date posted: Aug 26, 2020Location:Singapore, SGJob Function: Information TechnologyJob Type: InternJob Requisition ID: 4260Intern, Test and QAAbout the UnitThere are more than 500 million smallholder farms globally. 2.5 billion people depend on Smallholder Communities for their food and livelihoods. Smallholder regions are characterized by low living standards, high rates of illiteracy and low agricultural productivity. Yara's mission is "Responsibly Feed the World and Protect the Planet". Key to achieving this is enabling thriving Smallholder Communities.In 2017, Yara created the business unit, Digital Farming. At Yara Digital Farming, we are building solutions for farming communities, constructing hardware and sensors, crunching satellite data, applying artificial intelligence, and turning research results into services, products and solutions, all aimed at achieving this mission.Our team is made up of designers, software engineers, hardware developers, data scientists, services and solution managers and product owners. Digital Farming is a strategic priority within Yara. Each year we significantly grow our global Digital Farming team and country coverage. With hubs in Europe, Latin America, Asia and North America, Yara Digital Farming is shaping the future of farming by building new digital solutions solving critical problems within agriculture.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with the rest of the software development team to execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure solutions’ qualityHelp create test strategy, plans, approach, scripts and any other deliverable necessary to achieve high level of qualitySupport the tracking and creation of quality assurance metricsHelp with continued development and promotion of QA guidelines, best practices and standardsSupport the promotion of QA goals and approach are well understood and ultimately secures buy-in by all relevant team membersDesign, develop and execute automation scriptsProfileStrong personal/professional interest in the LSM segments (developing countries, low-income markets, etc) and agriculture in general.Basic experience with coding, testing and quality assurance. Detail focused.Additional InformationWe encourage all qualified applicants from all backgrounds to apply and are committed to creating a work environment that fits gender equality and allows combining career progress with the needs of a family or other personal circumstances.Why us?Evolving tech development division of an established agricultural products and services company.Explore and develop digital, software, hardware products, which provide value to farmers, smallholder communities and the value chain.Be part of our mission to build sustainable solutions that benefit humanity and the environment.Full-time, permanent and freelance contract options available with competitive remuneration + benefits.Support for personal development, training and continuous learning.Commitment to using new technologies and frameworks, meetups, and knowledge sharing.Apply no later thanJob Segment: Agricultural, Sustainable Agriculture, QA Tester, QA, Agriculture, Quality, Research

title: QA Manager - Singapore
description: At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us. It's a commitment. This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have the potential to change the world.We enable scientists to advance their research, allowing them to address scientific questions they didn't even know they could ask. Our tools have enabled fundamental discoveries described in over 1000 peer-reviewed publications across multiple application areas, including cancer, immunology, and neuroscience.Our teams are empowered and encouraged to follow their passions, pursue new ideas, and perform at their best in an inclusive and dynamic environment. The innovations and discoveries that we enable together will lead to better technologies, better treatments, and a better future. Find out how you can make a 10x difference.QA Manager - SingaporeAbout the role:10x is seeking an QA manager to establish, maintain and improve the Quality systems to assure compliance and continuous improvements. This position works indirectly and directly with multiple functions and global quality to assure understanding of quality process, tracking metrics. Additionally, the QA manager functions as a subject-matter resource for quality systems, compliance and validation systems and primary site quality contact for business leadersWhat you will be doing:Appointed person as the site Quality Management Representative.Lead the site quality program that ensures that the quality system meets all applicable regulatory and quality standard, and customer expectationsSupport product quality and manufacturing activities and is accountable for driving change, establishing effective and sustainable business processes (nonconformity, customer complaints and CAPA), improving product quality, and providing senior management with actionable data mining/analysis and status updates.Provide quality support for NPI activities including process and product transfer, and QC method validation, equipment and process qualification and facility validation, and product lifecycle management.Responsible for the internal audit program to ensure the site is compliant to procedures and quality standards.Oversee compliance audit activities, ensure findings response completed within timeline & oversee the implementation of response commitments.Oversee site product quality & customer complaints/feedback. May involve in leading investigations & resolve potential product quality issues.Able lead ISO13485 certification & sustenance for the site in the designated future timeframe .Define and implement the consistent application of best practices across manufacturing processes. Drive the culture of quality in all aspects of daily activitiesTo be successful in this role, you must have:An engineering or biological science discipline. Advanced degree preferred.8+ years' experience in a manufacturing environment of Life Sciences or Pharmaceutical /Medical Device industry.GMP Quality leadership experience will be advantageous.Extensive & hands on experience in internal & external audits and CAPA management.Experience in leading within a matrix environment.At least 7 years' experience in direct Quality Assurance including at least 3 years' experience in Quality Systems Management and 3 years of supervisor experience.Prefer manufacturing operations experience in the past.Strong collaboration and communication skills with colleagues and external collaboratorsNice to have skills:Quality certification (CQA/ASQ/ISO9001/ISO13485)Experience with operations and supplier quality management, and risk management.About 10x Genomics10x Genomics (NASDAQ: TXG) is building tools for scientific discovery that reveal and address the true complexities of biology and disease. Through a combination of novel microfluidics, chemistry, and bioinformatics, our technology is enabling researchers around the world to more fully understand the mechanisms behind cancer, the immune system, and the fundamentals of biology at the single-cell level. 10x is one of the fastest-growing biotech companies of the decade, growing from $3M in revenue in 2015 to over $200M in 2019, and has backed over 900 scientific publications in the past five years. For more information, visit www.10xgenomics.com.#LI-LN1

title: Project Officer (Earth Sciences/Geography/Environmental Studies/Public Policy/Engineering)
description: The Earth Observatory of Singapore (EOS) invite applications for the position of Project Officer.The Project Officer will join a dynamic, expanding research group that investigates the complex impact that natural hazards have on society (http://resilience-science.org/). In particular, the Project Officer will contribute to a project to better understand, quantify and predict long-term earthquake impact including socio-economic impact, based on research in Nepal.The work will involve assisting in the preparation and coordination for field surveys, assistance with lab management and purchases, organization of design research workshops, and communications for internal reporting and external announcements. title: Consumer Insights Intern
description: Office Location: GSK Asia HousePreferred Period of Internship Required: 6th January 2021 – June 2021Preferred School/Course of Intern: Preferably Food science, Life science or similar disciplinesJOB PURPOSE:We are looking for an intern to assist Consumer Science and Product Understanding R&D in delivering innovation programs for GSK Consumer Health R&D. The Industrial Placement student will work under supervision of the Consumer Science and Product Understanding Lead and collaborate with other functions of commercial, innovation, manufacturing, medical, regulatory, insights and R&D scientists in the company to provide appropriate and timely input into our innovation program.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:You will be required to support the Consumer Science and Product Understanding team in undertaking consumer research, data analysis & innovation workshops, including evaluating & summarizing consumer and sensory data. Key responsibilities include:Landscaping: understanding consumer, competitor, product trends to generate new insights and opportunities relevant for Consumer Healthcare categories (Pain Management, Respiratory and Skin Health, Oral Health and Wellness)Data Mining: conducting review and analysis of previous consumer studies to generate new insights and learning to strengthen current proposition or identify new opportunities for further research and explorationConsumer/Sensory Research: assist in the preparation, planning, conduct, data analysis and documentation of consumer studies in CH R&DCoordinating with other functions to prepare for consumer research studies – questionnaire review/alignment, sample preparation and shipments, internal clearances and approvalsCoordinating with respective agencies for preparation and conduct of consumer research studiesAssist in the preparation of reports and documentation of relevant studies following internal SOPs and guidelinesInnovation Workshops: assist in the preparation, planning, and conduct of innovation workshops for CH R&DWorking with internal and external partners to prepare for innovation workshopsAssist in facilitation and execution of Innovation WorkshopsLEARNING OUTCOMES:You will be able to:Obtain high level overview of the R&D/Innovation processes and activities and its position in the product lifecycleUnderstand importance of consumer and sensory sciences in the product development and market successUnderstand relevance and applications of fundamental science / technical knowledge to industry / product developmentThis role is an excellent opportunity to learn about the fast-moving consumer healthcare (FMCH) industry and experience the role of research & development in shaping business strategy and success. This role will be based in Singapore.GSK IDEAL FIT:We are looking for someone with the following:Business Skills and CompetenciesEducational background – studying Pharmacy, Food Science or Life Sciences related degree (Penultimate students preferred)Proficient in use of IT and software/systems, ideally document management and database systemsBehavioural Skills and CompetenciesStrong written and oral communication skillsDeadline-driven, flexible with self-reliance to work in an empowered environmentAwareness and ability to work within culturally diverse teamsDemonstrated ability to take initiative, think and work independently, and problem-solveStrong drive for performance and attention to detailsA keen interest in consumer healthcare science, product and development, and a passion for knowledgeWatch our video to find out more.Apply now by 11 September 2020You’ll be asked for your personal information and why you want to work for us. We recommend you apply as soon as possible, because we accept ongoing applications and offer positions on a first come, first served basis.At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We strive to make our recruitment process free of bias of any kind and aim to create an inclusive workplace at GSK. If you require any assistance, either to attend an interview or during the course of the recruitment process, please let us know.LI-GSKOur goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing.Important notice to Employment businesses/ AgenciesGSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Inside Sales Representative
description: Job Summary:The Inside Sales Representative (ISR) is responsible for driving consumable sales and serving as the initial point of contact for pre-sales customer inquiries. S/he manages the sales process for specific products lines, accounts and/or sales opportunities via phone and e-mail. Responsibilities include engaging with existing customers, generating new sales leads, introducing customers to the NanoString products that best meet their needs, coordinating with internal resources to address customer questions/objections, providing pricing, creating and submitting individualized quotes, negotiating and coordinating with manufacturing to ensure delivery of products, and closing the sales process through the point of order receipt. This individual works closely with Regional Account Managers and Sales Development Representatives to meet and exceed sales quotas for a specific territory. This is a home-based sales role located in a specific geography and requires minimal travel (10%); however, local travel to nearby customers is highly encouraged.Territory: APAC RegionEssential Functions:Drive strategic sales activities that result in consumable revenue at new and existing accounts.Engage with existing customers and generate new sales leads.Establish new customers in Academic and Biotech marketsMaintain/grow consumable revenue at existing customer accounts.Support Regional Account Managers with lead generation, customer follow-up, and developing/closing consumable opportunities.Initial point of contact for pre-sales customer inquiries and outbound prospecting.Manage trade show leads and their respective qualifications.Manage a consumables forecast and implement strategies to address any gaps to plan.Establish and nurture positive, productive relationships with customer accounts including product end-users, management and purchasing contacts.Work collaboratively with Marketing to drive product promotions and provide feedback on ROI.Maintain a CRM database via updates to sales opportunities, sales stages, marketing statuses, and customer intelligence data.Qualifications and Requirements (Education, Experience, Specific Skills):Bachelor's degree in a science or technical field required. Genetics, molecular biology, chemistry strongly preferred.MS. degree in molecular biology or a related field a strong plus.2-4 years of successful sales experience with a technical life science product preferred.Solid fundamental understanding of genetics.Demonstrated ability to quickly grasp and master highly technical concepts and articulate them well to others.Outstanding listening, verbal, presentation, and written communication skills.Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with a wide range of customer personality types. Ability to work well with highly educated research scientist customers.Strong ability to identify customer needs, obstacles to the sales process, and solutions using NanoString products.Proficient with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint)Experience working with Microsoft Dynamics or a similar CRM database a plus.Strong business sense, instinct, and personal drive.Team goal oriented with a focus on achieving team sales performance metrics through personal contribution and teamworkNanoString is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. NanoString does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that it does not have a signed agreement with.AccommodationsIf you require assistance or accommodation when applying for open positions please contact recruiting@nanostring.com#IND123 AND/OR #LI-MS1

description: Your roleAs a Refined Products Principal Analyst at IHS Markit’s Maritime & Trade business line, you will be responsible for playing a key role in developing and maintaining market intelligence and research flow for our Commodities @ Sea Refined Products analytics service that covers a range of markets including Diesel, Fuel Oil, Gasoline, Jet Fuel, LPG and Naphtha, etc. You will be part of a growing team which aims to deliver visibility for our clients into the dynamics of refined products trade flow intelligence, freight markets and the underlying physical trade in liquid bulk commodity markets.For this role, you will need to possess the ability to:Develop global supply and demand balance models for refined products by leveraging your strong understanding of the refining industry and margins, freight dynamics and trade routes and the supply and demand outlook for refined products.Deliver clear, concise and actionable analysis and insight through both prepared and improvised client-facing meetings (via web conferences, phone calls or in person) and through written analysis, commentary and interpretation of market events and developing trends.Support sales people and product managers in sales meetings by providing commercial, actionable insights to prospects and clients through live demonstrations that leverage your understanding of our suite of commodity analytics products.Collaborate with and advise our technical teams on ways to further improve our automated systems’ commodity voyage identification and classification rules and intervene directly when appropriate.Contribute to consulting projects for clients in the liquid bulk commodity and freight sectors as needed.The ideal candidate will also possess a superlative ability to infer the cargo type on a given vessel based on its observed behaviour and have a strong network of relationships across refined products supply chains and data source providers that could be leveraged to further support our product and program.Your teamYou will be working in the Maritime & Trade Research & Analytics team, which is part of a globally distributed group of analysts, data scientists and product managers. You will be based either in Singapore or Houston.Your colleagues are all earnest, capable, hard-working and collaborative professionals with years of experience working either directly in professional roles in industry or serving the industry through roles at information providers.We ask a lot of each other, deliver a lot to each other and our clients and take great pride in our work.Your expertiseYou have7-10 years of extensive work experience in the oil markets with specialist knowledge in refined products markets gained at oil majors, commodity or trading houses.Expert knowledge of market analysis, arbitrage and freight drivers based on strong understanding of macroeconomics.Strong comfort working with big data and possess the ability to quickly adapt to the use of new technology applications.Excellent communication skills and the ability to establish and maintain strong professional relationships both internal and external.You areAn eager team player who demonstrates a strong ownership mentality and independent initiative and who has a demonstrable history of working harmoniously with local and remote intercultural teams-IHS Markit is committed to providing equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the laws and regulations in any of our locations.We are proud to provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with IHS Markit and need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply for a position, please contact or call +1 212 849 0399. Determination on requests for reasonable accommodation are considered on a case-by-case basis. This contact information (email and phone) is intended for application assistance and accommodation requests only. We are unable to accept resumes or provide information about application status through the phone number or email address above. Resumes are only accepted through the online application process, and only qualified candidates will receive consideration and follow-up.IHS Markit maintains a substance-free workplace; employees may be asked to submit to a drug test (where permitted by law). In addition, as a federal contractor in the United States, the company participates in the E-Verify Program to confirm eligibility to work.For information please click on the following links:IHS Markit Business Code of ConductRight to WorkEEO is the LawEEO is the Law SupplementPay Transparency Statement-Current ColleaguesIf you are currently employed by IHS Markit, please apply internally via the Workday internal careers site.

title: Clinical Operations Lead
description: We are a team on a mission, to put accessible and affordable healthcare in the hands of every person on earth. Our mission is bold and ambitious, and it’s one that’s shared by our team who shares our values, to dream big, build fast and be brilliant.To achieve this, we’ve brought together one of the largest teams of scientists, clinicians, mathematicians and engineers to focus on combining the ever-growing computing power of machines, with the best medical expertise of humans, to create a comprehensive, immediate and personalized health service and make it universally available.At Babylon our people aren’t just part of a team, they’re part of something bigger. We’re a vibrant community of creative thinkers and doers, forging the way for a new generation of healthcare. We’re only as good as our people. So, finding the best people is everything to us.We serve millions, but we choose our people one at a time…At Babylon, we are a passionate, determined and cohesive group that consistently delivers premiumand innovative technology and healthcare. Our vision is to combine the latest technology with theknowledge and experience of the best doctors to make healthcare simpler, better, and moreaccessible and affordable for people everywhere. We believe in providing the highest value serviceexecuted in the smartest, most efficient way.As a Clinical Operations lead, you will work intimately with the clinical operational team and acrossmultiple technical teams to drive the strategy, programs, and processes to enable us to build the firstat scale digital general practice that can support millions of patients in Malaysia.The role will focus on both the supply side of our business and focus on clinician facing programs andprocesses as well as practice ‘back office’ processes.Responsibilities:You will manage a diverse range of projects and responsibilities from identification to implementationthat are focused on continually improving clinical operational processes and programs, redefining thehealthcare experience for our members, and expanding our available offerings and services. Focusareas may include:Improving the quality, availability, and utilization of our partner network and servicesOptimizing the appointment forecasting and scheduling processManaging our network of physical locations, partners and optimizing experience and utilizationManaging a team to facilitate high growth of our services while keeping the quality highRequirements:High performing work experience in startups, transformational business environments withhigh speed growth, strategy, operations, analytics, or a variety of other specialty roles withdemonstrated ability in quantitative fields.Experience in building a Customer Support function to scaleHighly analytical with a data-driven decision-making mentality, sound business judgment, andthe ability to back analysis up with deep analytical thinkingA strong balance of leadership and effective management skillsExperience planning, developing and growing the systems and processes to support acomplex logistical B2C services business containing elements of online, phone, video andface to face delivery to end usersEnthusiasm for end to end ownership of both strategy and operations for a critical businessfocus areaPrevious experience both delivering results individually and managing projects, programs, andteams.Ability to take initiative in a constantly-changing work environment and adopt a generalist do-what-it-takes mindset. You’re not afraid of getting your hands dirty and have a do-what-it-takes attitude to getting things done in the name of a better healthcare experience.Must also have strong interpersonal skills and work in a non-hierarchical manner acrossmultiple teams. You love people and working in teams. You are collaborative to a fault,understanding that none of us are successful unless all of us are.Excellent communication skills: client-facing and internal, written and verbalSolid organizational skills including attention to detailWe believe that difference inspires a better, healthier world. That’s why it’s at the heart of everything we do. From our people to our products, difference enriches every part of our business and creates a culture based on equality of opportunity, and in which all Babylonians can progress their careers. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things.Serving customers in over 100 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.Nokia is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion.At Nokia, employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.Key Responsibilities - As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future: Currently we are in the latter stages of a transformational journey from a traditional market research company to a trusted provider of prescriptive data analytics powered by innovative technology. This is only possible with extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. title: Data Science Advocate
description: About Neo4j:Neo4j is the leader in graph database technology. As the world’s most widely deployed graph database, we help global brands – including Comcast, NASA, UBS and Volvo – to reveal and predict how people, processes and systems are interrelated. Using this relationships-first approach, applications built using Neo4j tackle connected data challenges such as analytics and artificial intelligence, fraud detection, real-time recommendations and knowledge graphs. Find out more at neo4j.com.Our Vision:At Neo4j we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships between people, processes, locations and systems. We created, drive and are at the forefront of innovation in the Graph Database category; and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.Graph databases have grown over 1000% in the last ten years. The use of graphs in data science has also seen a strong adoption and growing interest. The problem is, there’s still a large portion of the data science community who is unfamiliar with when, why, and how to use graphs in their data science solutions. This person would be tackling this problem.Neo4j is the world’s leading graph database in the world and the Developer Relations team wants to find someone to help build awareness, knowledge, and understanding around graph data science to the overall data science community.This role will involve educating data scientists about the new opportunities, creating compelling content, and examples for data scientists who want to get started with the tools and techniques of a graph database.We’re looking for someone who:Has a background in data science and is comfortable taking projects from ideation, to model building, to communicating with stakeholders.Is curious and passionate about and wants to stay on top of all the cool things happening in the data science world.Has an interest in graphs and graph theory or is enthusiastic to learn about them.Loves teaching people and helping others.Can communicate complicated ideas in a simple way, both in written and spoken form.A fan of collaboration, especially with different types of tools and technologies. (especially in data-science related architecture).Is fluent in either Python and wouldn't be intimidated by having to write a small library to do a Neo4j integration.Responsibilities:Help the data science and related-communities better understand how, when, and why they should consider graphs. Your approach can be flexible if you find interesting opportunities to do this, but as a guideline, you can expect to:Write thought compelling content (blog posts, videos, etc.) showcasing graph data science solutions and how to combine Neo4j with other data science tools.Plan ways to collaborate with other types of technologies, tools, alongside graph to make more powerful solutions in data science.Work with industry partners / Neo4j users / companies / thought-leaders to help align their graph data science stories with trending topics and push their message to the data science community (advice or sharing opportunities that you discover for awareness).Present at industry conferences.The leading Graph Database Neo4j is extending its capabilities in the data science space with additional functionality for graph data science. Data scientists should be enabled to use contextual connected data to make better predictions and improve the accuracy of their models.Why Join Neo4j?We are one of the fastest growing startups in enterprise software in Silicon Valley, and this is an opportunity to lead and develop high-value strategic technology partnering relationships.For full-time employees we offer competitive salary, employer-paid benefits, generous paid family leave plans, catered lunches, a fully stocked kitchen, weekly activities, company off-sites, happy hours and the list goes on!Neo4j is a proud equal opportunity employer that fully supports a global mindset and workforce diversity. You will love your co-workers!Neo4j is a privately held company funded by Fidelity Growth Partners Europe, Sunstone Capital and Conor Venture Partners, Creandum, and is headquartered in San Mateo, CA, with offices in Sweden, UK, and Germany. For more information, please visit www.neo4j.com.Our Roots and Culture:Neo4j is a Silicon Valley company with a Swedish soul. We aim to hire smart, funny, creative and humble people who possess a lot of heart and drive. We value relationships (just like a graph!) and place trust in our colleagues to meet each day with focus and integrity.We foster collaboration and intellectually honest discussions for consensus decision making. Every Neo4j employee is empowered to contribute and put one's own innovative stamp on projects.Most of all, we are fanatical about graphs and creating an experience our users love.Intrigued by this role? We encourage you to apply even if you don't 100% fit the qualifications above.Neo4j is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. Please read the Privacy Notice Regarding Neo4j's Recruitment Process to understand how the personal data that you provide will be handled.
skills: ['Accuracy', 'Analytical', 'Architecture', 'Artificial Intelligence (AI)', 'Blogging', 'Collaboration', 'Communication', 'Data Science Tool', 'Decision Making', 'Enterprise Software', 'German', 'Graph Database', 'Graph Theory', 'Innovation', 'Privacy', 'Python', 'Recommendations AI', 'Video']

title: Senior Scientist I - Irrigated Rice Breeding
description: Working closely with in-country partners, IRRI develops improved rice varieties that yield more grain and better withstand pests and disease as well as flooding, drought, and other harmful effects of climate change. The main task of the Rice Breeding platform is to deliver on these key priorities guided by its OneRice breeding strategy in the areas of breeding for favorable environments, breeding for unfavorable environments, host plant resistance, quantitative genetics, and seed delivery systems. As the donor focus is shifting on increasing the efficiency, transparency of the breeding programs, this role will be crucial in increasing the impact and outreach of rice breeding, both at IRRI and with the national partners. This position will be responsible for delivering on existing important projects to ensure that continuity of future funding including proactive donor engagement.This position will be based at the IRRI Headquarters, Los Baños, Philippines and is open for international applications.Roles and ResponsibilitiesLead and develop rice breeding program and product delivery in prioritized market segments in line with target product conceptsConduct high quality research under changing rice production scenarios and develop necessary programs/strategiesIncrease the current rates of genetic gain using population breeding and recurrent selection approachLead contributions of a group of scientists and provide administrative support to its membersEnsure delivery of outcomes aligned with the IRRI’s vision, mission, values, target goals, policies and proceduresManage performance and mentor scientists and staff in the teamBuild and maintain partnership with internal, local and international collaborators and stakeholders towards resource mobilization for innovative researchCollaborate with governments, donors, rice R&D partners, private enterprises to align with client and donor expectations;Align with Platform and Cluster Leaders and Research Support to assure cross-Cluster synergy within IRRI’s Research groupMaintain and proactively develop networks & partnerships with various research teams including public and private entitiesConsistent delivery of improved varieties to replace older and obsolete mega-varieties for farmers in prioritized market segmentsDevelop and optimize breeding program using quantitative optimization in close collaboration with EiB and biometrics teamActively seek external funds and secure partnerships for research and development to meet program’s research needsPublish the important and relevant scientific findings in peer-reviewed journalsQualificationsAt least 8-10 years of post-PhD experience in Plant Breeding and Crop ImprovementSkills RequiredMandatoryModern breeding methods – rapid and data driven breeding & testing programQuantitative genetic theories and principalsperating in a matrix organization: proactive and effective communicationPlanning and execution of breeding programs at regional/global scaleManaging team with diverse skill sets, backgrounds and interpersonal skills at regional levelPreferredIndustry experience in managing a large/modern breeding/ varietal improvement and delivery program, molecular marker platform, budgeting and planning resourcesIRRI offers a highly extensive employee benefits package inclusive of globally-covered medical insurance, retirement plan, life and accident insurance and other allowances. Join our team and be part of our story!Please note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.This position will remain open until filled.

title: Jr. Scientist, Molecular Biology (1 Year Contract)
description: Why Thermo Fisher Scientific? Now is an exciting time to join our Genetic Sciences business. Here at Thermo Fisher Scientific, our industry leading scale means unparalleled commercial reach, unique customer access and a global footprint. Our broad customer base, from research to clinical to commercial production means you can have a broad and meaningful impact.All while working in an environment where you will be supported, valued and rewarded for your performance. Join the team with unmatched depth of capabilities and help our customers solve some of the world’s toughest challenges from the fight against COVID-19 to Zika to many others. How Will You Make an Impact? The Jr.Scientist, Molecular Biology will have responsibility in supporting scientific activities in the development of internal new product introductions (NPI). Housed within Thermo Fisher Scientific Singapore R&D, the successful candidate will provide technical support on a project level and will be expected to integrate into a dynamic and multidisciplinary team. The successful applicant is required to exhibit results-oriented attitude with the ability to thrive in the fast-paced environment of biotechnology. As part of the product development team, the candidate will possess the technical competency and professionalism in execution of activities and deliver detail-oriented quality results in order to meet project timelines and alignment with the business needs.What will you do? * Support development of qPCR and CE assays for new product introduction. * Execute experiments independently and analyze data set under guidance of senior group members and keep a detailed record of experiments. * Write procedures, protocols and reports.Exercise independent judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. * Recommend and execute changes to processes, procedures or products internally to the department. * May train and guide interns * Adhere to internal policies and procedures, as well as external quality standards. How will you get here?Education/Experience * Required - Bachelor’s degree in Biochemistry, Molecular Biology or similar Knowledge, Skills, Abilities * Good practical knowledge of molecular biology techniques. * Possess good laboratory and documentation practices. * Driven to deliver quality results on time and in a highly ethical and professional manner * Demonstrated resourcefulness, self-motivation, systematic and analytical thinking, directed toward achieving objectives. *GTSDouble
