title: Senior Director, Clinical Development
description: BeiGene continues to grow at a rapid pace with challenging and exciting opportunities for experienced professionals. When considering candidates, we look for scientific and business professionals who are highly motivated, collaborative, and most importantly, share our passionate interest in fighting cancer.General Description:The Senior Director, Clinical Development will support BeiGene Clinical and Medical assets by successful execution of clinical development programs and deliverables in partnership across the organization; with external vendors; and with external academicians and collaboration partners. The candidate will report to the Executive Director Global Clinical Development. As a leader in the organization, the incumbent will be involved clinical program strategy and help assure that activities are executed within expected scope, budget and timelines. The incumbent will play a key role the establishment and growth of Clinical Research functions to assure best-in-class global capabilities and execution. Specifically, the incumbent will work closely with colleagues in clinical development, program leadership, biometrics, clinical operations, safety/pharmacovigilance, regulatory, molecular diagnostics, and translational research.Essential Functions of the job:Facilitate generation of, author, update, and/or review key documents, including, but not limited to:Protocol concepts, synopses, protocols, and amendmentsInformed consent documentsInvestigator BrochuresClinical study reportsAbstracts, posters and manuscriptsClinical sections of INDs (and equivalent applications), NDAs (and equivalent applications), Annual Reports, and Developmental Safety Update ReportsClinical sections of Health Authority Briefing Documents, Orphan Drug applications, and annual reportsRisks / benefits analysis for applicable documentsClinical Development PlansPartner with clinical operations and other functional areas for the successful implementation and execution of clinical studiesProvide scientific expertise for selection of investigator and vendorsTrain BeiGene colleagues, CRO staff, and study site staff on the therapeutic area, molecule, and/or clinical protocolProvide scientific and medical support throughout conduct of a clinical trial; respond to clinical questions from sites, IRBs/IECs, Health Authorities, and CROsReview, query, and analyze clinical trial dataInterpret, and present clinical trial data both internally and externallyRepresent a clinical study or development program on one or more teams or sub-teamsCreate clinical study or program-related slide decks for internal and external useBuild and maintain opinion leader/investigator networks; organize and present at key opinion leader advisory boards and investigator meetingsContribute to or perform therapeutic area/indication research and competitor analysisBuild strong relationships with internal experts.Identify continuous process improvement opportunities.Identify incremental organizational resource needs – staff, budget, and systemsDevelop, track, execute and report on goals and objectivesSupport budget planning and managementBe accountable for compliant business practicesExperience Required:Minimum 12 years of experience within other biotech/pharmaceutical or relevant academic credentials companiesAdvanced degree (MD or MD equivalent) with sub specialty training in hematology/oncology (preferred)Previous participation in a clinical development program is essential, including involvement in all stages of clinical trials (i.e. from start up to study report), ideally having taken at least one study through from start to finish in a clinical scientist roleClinical oncology experience; candidates with exceptional experience in other therapeutic areas would be considered if they demonstrated clear potential to apply their existing skills to oncologyExpert understanding of global clinical study design and drug development process from discovery to registration and post-marketingHigh level of communication (written and verbal), interpersonal, organizational, and cross functional collaboration skills•Knowledge of GCP and ICH GuidelinesFlexibility to work with colleagues in a global setting•Able to engage in work-related travel approximately 25%Strategic leader with demonstrated success building, managing and developing individuals and teams is preferredExperience with the development and support of related SOPs and policies is expectedKnowledge of industry standard Clinical Development IT solutions expectedCapabilities and CompetenciesExecutive presenceValues based collaborator – respectful, accountable and collaborativeAbility to relate and work with a wide range of people to achieve resultsImpactful written and verbal scientific communicationSuccessful and superior influencing skills across all levels of the organization and external collaboratorsProblem solving and risk-mitigation skillsConfident, positive attitude, enthusiastic and charismaticAppreciation of diversity and multiculturalismStrategic and creative thinkerAbility to build working relations throughout the organization and with business partners to achieve business goalsStrong time management and organizational skillsAbility to manage multiple projects in a fast paced environmentSkilled in multiple computer-based tools, in addition to software programs such as MS OfficeEducation Required:MD, PharmD. or PhD. within a clinical and/or scientific profession (or an equivalent level of professional, clinical and/or scientific education, training and experience) requiredCompetencies:Ethics - Treats people with respect; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Shares expertise with others.Adaptability – Able to adapt to changes in the work environment. Manages competing demands. Changes approach or method to best fit the situation. Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and development areas; Pursues training and opportunities for growth; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality.Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully.Project Management - Communicates changes and progress; Completes projects on time and budget.We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. title: Senior Scientist I - Irrigated Rice Breeding
description: About IRRIThe International Rice Research Institute (IRRI) is the world’s premier research organization dedicated to reducing poverty and hunger through rice science; improving the health and welfare of rice farmers and consumers; and protecting the rice-growing environment for future generations. IRRI is an independent, nonprofit, research and educational institute, founded in 1960 by the Ford and Rockefeller foundations with support from the Philippine government. The institute, headquartered in Los Baños, Philippines, has offices in 17 rice-growing countries in Asia and Africa, and over 1,000 staff.Working with in-country partners, IRRI develops advanced rice varieties that yield more grain and better withstand pests and disease as well as flooding, drought, and other harmful effects of climate change.Job PurposeWorking closely with in-country partners, IRRI develops improved rice varieties that yield more grain and better withstand pests and disease as well as flooding, drought, and other harmful effects of climate change. The main task of the Rice Breeding platform is to deliver on these key priorities guided by its OneRice breeding strategy in the areas of breeding for favorable environments, breeding for unfavorable environments, host plant resistance, quantitative genetics, and seed delivery systems. As the donor focus is shifting on increasing the efficiency, transparency of the breeding programs, this role will be crucial in increasing the impact and outreach of rice breeding, both at IRRI and with the national partners. This position will be responsible for delivering on existing important projects to ensure that continuity of future funding including proactive donor engagement.This position will be based at the IRRI Headquarters, Los Baños, Philippines and is open for international applications.Roles and ResponsibilitiesLead and develop rice breeding program and product delivery in prioritized market segments in line with target product conceptsConduct high quality research under changing rice production scenarios and develop necessary programs/strategiesIncrease the current rates of genetic gain using population breeding and recurrent selection approachLead contributions of a group of scientists and provide administrative support to its membersEnsure delivery of outcomes aligned with the IRRI’s vision, mission, values, target goals, policies and proceduresManage performance and mentor scientists and staff in the teamBuild and maintain partnership with internal, local and international collaborators and stakeholders towards resource mobilization for innovative researchCollaborate with governments, donors, rice R&D partners, private enterprises to align with client and donor expectations;Align with Platform and Cluster Leaders and Research Support to assure cross-Cluster synergy within IRRI’s Research groupMaintain and proactively develop networks & partnerships with various research teams including public and private entitiesConsistent delivery of improved varieties to replace older and obsolete mega-varieties for farmers in prioritized market segmentsDevelop and optimize breeding program using quantitative optimization in close collaboration with EiB and biometrics teamActively seek external funds and secure partnerships for research and development to meet program’s research needsPublish the important and relevant scientific findings in peer-reviewed journalsQualificationsAt least 8-10 years of post-PhD experience in Plant Breeding and Crop ImprovementSkills RequiredMandatoryModern breeding methods – rapid and data driven breeding & testing programQuantitative genetic theories and principalsperating in a matrix organization: proactive and effective communicationPlanning and execution of breeding programs at regional/global scaleManaging team with diverse skill sets, backgrounds and interpersonal skills at regional levelPreferredIndustry experience in managing a large/modern breeding/ varietal improvement and delivery program, molecular marker platform, budgeting and planning resourcesIRRI offers a highly title: Scientist, Molecular Biology (1 year contract)
description: Why Thermo Fisher Scientific? Now is an exciting time to join our Genetic Sciences business. Here at Thermo Fisher Scientific, our industry leading scale means unparalleled commercial reach, unique customer access and a global footprint. Our broad customer base, from research to clinical to commercial production means you can have a broad and meaningful impact.All while working in an environment where you will be supported, valued and rewarded for your performance. Join the team with unmatched depth of capabilities and help our customers solve some of the world’s toughest challenges from the fight against COVID-19 to Zika to many others. How Will You Make an Impact? The Scientist, Molecular Biology, will take part in verification and validation activities of Molecular Diagnostic (MDx) assays both for RUO and IVD use.The successful candidate will provide technical expertise on a project and group level and will be expected to integrate into a dynamic and multidisciplinary team. The successful individual is required to exhibit a results oriented attitude with the ability to thrive in the fast paced environment of biotechnology and MDx. The Scientist will possess the technical capacity to develop experimental hypotheses, design and perform experiments, analyze data sets, and write protocols and reports. Furthermore, they will be expected to present their findings to the project team.Successful candidate will possess good practical knowledge of molecular biology techniques, such as PCR, qPCR, capillary electrophoresis, nucleic acid extraction, as well as proven track record of molecular tests development. What will you do? * Represents verification and validation function on a project team for molecular biology assays development (both RUO and IVD). * Personally conducts experiments using molecular biology methods (nucleic acid extraction, PCR, DNA sequencing, gel electrophoresis, etc.).Maintains accurate laboratory records and data. * Exercises independent judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. * Problem solving using knowledge of technical product details, design control and basic regulatory issues. * Designs and conducts experiments independently and writes procedures, protocols and reports.Manages and analyzes data sets using statistical tools. * May lead training and guidance of junior scientists; may review and approve junior scientist's work * Adheres to internal policies and procedures, as well as external quality standards. How will you get here? I.Education * Required – Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Molecular Biology, Chemistry, Biochemistry or similar with minimum 4 years of experience. Fresh Ph.D can apply. II. Experience * Extensive hands on experience with molecular biology methods.Experience with qPCR, CE and/or NGS MDx tests development for infectious diseases and/or oncology will be a benefit. * Experience with statistics packages, e.g. JMP, Minitab. III.Knowledge, Skills, Abilities * Able to design, plan and execute experiments for verification and validation testing. * Able to write test plan & report, design test matrix, develop test protocols. * Knowledge of IVD process for MDx and experienced at working at ISO 13485 will be a benefit. * Possess good laboratory and documentation practices.GTSDouble

title: Graduate Environmental Scientist
description: At Jacobs, we push the limits of what’s possible to make the world more connected and sustainable. For our site remediation group, that means using new technologies to make our environment better for today’s communities and tomorrow’s. Bring your creativity, collaborative spirit and extreme attention to detail, and we’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what drives you – so we can deliver extraordinary solutions for a better tomorrow, together.About the OpportunityWorking under the direction of the Environmental Project Manager and/or Senior Consultant, you will;Undertake fieldwork and travels to multiple locations within the country.As part of a dedicated team to conduct environmental field samplings for groundwater and soil at onshore oil & gas or industrial/commercial facilitiesInitially to perform field tasks following a mentor for several months, subsequently to work independently for simple field tasks and data collectionLiaise with laboratory for samples analysis and data reportingOrganize and analyze field and laboratory data to derive useful informationWrite and compile environmental site assessment reports or other technical reportsSupport project coordination and planning, project permitting with the authorities, communications with clients, suppliers and stakeholders, etc.About YouWe need young energized people with positive mindset who can understand and appreciate how they will fit into the bigger picture and support the project team undertaking environmental projects or other investigation tasks, ultimately leading to end to end and holistic solutions. Not only will you receive professional supervision, you’ll work in collaboration with other disciplines and acquire the knowledge and practical skills thru' “on-the-job learning.”With a Degree in Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering, Geology, Hydro Geology or Chemical EngineeringCandidates with up to three (3) years of similar experience will be consideredPreferably trained in HAZWOPER, local or oil & gas industry health & safetyWilling to perform hands-on fieldworkMore importantly we need people who areConfidentHaving a growth mindset and thirst for knowledgeResilient and problem solvingInnovativeAnalyticalAppreciate health and safety as culture and valuesJacobs. A world where you can.From our inclusive employee networks, to our positive mental health champions – we’re committed to driving a culture of caring where you can be you. Joining Jacobs not only connects you locally but globally - and together, our diverse perspectives and unique backgrounds power our collective strength. We collaborate and share! By supporting one another, we all succeed.With safety and flexibility always top of mind, we’ve gone beyond traditional ways of working so you have the support, means and space to maximize your potential. You’ll uncover flexible working arrangements, benefits and opportunities to do good too –from participating in our global giving and volunteering program, to exploring new and inventive ways to help our clients make the world a better place. No matter what drives you, you’ll discover how you can cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals – all at a single global company.Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.Please note: If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to Jacobs.#LI-JA1

title: R&D Optics Staff Engineer
description: Job Description :Job Description:Responsibilities:This is a R&D position within a dynamic and innovative technology development team, focusing on illumination source technologies required for next generations of wafer inspection and metrology equipment. The main responsibility of this position is to manage all aspects of optical module designs from evaluating initial specifications to validating performance of finished prototypes, including tasks listed below:As a critical part of Singapore team, work with scientists in USA to gain deep understanding of technology and engineering challenges of illumination sources, such as lasers and broadband plasma.Replicate the proven system from USA, run reliability tests and characteristic measurements and use the learnings towards a more robust design.Work closely with the systems group to develop the fundamental specifications of illumination system and drive down to requirements for optical design, with the consideration of desired system performance, achievable optics capability and other factors.Design lenses and optical subsystems in ZEMAX or equivalent optical modeling software, including lens elements, multi-lens systems, or other optical components, systems or subsystems. Conduct optical tolerance, aberration, stray light, and sensitivity analyses of optical designs, as necessary.Design and execute multi-disciplinary experiments, create detailed test plans and summary reports for system performance validation. Analyze experimental data and compare with simulation model for design correlation and optimization.Create and review specifications, concepts, and design documents throughout the development cycle.Be an effective communicator and team player while working with other engineering groups, such as laser systems engineer, mechanical design engineer and electric design engineer, to ensure flawless design, integration and test at the subsystem and system level.Requirements:Master's level degree in optics engineering or related with at least 8 years of experience orDoctorate (Academic) in optics engineering or related with at least 5 years of experienceExperience as a direct contributor in optical system design and tolerancing (in Zemax OpticStudio and/or CODE V) from concept to fieldable prototype or product.Must have experience of aligning, debugging and characterizing optical systems.Experience with beam shaping design is a plusExperience with thermal management in high power laser system is a plusMust be a good team playerAll Successful candidates can expect a very competitive remuneration package and a comprehensive range of benefits.Please email your resume in a detailed MS Word format to stating1) Current Drawn2) Expecting Salary3) Date Available4) Reason to Leave each job:We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notifiedJoyce Koh Ai LengPeople Profilers Pte Ltd,10 Anson Road #09-01/02 International PlazaSingapore 079903Tel: 6805 0868EA License Number: 02C4944EA Personnel Reg nos R1110618Job ID : 875V7V Salary Package:S$ 5,000 - 8,500 (Singapore Dollar)Job Description : Job Description: Responsibilities: This is a R&D position within a dynamic and innovative technology development team, focusing on illumination source technologies required for next generations of wafer inspection and metrology eq

title: Analytical Science Leader
description: Company Overview – Key FactsFMC is an agricultural sciences company that advances farming through innovative and sustainable crop protection technologies.From our industry leading discovery pipeline, to unique application systems, to modern biological products, we are passionate about bringing new solutions to growers around the world.For more than 130 years, we’ve been rooted in agriculture and innovation. Today’s FMC continues to earn the trust of growers and industry partners to maximize their productivity, profitability and sustainability.We are a company driven by innovation and committed to discovering new active ingredients, product formulations and application technologies.FMC provides innovative and cost-effective solutions to enhance crop yield and quality by controlling a broad spectrum of insects, weeds and disease, as well as in non-agricultural markets for pest control.Founded in 1883 and headquartered in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, the top-tier international agricultural sciences company has presence globally with over 6,400 employees across APAC, EMEA, Latin America and North America.FMC Corporation shares are listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: FMC).Company OverviewInclusiveLeadershipAccountableInnovativeAdaptiveStrategicFunctional or Technical Knowledge or SkillsFMC is guided by four core business principles:We discover and develop sustainable technology to solve evolving crop protection needs.We commit to exceed customer expectations through collaboration, speed and agility.We believe that doing business with us should be simple and easy.We operate with strict financial rigor for the benefit of our customers, employees and investors.Core Values:IntegritySafetySustainabilityRespect for PeopleAgilityCustomer-CentricityFMC & SustainabilityFMC’S NEW 2025/2030 SUSTAINABILITY GOALSWe have a commitment to deliver products that maintain a safe and secure food supply and to do so with minimal impact on the planet. To reflect this commitment, we have reset our sustainability goals to challenge ourselves and ensure that we are helping to create a better world.We are at a pivotal moment in history where the effects of climate change are threatening to disrupt global food production due to unpredictable weather patterns, rising sea levels and increasing global mean temperatures. These effects, if left unchecked, will have a long-term impact on our business, including unexpected disruptions in our supply chain, rapidly changing pest profiles and changes in geographies where crops can be grown.As we move forward with these new goals, we would like to note that FMC made excellent progress on the sustainability goals we initially set in 2015: we exceeded our innovation, safety, energy, waste and water targets.History & NowFMC's Spirit of Invention was born in 1883 when founder John Bean created an innovative insecticide spray pump to combat scale, an infestation that was ravaging California's orchards and endangering the livelihood of growers.Over the years, FMC has expanded internationally and diversified largely over the years. They have been innovating for over 130 years to meet global sustainable standards and client demands and expectations.FMC continues to earn the trust of growers and industry partners to maximize our productivity, profitability and sustainability.Global PresenceFMC has presence globally with over 6,400 employees across APAC, EMEA, Latin America and North America.FMC is a company with a long history of agricultural innovation and expertise behind it. Today’s FMC has succeeded in skillfully combining solid industry experience with modern business and environment values.FMC in APACFMC in Asia Pacific spans the Indian sub-continent, Australasia, Greater China, Japan, Korea and South East Asia. More than 2,000 employees across the region work together to realize our goal to be a leading ag-sciences company in Asia Pacific, bringing value to growers through differentiated, sustainable and innovative crop protection and nutrition solutions.The Asia Pacific regional headquarters is in Singapore, with an inclusive team that works together to bring value to growers across the region through differentiated, sustainable and innovative crop protection and nutrition solutions.With an Asia Pacific organization spread across 17 countries, you will be joining a truly diverse international team.As FMC strengthens its regional leading position in agricultural sciences with major investments in Singapore, they are looking further into gaining a foothold of the insecticide, herbicide and fungicide business across the APAC region.Singapore Tech Center (STC)As FMC strengthens its global leading position in agricultural science and innovation, they are looking further into sustainable development strategies across the APAC markets.The Singapore Tech Center (STC) serves as a pillar in the region for technology advancements in a global context.Advancing FMC to continue to grow as a Global leader within the sector.Role Purpose – Analytical Team LeaderDue to growth & expansion, FMC is looking to hire a seasoned professional who will be responsible for developing and leading a team of analytical scientists providing diverse analytical services required for R&D and technology improvement activities in a cross organizational environment. You will be reporting to directly to the Assoc. Director Singapore Technology Centre based in Singapore.Based in Singapore, you will work closely with global teams to build and manage a technical project portfolio, executing against strategies that drive business results.Highlights of the Position:Opportunity to be part of an organization with a robust growth agenda.Key strategic position to carve development for the region.Exciting opportunities to learn and grow within a dynamic, results-focused and growth-oriented international businessYour education and professional experience are valued and brought into use from day one. Your success at completing key initiatives can result in a varied, progressive and fulfilling career with FMC.Role Overview➢ The mission of the Singapore Tech Center is to provide process technology ensuring a long-term sustainable FMC business. This includes chemistry-and engineering improvement of current operation at commercial scale, as well as, development of new processes suitable for implementation at commercial scale in the Global FMC manufacturing network.➢ The overall responsibility of this role is to develop and lead a team of analytical professional supporting all Singapore Tech Centre activities and beyond. This includes coordination of support to (1) Process improvement- and development projects (2) Operations, in the format of standardization, trouble shooting, technology transfer and quality assurance processes, and (3) Initiatives through innovations of analytical techniques.➢ This role will coordinate, schedule, assist in and have responsibility for in-process control issues, raw material evaluations, process improvements and final product analytical methods. The Analytical Team Leader will also be responsible for building/maintaining relationships with multidisciplinary teams, internal and external to FMC. Moreover, driving the development of novel analytical tools and manage the data generation for initiatives is a key responsibility of this role. The scope of this position will include varying levels of support for manufacturing operations, R&D and environmental projects, process control requirements, product commercialization, renewal and maintenance of all analytical methods.Scope & Responsibilities As a member of the Singapore Tech Centre Leadership Team, actively participate in the development and execution of the strategy for the organizationCoordinate support to multiple, concurrent projects and prioritize work to efficiently allocate resources to meet organizational needs and commitmentsMonitor and evaluate team/team member performance to identify continuous improvement and development opportunities to meet current and future company needsAccountable for all aspects of FMC Safety Policies and Standards, including laboratory safety and industrial hygiene protocols are practiced throughout the team.Function as a Guardian for analytical techniques to provide a single point of contact for Operations, Global Tech pharmaceuticals, fine or specialty chemicals industry working with R&D and scale-up is required5 years of experience in developing and leading a cross functional team of technical staff deliver SPTS provides industry leading etch and deposition process technologies on a range of single wafer handling platforms. End-market applications include micro-electromechanical systems (MEMS), advanced packaging, LED, high speed RF device IC’s and power semiconductors. SPTS is part of KLA Corporation which develops industry-leading equipment and services that enable innovation throughout the electronics industry. We provide advanced process control and process-enabling solutions for manufacturing wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. In close collaboration with leading customers across the globe, our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers design solutions that move the world forward.Group/DivisionSPTS wafer processing solutions include market-leading silicon etch, dielectric etch, dry-release etch, PVD, PECVD and molecular vapor deposition (MVD®), available with a range of wafer-handling options applicable to R&D, pilot production, or volume production environments. SPTS is headquartered and has its main manufacturing facility in Newport, UK, with additional manufacturing in Allentown, Pennsylvania. title: Process Development & Improvement Engineer
description: Company Overview – Key FactsFMC is an agricultural sciences company that advances farming through innovative and sustainable crop protection technologies. From our industry leading discovery pipeline, to unique application systems, to modern biological products, we are passionate about bringing new solutions to growers around the world.For more than 130 years, we’ve been rooted in agriculture and innovation. Today’s FMC continues to earn the trust of growers and industry partners to maximize their productivity, profitability and sustainability.We are a company driven by innovation and committed to discovering new active ingredients, product formulations and application technologies.FMC provides innovative and cost-effective solutions to enhance crop yield and quality by controlling a broad spectrum of insects, weeds and disease, as well as in non-agricultural markets for pest control.Founded in 1883 and headquartered in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, the top-tier international agricultural sciences company has presence globally with over 6,400 employees across APAC, EMEA, Latin America and North America.FMC Corporation shares are listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: FMC).Company OverviewInclusiveLeadershipAccountableInnovativeAdaptiveStrategicFunctional or Technical Knowledge or SkillsFMC is guided by four core business principles:We discover and develop sustainable technology to solve evolving crop protection needs.We commit to exceed customer expectations through collaboration, speed and agility.We believe that doing business with us should be simple and easy.We operate with strict financial rigor for the benefit of our customers, employees and investors.Core Values:IntegritySafetySustainabilityRespect for PeopleAgilityCustomer-CentricityFMC & SustainabilityFMC’S NEW 2025/2030 SUSTAINABILITY GOALSWe have a commitment to deliver products that maintain a safe and secure food supply and to do so with minimal impact on the planet. To reflect this commitment, we have reset our sustainability goals to challenge ourselves and ensure that we are helping to create a better world.We are at a pivotal moment in history where the effects of climate change are threatening to disrupt global food production due to unpredictable weather patterns, rising sea levels and increasing global mean temperatures. These effects, if left unchecked, will have a long-term impact on our business, including unexpected disruptions in our supply chain, rapidly changing pest profiles and changes in geographies where crops can be grown.As we move forward with these new goals, we would like to note that FMC made excellent progress on the sustainability goals we initially set in 2015: we exceeded our innovation, safety, energy, waste and water targets.History & Now➢ FMC's Spirit of Invention was born in 1883 when founder John Bean created an innovative insecticide spray pump to combat scale, an infestation that was ravaging California's orchards and endangering the livelihood of growers.➢ Over the years, FMC has expanded internationally and diversified largely over the years. They have been innovating for over 130 years to meet global sustainable standards and client demands and expectations.➢ FMC continues to earn the trust of growers and industry partners to maximize our productivity, profitability and sustainability.Global PresenceFMC has presence globally with over 6,400 employees across APAC, EMEA, Latin America and North America.FMC is a company with a long history of agricultural innovation and expertise behind it. Today’s FMC has succeeded in skillfully combining solid industry experience with modern business and environment values.FMC in APAC➢ FMC in Asia Pacific spans the Indian sub-continent, Australasia, Greater China, Japan, Korea and South East Asia. More than 2,000 employees across the region work together to realize our goal to be a leading ag-sciences company in Asia Pacific, bringing value to growers through differentiated, sustainable and innovative crop protection and nutrition solutions.➢ The Asia Pacific regional headquarters is in Singapore, with an inclusive team that works together to bring value to growers across the region through differentiated, sustainable and innovative crop protection and nutrition solutions.➢ With an Asia Pacific organization spread across 17 countries, you will be joining a truly diverse international team.➢ As FMC strengthens its regional leading position in agricultural sciences with major investments in Singapore, they are looking further into gaining a foothold of the insecticide, herbicide and fungicide business across the APAC region.Singapore Tech Center (STC)As FMC strengthens its global leading position in agricultural science and innovation, they are looking further into sustainable development strategies across the global markets.The Singapore Tech Center (STC) serves as a pillar in the region for technology advancements in a global context.Advancing FMC to continue to grow as a Global leader within the sector.Role Purpose – Process Development & Improvement Engineer➢ Due to growth & expansion, FMC is looking to hire a seasoned professional who will be responsible for chemical process scale-up activities, as well as, operational engineering improvement initiatives, reporting directly to the Engineering Team Leader based in Singapore.➢ Based in Singapore, you will work closely with the Asia Pacific teams to build and execute chemistry engineering, analytical capabilities and strategies that drive business results.Highlights of the Position:✓ Opportunity to be part of an organization with a robust growth agenda.✓ Key strategic position to carve development for the region.✓ Exciting opportunities to learn and grow within a dynamic, results-focused and growth-oriented international business✓ Your education and professional experience are valued and brought into use from day one. Your success at completing key initiatives can result in a varied, progressive and fulfilling career with FMC.Role Overview➢ The mission of the Singapore Tech Center is to provide process technology ensuring a long-term sustainable FMC business. This includes chemistry-and engineering improvement of current operation at commercial scale, as well as, development of new processes suitable for implementation at commercial scale in the Global FMC manufacturing network.➢ This role requires chemical engineering knowledge, as well as, work experience in process development, pilot plant and commercial operations. The successful candidate will be able to conduct technical and economical assessments of existing operations, identify improvement opportunities, provide technology advancements and finally deliver implementation at plant level in combination with a cross organizational team. Similarly, The Process & Improvement Engineer will interface with the laboratory team and be responsible for technical feasibility guidance during early stage laboratory scale synthesis development. The role involves engineering support through all phases of process development, with responsibility from early stage ideation process through commercial scale launch.Scope & Responsibilities➢ Owns the scale-up process of laboratory scale chemical processes by design and installation/modification of pilot plant equipment that enables generation of process data suitable for process design. This includes all aspects of EHS and Process Safety Management➢ Design, direct, and coordinate work with external research partners to supplement internal experimental programs when required➢ Transfer technology from STC to manufacturing sites and provide technical troubleshooting support to OperationsEducation and Qualifications RequiredA mind that is stretched by new experiences can never go back to its old dimensions - Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.➢ MSc, Ph.D. or similar degree in Chemical Engineering➢ A minimum of 5 years of industrial experience in agro, pharmaceuticals, fine or specialty chemical industry with manufacturing and/or scale-up is required➢ In-depth knowledge of general engineering principles and practical experience with typical unit operation for chemical processing➢ Excellent hold on basic chemical engineering concepts and can utilize them to support cross functional teams in identification of improvement ideas➢ Basic understanding of organic chemistry➢ Experience and/or strong interest in interdisciplinary project work - Experience with project management is indeed a qualification➢ Strong interpersonal and communication skills to effectively communicate technical and non-technical information with global internal and external partners require➢ Expertise in process safety management and thermal hazards evaluation ideal➢ Flexible work schedules to accommodate different geographies required➢ Collaborate effectively with interdisciplinary teams of scientists in a global organization➢ Capture and maintain appropriate records and communicate effectively➢ Effectively develop and test hypotheses, as well as, determine the feasibility of a proposalNP348

title: Staff Optical R&D Engineer
description: Job Description :Job Description:Summary :This is a R&D position within a dynamic and innovative technology development team, focusing on illumination source technologies required for next generations of wafer inspection and metrology equipment.The main responsibility of this position is to manage all aspects of optical module designs from evaluating initial specifications to validating performance of finished prototypes, including tasks listed below:Responsibilities:As a critical part of Singapore team, work with scientists in US to gain deep understanding of technology and engineering challenges of illumination sources, such as lasers and broadband plasma. Replicate the proven system from US, run reliability tests and characteristic measurements and use the learnings towards a more robust design.Work closely with the systems group to develop the fundamental specifications of illumination system and drive down to requirements for optical design, with the consideration of desired system performance, achievable optics capability and other factors.Design lenses and optical subsystems in ZEMAX or equivalent optical modeling software, including lens elements, multi-lens systems, or other optical components, systems or subsystems. Conduct optical tolerance, aberration, stray light, and sensitivity analyses of optical designs, as necessary.Design and execute multi-disciplinary experiments, create detailed test plans and summary reports for system performance validation. Analyze experimental data and compare with simulation model for design correlation and optimization.Create and review specifications, concepts, and design documents throughout the development cycle.Be an effective communicator and team player while working with other engineering groups, such as laser systems engineer, mechanical design engineer and electric design engineer, to ensure flawless design, integration and test at the subsystem and system level.Requirements:Master's level degree in optics engineering or related with at least 8 years of experience orDoctorate (Academic) in optics engineering or related with at least 5 years of experienceExperience as a direct contributor in optical system design and tolerancing (in Zemax OpticStudio and/or CODE V) from concept to fieldable prototype or product.Must have experience of aligning, debugging and characterizing optical systems.Experience with beam shaping design is a plusExperience with thermal management in high power laser system is a plusMust be a good team playerAll Successful candidates can expect a very competitive remuneration package and a comprehensive range of benefits.Please email your resume in a detailed MS Word format to statingExpecting SalaryDate AvailableReason to Leave each job:We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notifiedJoyce Koh Ai LengPeople Profilers Pte Ltd,10 Anson Road #09-01/02 International PlazaSingapore 079903Tel: 6805 0868EA License Number: 02C4944EA Personnel Reg nos R1110618Job Id:6R3Y75Job Description : Job Description: Summary : This is a R&D position within a dynamic and innovative technology development team, focusing on illumination source technologies required for next generations of wafer inspection and metrology equipment.

title: Associate Scientist, Beauty Discovery & Delivery, Microbiology (Masters)
description: Overview of the jobProcter & Gamble has established the largest private research facility in Singapore in the heart of Biopolis, Singapore's Life Sciences Hub. Microbiology is one of the capability fields in the Singapore Innovation Centre.Do you want to lead laboratory operations, perform microbiological risk assessments and work on microbiology innovations and capabilities for application across our Beauty Care Product Development organization?If this sounds exciting to you, read on!Your teamYou will be part of Beauty Discovery and Delivery-Microbiology organization. An integral member of the team, you will work in a global & regional multi-functional team and engage with both internal and external partners.Key ResponsibilitiesYou will lead Microbiology work for current and upstream Beauty Care business initiatives including the following:Have ownership of the Beauty category product microbiology knowledge, including key technologies, methods and relevant external regulationsLead method development, screening and assessment of new chemistries, product types and formulations.Communicate results proactively to project teamLead lab operations and managed services both internally and externallyAble leverage or build Data/models from biological methods, process, predictionLead the Beauty Sector Pilot Plant Microbiology Risk Assessments (MRA), Microbiology Daily Management (MDM) and external Microbiology lab assessments. Over time, we expect that you will reach a qualification level required to lead the Pilot Plant Microbiology workAble to contribute to Microbiology credentialing and/or defense of microbiology data through partnerships with academic partners, industry associations, and/or Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs)Master's degree in Life Sciences (Microbiology, Biotechnology, Molecular Biology or other related fields)2 years' experience working in a Life Science (Microbiology) laboratory, managing GMP lab operations and performing quality assessmentsPassion for hands on experimentation work in the laboratoryStrong analytical skills, thought process and ability to interpret findings to share to multi-functional teamsExcellent judgement, creative thinking skills and a growth mindset. Ongoing capability building by the individual is expectedExcellent English communication skills. Proficiency in Mandarin with emphasis on technical communication skills both orally and in writing would be an advantage due to work related to the China marketAble to collaborate effectively and build positive relationships across a variety of partners within and outside the organizationA strong sense of ownership to develop and convey robust, microbiological risk assessments to project teams.About usWe produce globally recognized brands and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ariel®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Herbal Essences®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide.Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we're committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion and our ideal candidate is passionate about the same principle: you will join our daily effort of being "in touch" so we craft brands and products to improve the lives of the world's consumers now and in the future. We want you to inspire us with your unrivaled ideas.We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

title: Technical Applications Specialist II, Genetic Analysis
description: When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals. How will you make an impact? The Technical Applications Scientist is responsible for providing remote pre and post sales technical support of Thermo Fisher Scientific products to customers and field personnel, as well as relaying customer feedback to the organization.What will you do? * Provide technical support for Thermo Fisher Scientific Genetic Analysis products * Answer customer technical inquiries, primarily received by telephone and email * Provide timely technical advice with a view to immediate problem resolution * Utilize all available resources to resolve or escalate complex issues * Keep detailed records of customer interactions in appropriate systems * Remain up to date with product and workflow knowledge through continuous learning * Participate in creating, maintaining and improving technical documentation, website information and knowledge databases * Present internal technical training and updates and contribute to department meetings * Assist sales, marketing and support teams to present technical and product information during customer visits and events * Participate in additional projects, activities and duties as required * Some travel may be required for the position How will you get here? Education * Minimum Qualifications: B.S., B.A. or M.S.in life sciences or chemistry or a similar field. * Preferred Qualifications: PhD or a PhD. with post-doctoral experience. Experience * 3+ years of hands-on experience with Genetic Analysis applications including DNA sequencing, Real Time PCR, and/or Microarray technologies.Understanding of: * assay design, optimization and validation * sample preparation * instrument operation and troubleshooting * data analysis/software * Familiarity with data management, computer networking and bioinformatics * Experience with clinical applications is desirable * Prior experience in a customer service or support role is desirable * Knowledge, Skills, Abilities * Ability to quickly learn large amounts of new, complex technical information * Aptitude for problem solving * Ability to work effectively as part of a team * Positive and assertive attitude towards resolving stressful situations * Excellent oral and written communication skills * Ability to manage multiple priorities * Some weekend work will be required * A minimum two-year commitment to Technical Support is required due to the extensive up-front training needed to fully support our expansive product line.

title: Sales Operations & Enablement Manager - APAC
description: Job Title: Sales Operations & Enablement Manager - APACReporting To: Head of Sales Operations & Sales Enablement EMEA & APACDivision: Informa IntelligenceLocation: SingaporeInforma Intelligence provides market intelligence, news and analysis, bespoke consulting services, industry events and specialist online training to millions of customers worldwide through online platforms and multimedia subscription services. We provide businesses, professionals, academics, scientists and governments with information so they can act, and ultimately make valuable and profitable decisions.JOB PURPOSEAs the Sales Operations & Enablement Manager " APAC you must ensure the efficient and effective execution of Informa Intelligence's Order-to-Cash and Order-to-Fulfilment business processes, evidenced by timeliness and accuracy in Informa Intelligence's invoicing and product delivery to customers, and in its sales reporting to commercial leadership and senior management. Effectively manage the relationship with the Singapore Shared service centre ensuring sales spend little to no time resolving process related problems.You are responsible for ensuring all APAC Salesforce users are fully trained in all aspects of the CRM system so Salesforce's capabilities that maximise new business & renewal sales are fully utilised. Understanding the commercial goals of the business and ensuring training and Salesforce development is in place to support and exceed these goals.In combination your role ensures the optimisation of sales through each stage of the pipeline and then into post sale support through well understood and used, systems and processes.As part of Informa Intelligence's & Techs central Business Operations function the Sales Operations team acts as a service provider to the Informa Intelligence & Tech Verticals, ensuring the validity of sales contracts that are accepted by the business for revenue recognition and product fulfilment. In collaboration with Informa Intelligence's Client Services function and the Informa Group Shared Service Centres, the Sales Operations team ensures that the downstream order processes are executed and that any queries or changes are promptly and appropriately resolved.This will be achieved by:Contribute fully to the objectives of your team and achieve the personal objectives set by your company: J. Walter Thompson (S) Pte Ltd wundermanthompson.c...
description: Do you have a desire to better understand consumer behaviour? Are you someone with an innovative and logical mind who can think laterally? Are you able to dive deep into a variety of information and uncover insights that lead to a better view of the customer and what makes them tick? title: Associate Director, .NET Application Architect
description: Posting Description:We’re hiring!Aon is currently recruiting an Associate Director, .NET Application Architect to join our team in Singapore.About Aon's Center for Innovation & AnalyticsAon’s Centers for Innovation and Analytics in Dublin and Singapore are at the heart of delivering Aon’s Data & Analytic Services team’s mission to:accelerate the rate of innovation through digital solutions to help better respond to clients’ evolving needsprovide foundational data and analytics capabilities in one place for 50,000 Aon colleagues and our global clients who use our risk and people solutionsEstablished in 2012, there are over 100 colleagues in Singapore’s Centre today including actuaries, software developers, data scientists, financial analysts and accountants. We are expanding rapidly and looking for dedicated individuals who can leverage emerging technologies and collaborate across Aon’s solution lines to help clients and colleagues make better, data-driven decisions today and tomorrow.The OpportunityWe are seeking an Application Architect who is a team player and extremely keen in pushing themselves to learn new skills on the job or off the job. The right individual for this role will need to be heavily involved around the entire software application lifecycle from design to development. This person must be passionate about technologies and eager to push boundaries with respect to innovating and modernizing new/existing applications.This person will work with a team of highly experienced actuarial analysts, developers and business resources to build, maintain and improve web applications that span traditional n-tier architecture to new serverless models for delivering insights to our users with the rich data that we possess.As an Application Architect in the Singapore Aon Innovation Centre, you will be the expert that guides and supports the development teams in the areas of software design and development such that the solutions follow best practices to be maintainable, performant and scalable. You will have an opportunity to work with newer modern technologies as well as tried and tested traditional technologies. In addition to the flexibility given in applying new innovative ideas into proof of concepts, there are many opportunities in terms of growth from a soft skills perspective as well. This is a role that will be part of the talent growth strategy of Aon. Being successful in this role would lead to technical and people leadership opportunities in the future as well.ResponsibilitiesLead projects from a technical aspect by providing solution analysis, technical team coordination, design and development of new applications and enhancements to existing applicationsProvide application design expertise, technical direction, and assistance within the application development teamEnforce alignment to the application development strategy across the various teams to leverage synergies between projects and work itemsPropose, design and develop the foundation of an application during its inception that fits into the overall application development strategyAble to participate in hands-on development with the team during the development lifecycleProvide troubleshooting expertise to the development team when required for complex issuesPrepare technical documentation of application design and architecturePassionate in researching on new emerging technologies in support of application developmentefforts and make recommendationsAble to communicate clearly between technology teams and the business teams to ensure that the technical direction is aligned with the business requirementsConduct code reviews and sharing sessions with regards to best practices in application design and developmentRequirementsA bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related area is preferredMinimum 5 years’ experience as a full stack .NET developerMinimum 2 years' combined experience of web application development in AngularJS and AngularHas played a role as an application architect or the lead developer for a team through a couple of full application development lifecyclesExcellent knowledge in data structures, design patterns and algorithms.Has hands-on working knowledge in areas of application performance optimization and memory managementExtensive knowledge on areas of scalability, testability and maintainability.Expertise in CI/CD toolsets and modern build pipelinesExperience with progressive web applications, serverless development and distributed computing is an advantageHow to ApplyYour opportunity to empower results could start right here. Make your mark and apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.We Offer YouA competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.Our Colleague ExperienceEvery day, our colleagues make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. Together, we share this one purpose: to empower economic and human possibility around the world. This unifying goal is at the heart of our identity, and it lives in everything we do. To learn more about our colleague experience, visit Aon Colleague Experience.Aon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture where everyone feels valued and has opportunities for growth and development.

title: Assoc. Spclst, Service Delivery/Mgmt (IT Intern)
description: Job DescriptionOur CompanyFor more than a century, our Company has been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, it continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.Our Singapore IT HubEstablished in 2015, our Company’s Singapore IT Hub aims to harness digital solutions for better business outcomes. One of its key focuses is in using analytics and data science to guide better decision-making.Home to more than 300 employees with over 20 nationalities, the Singapore IT Hub is part of a global network, with sister hubs located in the United States and Czech Republic. In Singapore, the hub houses a wide span of IT capabilities teams ranging from Data Science, Software Engineering, Cybersecurity & Risk Management to Enterprise Platforms and many more. title: PCB Design Engineer
description: Company Description:Ampere is designing the future of hyperscale cloud and edge computing with the world’s first cloud native processor. Built for the cloud with a modern 64-bit Arm server-based architecture, Ampere gives customers the freedom to accelerate the delivery of all cloud computing applications. With industry-leading cloud performance, power efficiency and scalability, Ampere processors are tailored for the continued growth of cloud and edge computing.Our StoryLike the scientist behind its name, Ampere employees are innovators. We understand the needs of cloud computing and different software requirements. We are inventing what comes next and looking at everything from the structure of memory and how efficient the system is, to considerations on speed, cost of electricity and ability to cool. Power, size, weight and cost are driving the technology requirements and the innovation to come.Our world class team of engineers, with depth and expertise in the cloud and semiconductor industries, is not only focused on the development of new semiconductor designs but also building out the first software ecosystem for Arm®-based server processors. Through the Ampere approach to the cloud and edge, we give our customers the freedom to challenge the status quo and accelerate next-generation data centers for the most memory-intensive applications. Given the challenge we have outlined, we are building a culture of entrepreneurs that ensure customers come first, proactively approaching industry challenges in the areas of security, power and performance, delivering results that matter most.Job DescriptionAs PCB Designer, you will be responsible for a variety of high-speed PCB layouts for Chip validation, customer reference and layout review. You will work with design team to complete layouts with minimal supervision. You will work with Signal Integrity team to verify signal characteristics and optimize signal routing. You will create gerber data, fabrication and assembly drawings for manufacturing. You will interact with fabrication and assembly vendors to verify issues and keep projects on schedule.ResponsibilitiesWork with a team of engineers to perform component placement and Multi-Layer PCB routingBuild and maintain an Allegro Library database, create footprints.Talk to FAB house to design PCB stackupOptimize routing for high speed signals and plane for power delivery.Control QA processExport gerber date to FAB and Assembly houseQualifications2+ years of PCB layout experienceExperience with Cadence Allegro, and PADS PCB toolsExperience in all aspects of PCB design: footprinting, netlisting, constraint setup, placement, routing, and generating gerbersHave a deep understanding of High Density Interconnect PCB layout and PCB Signal IntegrityGeneral understanding of electronic circuits and chip functionality.Able to read and understand schematicsExpert in generation of Gerber image files, and knowledgeable with the CAM350 suite of tools and PCB fabrication processesExpert in the PCB layout process conforming to IPC standards and electrical and mechanical constraints of printed circuit board design, fabrication, and assemblyGood English communications skills, both verbal and writingEducation:BS/MS in Electronic Engineering/Computer Engineering or related discipline is required

title: Associate Scientist
description: Associate Scientist (Food Chemistry)Job description: Hoow Foods is a food technology startup focused on the development of products that serve to ameliorate the worsening metabolic disorder epidemic that Singapore and the world faces. We do this using a platform technology that allows for analysis of existing products and food chemistry-based substitution of ingredients.Hoow Foods is seeking to employ an Associate Scientist to assist in product development, ingredient characterization and contribute to research bolstering the in-house technology.Job Scope: 1. Participate in product development work involving various cooking and baking processes.2. Analyze food ingredients and products using in-house instruments, or at an off-site location.3. Project manage collaborations.4. Search for, read and summarise relevant literature articles.5. Set up and maintain a food ingredient database through collaboration with Data Scientists.6. Source for vendors and suppliers and maintain good working relationship with them.7. Maintain equipment, upkeep lab safety and inventory.8. Draft Standard Operating Procedures, Risk Analyses and other documents necessary for data integrity and traceability as well as lab safety.9. Attend conferences, seminars and exhibitions, either as a participant or as an exhibitor and organize logistics for such events where necessary.10. Participate in IP creation processes, such as drafting of patents and research papers.11. Participate in grant applications.12. Assist in the creation of posters and presentation decks.13. Assist in any other activities as required by the company.Requirements: 1. Bachelor’s Degree in Pharmacy, Food Science or Chemistry.2. Fresh graduates are welcome.3. Strong biochemistry and organic chemistry knowledge.4. Exposure to Final-Year Project or significant experience of wet lab work will be advantageous.5. Experience with conventional baking and cooking instruments and equipment.6. Experience with analytical instruments such as rheometers, viscometers, texture analyzers.7. Possess intellectual curiosity, able to take broad, loosely defined business needs and creatively identify precise, workable solutions.8. High level of initiative, keen interest to learn cross-disciplinary knowledge and skills and take on personal research projects.9. Good presentation skills with an ability to communicate difficult concepts in a comprehensible manner.10. High level of ability to multi-task and yet ensure quality of work on different projects.11. Able to work independently and in a team.12. Singapore citizenship is required.Job Types: Full-time, Contract, PermanentExperience:research: 1 year (Required)Education:Bachelor's or equivalent (Preferred)Work Remotely:No

title: Computer Scientist (IRP JPS)
company: CAMBRIDGE CENTRE FOR ADVANCED RESEARCH AND EDUCATI...
description: Who are we?We are the University of Cambridge presence in Singapore called Cambridge CARES, sponsored by the NRF CREATE program CAM.CREATE. The research programme Cambridge Centre for Carbon Reduction in Chemical Technology (C4T) is a joint Cambridge, NTU and NUS research activity within Cambridge CARES.Our team is comprised of world-class scientists and engineers working in a vibrant, fast-paced environment with great opportunities for knowledge and skills development.Who are we looking for?Urban growth is driving the need for sustainable operational models for city planning. Simultaneously, the proliferation of urban data has introduced a fragmentation into myriad types, formats, and qualities, hindering data integration into urban planning. The project aims to address one of the grand challenges in urban planning today: to connect and catalyse the unprecedented growth of cities and the exponential proliferation of data. The project will develop a Master-planning Knowledge Graph, transforming the conventional instrument of urban planning–the city master-plan–into a knowledge management system that supports cross-domain evaluations of planning proposals by enabling the integration of siloed data, software tools and Application Programming Interfaces from disparate knowledge domains. The overall goal is, using ideas from Smart Nation, Internet of Things, the Semantic Web, machine learning, and statistics, to create a system allowing planners to explore and compare more variations and more iterations for a particular development proposal, leading to improved master plans.The successful candidate will be expected to assume intellectual leadership in the development of the theoretical and mathematical foundations as well as the wider, ongoing development of our main software tool. This will involve keeping abreast of the latest web technologies, making key design decisions, and ensuring their realisation. Being part of a 2-member consortium will require close interaction with collaborators. Activities will include participating in research discussions with local industries and partners, overseas universities, and writing reports as required by the National Research Foundation (NRF) of Singapore.Other responsibilities include:Working closely with data-owners and domain experts to understand their problem statements and identify opportunities for data science solutions.Develop ideas for applications of research outcomes.Develop and/or modify ontologies and data models together with domain experts.Develop and/or apply description logics and reasoning for use cases.Big data handling, data extraction, analysis and integration.Performing programming and scripting utilizing various technologies.What skills do you have?A PhD degree in a relevant discipline such as mathematics, computer science, (theoretical) physics/chemistry, software engineering, or a related subject ideally involving semantic technologies and/or description logics.Excellent mathematical and programming skills.An understanding of the software development lifecycle and design patterns.Experienced in working with a diverse range of data types.Willingness and capable to acquire software skills and knowledge about modern technologies.Computational thinking with proven ability to conduct independent research and an outstanding publication record in at least one of the research areas concerned.Proactive problem solver with critical thinking and attention to details.Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.The ability to work as part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary team of researchers.What can we offer you?A stimulating working-environment with friendly, highly motivated colleagues.Opportunities to develop and implement new ideas in a creative environment.A competitive salary in line with your skills and experience.A one-year contract in the first instance, extendable following satisfactory performance.A comprehensive medical insurance cover as part of your employment.Please note this post is mainly based in the CREATE Tower at NUS University Town, Singapore and is likely to be suitable for recent graduates.How to apply?Please send your CV and cover letter (summarizing the most relevant skills and experience that you have for the position) to recruitment@cares.cam.ac.uk

title: Medical Scientist
company: Observational and Pragmatic Research Institute Pte...
description: We are currently seeking candidates to fill a Medical Scientist role.You will have the scope and capability to contribute to the development of our organisation’s medical quality improvement programs. The purpose of the role is to facilitate the translation of research data and quality improvement programs into clinical practice and improvement of patient care. The duties include assisting with drafting and reviewing documentation and publications, project coordination and liaison with project teams, as well as presentation to external stakeholders and conference participation.This is a fantastic opportunity to become involved in medical management and quality improvement projects with an internationally recognised research organisation involved in the analysis and dissemination of real-life research from large-scale observational studies and pragmatic randomised controlled trials.This role can be based in our UK (Cambridge or Norfolk), Singapore or Brisbane offices on a full or part time basis. For highly experienced individuals international remote working will be considered.Primary responsibilitiesTo contribute to medical quality improvement programsTo continually assess the benefit of our quality improvement programs to patients, and tailor the programs to maximise their real-life application in a clinical settingReview and contribute to scientific documents and publications (including proposals and reports)To independently develop ethics applications for projectsTo contribute to new and existing projects with respect to considering practical medical issues and clinical application; and to understand EMR data and coding systems and give guidance on the application of data to projectsReview and complete presentations, abstracts, and postersCommunication and liaison with internal team across various global locationsLiaison with study sponsors and steering committee expertsPresentations and calls with external stakeholdersParticipation and presentations at international medical / scientific conferencesQualificationsClinical background required, ideally a qualified medic. A post-graduate degree in Biological Sciences or respiratory nursing background would also be consideredMinimum of 3 years of clinical experience requiredClinical experience or scientific study in the field of respiratory medicine is an advantageExperience and Key SkillsMedical training and clinical background, with an interest in research and scientific studiesExperience of health research projectsExperience in scientific writing, publication of peer-review journal publications preferredClient relations, liaising with external parties internationally, strong leadership and presentation skillsExcellent written and verbal English communication skillsAbout Observational Pragmatic Research Institute (OPRI)At OPRI we focus on improving disease management and patient outcomes by undertaking the highest quality observational and pragmatic clinical research. Working here means being ambitious, thinking big and working together to make a difference. By collaborating with world-renowned clinical, academic and industry partners OPRI has published over 200 papers and is considered a dynamic and progressive company at the forefront of advances in global healthcare.Further information is available at www.opri.sg.Contract and SalaryStarting salary is dependent on qualifications and experience.Immediate start is available.Contact UsPlease send your CV with a covering letter summarising your suitability for the role to hr @opri.sg. Candidates will be required to undertake a remote skills test prior to interview.We look forward to hearing from you.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timeExperience:Clinical: 3 years (Preferred)Qualified Medic, Respiratory Nursing, Research: 3 years (Preferred)Education:Master's (Preferred)Location:Singapore (Preferred)Work eligibility status:Eligible to work in Singapore and do not need work sponsorship (Preferred)

title: Senior Scientist, Quantitative Biosciences
description: Join the world’s leading bio pharmaceutical company.Shape and drive scientific leadershipBe at the center of innovation and excellence in executionOur Quantitative Sciences team uses big data to analyze the safety and efficacy claims of our potential medical breakthroughs. We review the quality and reliability of clinical studies using deep scientific knowledge, statistical analysis and high-quality data to support decision making in clinical trials.OVERALL JOB PURPOSE:As a Senior Scientist and senior member of the Quantitative Biosciences group, you will provide scientific leadership and be responsible for the generation of data to enable quantitative and rigorous characterization of complex biological interactions at scale and to drive target identification/validation and hit-to-lead finding strategies as part of drug discovery programs.MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:Provide scientific leadership and expertise in biochemistry/biophysics or molecular/cellular pharmacology. Implements biochemical, cell based or patient-derived translational assays to generate data to support target identification/validation or molecular mechanism of action studies as part of hit-to-lead finding activities.Under general scientific and administrative direction, carry out independent research projects within function or across functional groups to develop and execute on research operating plans or new research and technology assessment proposals to advance novel therapeutic strategies and drug discovery efforts. Proactively pre-empt and respond to emerging project needs to align with business and functional strategy.Contribute to and help define and implement the Quantitative Biosciences research strategy aligned with company’s Research Laboratories drug discovery approaches and organizational objectives and serve as a resource for technical, pharmacological, biological and drug discovery expertise.Supervise, train and mentor junior scientists to ensure continuous performance improvement and development. Operate autonomously to draft research project proposals, reports, publications and other scientific communications related to research activities.Promotes the use of novel experimental approaches within own area including implementation of advanced laboratory equipment, design of robust scientific experiments and routinely investigates/creates innovative processes, hypotheses and methodologies. Participate as a technical specialist in cross-discipline project teams, sharing technical and biological knowledge across the functional area.Identify, lead or support collaborative initiatives with academic research institutes to further target identification or validation and lead finding approaches as part of drug discovery programs.Optimize technology to support scientific/business processes, ensure reliable documentation of experiments and results in electronic notebooks and other documents in compliance with company policies and project needs.Education Level:PhD in Life Science-related discipline or BSc/MSc with more than five years’ significant relevant independent research experience and proven track record of independent scientific achievement.Experience:Expertise in biochemistry/biophysics/chemistry or molecular/cellular pharmacology with demonstrated experience in assay development and methodologies supporting target identification or validation, mechanism of action studies or hit-to-lead-finding activities.Extensive experience in state-of-the-art technologies such as LCMS, fluorescence-based techniques, SPR, calorimetry, fluorescent- or cell-based or high-content imaging, binding or reporter assays or scintillation proximity assays with demonstrated ability to perform detailed mechanistic studies.Ability to identify, evaluate and integrate new technologies to expand capabilities.Demonstrated capability to develop and implement innovative ideas that yield significant programmatic/process impact.Excellent data analysis and trouble-shooting skills expected. Highly collaborative yet independent scientist that excels in a matrix environment.Excellent interpersonal, collaborative and communication skills expected.Who we are:Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as “Merck” in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. title: Scientist
