title: #SGUnitedJobs Scientist III / Senior Scientist I (Mechatronics), SIMTech
description: The mission of the Mechatronics group in the Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology (SIMTech) is to provide key technologies and expertise for the development of robotics and automation systems. The main research and competencies areas include mechanism design and analysis, thermomechanical modeling, actuator design, real time control design, software architecture design, and artificial intelligence. The mechatronics group consists of four teams focusing on research in robot manipulation, mobile robotics, actuation and control as well as design and simulation.The robot manipulation section works on research and technology development in new robotic mechanisms and intelligence including force control end-effector modules, adaptive grippers and AI for material handling.The mobile robotics section works on development of scalable reconfigurable mobility platform technologies to achieve mobile robot building blocks to quickly customize and synthesize task optimized mobile robots.The actuation and control section works on technology development in data driven auto tuning for precision machines, using artificial intelligence approaches to improve control performance as well as new motors and drives.The design and simulation section works on technology development in automation methodologies, electromagnetic, thermos fluid & vibration analysis, virtual prototyping & system design optimization as well as multi-physics modelling & simulation.SIMTech , a research institute under the Agency for Science Technology and Research (A*STAR) , is inviting applications for Senior Research Scientist/Section Manager position in the following areas:Design for novel robotic modules and systemsAutonomous mobile robotsAdaptive gripper designAI for robot handling, planning and controlResponsibilitiesIdentify strategic projects, opportunities and propose technical roadmap aligned with business and customer requirementsRecognized as a technical expert in research domain and able to influence across teams/divisions to deliver technicallyKeeps informed about cutting-edge technology within specific technical area to envision future innovation in technology roadmapLead major initiatives/programmes/projects to advance the technology and/or industry applicationsRequired BackgroundPhD degree in mechanical/electrical/electronics engineering or computer science.Minimum 5 years’ experience in executing and/or managing R&D projects in roboticsProactive team player and technically motivated to solve problems, innovate and deliver to internal and external customersGood interpersonal and communication skillsKnowledge and experience in development of robot grippers / end effectors for industrial applications or mobile robotics is preferred.The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.EY Forensic & Integrity Services practice help organizations protect and restore enterprise and financial reputation. Our professionals assist companies and their legal counsel to investigate facts, resolve disputes and manage regulatory challenges. We put integrity at the heart of compliance programs to help better manage ethical and reputational risks. title: Process Scientist - Viral Clearance
description: A career with Merck is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 50,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in healthcare, life science and performance materials. For 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others.WHO WE ARE:Merck is a leading science and technology company. Its life science business offers a broad range of innovative products and services to biotech and pharmaceutical drug therapies businesses. Through dedicated collaboration with the scientific and engineering communities, and as one of the top three R&D investors in the life science tools industry, the brand serves as a strategic partner to customers and helps advance the promise of life science.YOUR ROLE:As Scientist – Viral Clearance you will design and deliver Viral Clearance validation studies for biopharmaceutical companies across the APAC region. Within the Merck Process Solutions Services team, you will have scientific expertise in Viral Clearance with in-depth understanding of biopharma downstream processing (chromatography, virus filtration and low pH/chemical inactivation) and virology. You will ensure projects are carried out with the appropriate scientific and regulatory compliance oversight and you will provide technical expertise during client meetings, lead technology transfer of client processes, oversee the generation of batch records, coordinate execution of scale-down process in the lab and lead technical trouble shooting and investigations. You will also have the technical expertise to advice and support GLP / GMP operations and audits, and you will maintain an in-depth understanding of Merck BioReliance services and technical principles as well as advances in the field. The ability to maintain effective working relationships with clients (external) and development services, project management, quality, sales and laboratory personnel (internal) will be critical for success in the role.The post holder will be able to perform the following functions.Brief role description:Acts as Process Scientist for viral clearance studies and holds responsibility for process aspects of client studies, including collection of client process information, generation of process records and Akta methods, client communication of results, resolving process issues and ensuring on time delivery of complete clearance studiesWorks within the viral clearance laboratory providing hands-on support, training and guidance to laboratory based personnel in the areas of process science, chromatography, virus filtrations and lab-scale downstream modelsEffectively collaborates with study management, testing lab functions, quality and PMO to ensure routine and complex client studies are completed on time, to the appropriate scientific and regulatory standardsPlans and designs the execution strategy to successfully transfer client processes into the BioReliance laboratories according to the client’s technical documentation and SOP’sPrepares high quality client process specific protocols and methods for the performance of chromatography, inactivation and filtration stepsLeads by example, acts as subject matter expert, offers scientific coaching and mentoring to other staff membersResponds to audit observations through the BioReliance Integrated Quality System (Trackwise)Raises and progresses deviation and Corrective or Preventative Action (CAPA) records in a timely mannerDesigns, directs and leads complex projects related to area of operational expertiseWrites protocols, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and workbooks for projects and implements Change Control for new service introductionWrites and approves safety and quality risk assessments as and when requiredLeads process improvements within the laboratory to improve quality and performanceActs as process science and technical consultant to support departmental investigations, client process queries, supplier audits and client/regulatory inspectionsEnsures a safe and healthy work environment at all times by not only complying with but actively embracing health and safety policies and procedures to ensure the welfare and safety of self and others within the workplaceThe above list of job duties is not exclusive or exhaustive and the post holder will be required to undertake such tasks as may reasonably be expected within the scope of the post.WHO YOU ARE:Education:Master degree in Chemical Engineering, Biological Sciences or higher degree in related scientific subjectExperience:Minimum 8 years of experience in a scientific laboratory roleMinimum 2 years of experience in a regulated environment (GLP/GMP) preferredDemonstrable scientific understanding in downstream bioprocessing (filtration and chromatography)Hands-on experience with Akta Pure/Avant systemsPrior experience in any of the following areas will be desirable:Prior experience in a regulated environment (GLP/GMP)Prior experience in MSAT or Process Development (protein purification) in a biopharmaceutical company or related industryExperience of working in Biosafety Level 2 laboratoryKnowledge & Skills:Computer literacy and entry of data into databases (LIMS, ELN, SAP, etc.)Ability to complete documentation (both handwritten and electronic) neatly and accuratelyTrain the trainerEnglish fluency in speaking and writing. Practical knowledge of Japanese and/or Korean is a plus.Core competencies:Organization skillsDemonstrates customer centricityThrough effective communication, provides the information people need to know to do their jobsHas strong organizational skills with the ability to use available resources effectivelyProblem solving and driveCan learn new skills and acquire knowledge rapidlyUses logic to solve complex problems and can troubleshoot effectivelyIs self-motivated and action-orientated, determined to provide best-in-class service and seizes more opportunities than othersPursues everything with energy, drive and the need to finish, especially in the face of resistance or setbacksCan be counted on to achieve goals, constantly and consistently, pushes self and others for resultsProfessional and technical skillsHas the functional and technical knowledge and skills to do the job at a high level of accomplishmentShows sound judgment in decision makingComes up with new and unique ideas and adds value in brainstorming settingsDeals effectively with pressure; remains optimistic and persistent, even under adversityPuts safety first by adhering to health and safety procedures and actively takes necessary action when encountering unsafe situationsPersonal and interpersonal skillsRelates well to all kinds of people in the organization, builds constructive and effective relationships using diplomacy and tactIs seen as a team player, cooperative and encourages collaborationCommunicates effectively with others and handles conflict effectivelyThe ability to maintain effective working relationships with lab personnel, global and internal stakeholders will be critical for success in the roleADDITIONAL LOCAL NEEDSAbility to work overtime or flexible shifts from time to time to cover testing requirementsJob Requisition ID: 211555Location: SingaporeCareer Level: D - Professional (4-9 years)Working time model: full-timeCareers during Covid-19Thank you for visiting our careers website, we are always looking for curious minds to join our teams. We understand how much the world is being impacted by the Covid-19 crisis and we want to assure you that your safety is very important to us. To ensure that everyone’s health is protected, instead of a standard face-to-face interview, it is likely that you will be offered alternative digital interview options.US DisclosureThe Company is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. No employee or applicant for employment will be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, gender identity, transgender status, marital status, or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. This policy of Equal Employment Opportunity applies to all policies and programs relating to recruitment and hiring, promotion, compensation, benefits, discipline, termination, and all other terms and conditions of employment. Any applicant or employee who believes they have been discriminated against by the Company or anyone acting on behalf of the Company must report any concerns to their Human Resources Business Partner, Legal, or Compliance immediately. The Company will not retaliate against any individual because they made a good faith report of discrimination.North America DisclosureThe Company is committed to accessibility in its workplaces, including during the job application process. Applicants who may require accommodation during the application process should speak with our HR Services team at 855 444 5678 from 8:00am to 5:30pm ET Monday through Friday.

title: Research Assistant
description: The successful candidate will work with A/Prof Victor Yu to study the key signalling mechanisms of MOAP-1 in aging.A) Competencies/Exposure the trainee will learn in this programme include: -Cell culture technique for growing mammalian cell lines.Basic molecular biology techniques, including PCR, quantitative RT-PCR and immunofluorescence/immunohistochemistry.Data analysis using commonly used softwares such as GraphPad Prism and ImageJ.Multi-tasking and effective time management skills in a multi-disciplinary team interacting with basic science and clinical scientists.B) Specific Responsibilities of the trainee include: -Providing administrative support to project, including writing procedures, protocols and reports.Conducting experiments involving basic laboratory techniques such as PCR, quantitative RT-PC, western blot and immunofluorescence/immunohistochemistry.Executing general laboratory duties related to housekeeping and laboratory safety.To facilitate a better understanding of the work being pursued in the laboratory, prospective applicants are urged to refer to the following papers published by the laboratory: -K.O. Tan et al., MAP-1 is a mitochondrial effector of Bax, (Track II), Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. USA, 102: 14623-14688, 2005.N.Y. Fu et al., Inhibition of ubiquitin-mediated degradation of MOAP-1 by apoptotic stimuli promotes Bax function in mitochondria, (Track II), Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. USA, 104: 10051-10056, 2007.N.Y. Fu et al., Baxβ: a constitutively active human Bax isoform that is under tight regulatory control by the proteasomal degradation mechanism, Molecular Cell, 33: 15-29, 2009.S.K. Sukumaran et al., A soluble form of the pilus protein FimA targets the VDAC-hexokinase complex at mitochondria to inhibit host cell apoptosis, Molecular Cell, 37: 768-783, 2010.C.T. Tan et al., MOAP-1 Mediates Fas-Induced Apoptosis in Liver by Facilitating tBid Recruitment to Mitochondria, Cell Reports, 16:174-85, 2016.QualificationsBachelor Degree in Science.Skills:Strong ability to work in a team setting.Effective oral and written communication skills.Proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel.Punctual and good time management skill.Self-motivated.Experience:Prior experience in working in a research lab setting in life sciences will be given priority in the selection process.Job: ResearchPrimary Location: Kent RidgeOrganization: PharmacySchedule: Full-time - Fixed Term (Contract)Job Posting: 30/10/2020, 4:47:02 AM:

title: HR Business Partner, APAC (Singapore)
description: At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us. It is a commitment. This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have the potential to change the world.We enable scientists to advance their research, allowing them to address scientific questions they did not even know they could ask. Our tools have enabled fundamental discoveries across multiple application areas, including cancer, immunology, and neuroscience.Our teams are empowered and encouraged to follow their passions, pursue new ideas, and perform at their best in an inclusive and dynamic environment. We know that behind every scientific breakthrough, there is a deep infrastructure of talented individuals driving the life sciences industry and making it possible for scientists, engineers, clinicians, computational biologists, and more to make new strides. We are dedicated to finding the best person for every aspect of our work because the innovations and discoveries that we enable together will lead to better technologies, better treatments, and a better future. Find out how you can make a 10x difference.HR Manager (HR Business Partner) - APAC Region (Singapore)About the Role:Our dedicated and passionate HR team paves the way for the organization to own the culture, live true to our values, and drive the execution of our vision. Our company is in high growth mode due to our successes, and as such we have a newly created position for an HR Manager/Business Partner (HRBP) to engage with our managers and teams to ensure that we provide an exceptional employee experience for our employees based in the Asia Pacific region supporting both Commercial, Operations and Manufacturing.Individuals applying for this position must be self-starters, strategic thinkers, action-driven, flexible to change direction and bring creative approaches to HR solutions on a regular basis, thrive in a fast-paced environment, excel at managing multiple priorities and projects concurrently, succeed in communicating with all levels and across multiple countries within the organization and make an immediate contribution. Expertise and knowledge of multiple country-specific employment practices, benefits, immigration requirements related to Asia Pacific is required.The role is based at our Singapore location and will be required to come on-site on a regular basis to meet with the leaders and employees. The position will report directly to the Sr. Director, HR, and will be part of the growing global HRBP team in addition to the Commercial and Operations regional leadership teams. Flexibility related to working hours across multiple time zones will be required. There will not be relocation offered.What you will be doing:Ability to execute employee programs and proactively meet with employees, leaders, global HR partners to create and implement global process' and programs on culture, diversity and inclusion, employee engagement and experience, employee roundtables, employee development (training and career development), administration of time and absence tracking, compensation, benefits enrollment and partnership with our local brokers, performance management, employee onboarding and assimilation and immigration for the region.Business Partner to the leaders and employees based in Asia for Commercial and Operations, a key HR point of contact for the Singapore site and APAC region, thought partner and sounding board.Manage the alignment between functional, regional and site initiatives and ensure successful execution.Consult, advise, coach and partner with the business on people and organizational needs.Program manage all areas of leadership coaching, employee relations consultation, program/project management key HR projects, team facilitation and employee communication for the site and region.Identify talent and proactively address issues before they affect the business.Identify and provide recommendations on any local practices for compliance of all HR practices within the region with regard to employment legislative and regulatory requirements, standards, and other known relevant policies and guidelines for each of the countries we do business in.Act as a trusted advisor to managers and employees.Manage all administrative and operational aspects of all HR processes, including partnering closely with our benefits brokers, local governments, payroll, legal and finance partners for the region.To be successful, you will need:University degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, Organizational Development or related field required, advanced degree (Masters) preferred.6-8 years demonstrated skills and experience in a Human Resources Business Partner role with experience in a fast-paced high-growth organization, preferable in either technology, biotech or life sciences.Current and strong working knowledge of all the country-specific employment laws and practices within the APAC region.Focus and demonstrate a passion to create an exceptional employee experience. Actively engaged in a proactive and engaging way to inspire and build trust with our employees and leaders on a global basis.Engage with all centers of excellence in HR to ensure that we can hire, develop and retain the "best of the best" and maintain our talent bar.Expertise in working with data analytics and reporting to draw actionable insights on the talent within their respective organizations and partner with leaders to influence change.Ability to execute and focus independently and on a team to achieve results in a timely manner.Work strategically and proactively with our global leaders on employee relations, recruitment, talent management, compensation, development, employee engagement and culture, and all HR programs.Care deeply about our employee's wellbeing and morale (office environment, perquisites) to allow 10x to drive high performance, innovation and a strong sense of community and safety.Business acumen and belief in our mission.#LI-LN1About 10x Genomics10x Genomics (NASDAQ: TXG) is building tools for scientific discovery that reveal and address the true complexities of biology and disease. Through a combination of novel microfluidics, chemistry, and bioinformatics, our technology is enabling researchers around the world to more fully understand the mechanisms behind cancer, the immune system, and the fundamentals of biology at the single-cell level. 10x is one of the fastest-growing biotech companies of the decade, growing from $3M in revenue in 2015 to over $200M in 2019, and has backed over 500 scientific publications in the past four years. For more information, visit www.10xgenomics.com.10x Genomics is headquartered in Pleasanton, with an office by Embarcadero BART in San Francisco.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.For more information, please contact jobs@10xgenomics.com or submit your resume at http://www.10xgenomics.com/careers/

title: Technical Applications Specialist III, Genetic Analysis
description: Thermo Fisher Scientific’s Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer, and the global coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak is a powerful reminder of the importance of that Mission. In fact, Thermo Fisher is at the forefront of the global response to COVID-19. We are working with governments, agencies, industry partners and researchers globally to ensure priority access to instruments, consumables, safety supplies and other products to address the outbreak. Our efforts have been particularly focused in supporting analysis of the virus, diagnosis, personal protection, and ultimately helping in the development of new therapeutics and vaccines.How will you make an impact?The Technical Applications Scientist is responsible for providing remote pre and post sales technical support of Thermo Fisher Scientific products to customers and field personnel, as well as relaying customer feedback to the organization.What will you do?Provide technical support for Thermo Fisher Scientific Genetic Analysis productsAnswer customer technical inquiries, primarily received by telephone and emailProvide timely technical advice with a view to immediate problem resolutionUtilize all available resources to resolve or escalate complex issuesKeep detailed records of customer interactions in appropriate systemsRemain up to date with product and workflow knowledge through continuous learningParticipate in creating, maintaining and improving technical documentation, website information and knowledge databasesPresent internal technical training and updates and contribute to department meetingsAssist sales, marketing and support teams to present technical and product informationduring customer visits and eventsParticipate in additional projects, activities and duties as requiredSome travel may be required for the positionWeekend work will be required to support customers across the globeHow will you get here?EducationMinimum Qualifications: B.S., B.A. or M.S. in life sciences or chemistry or a similar field.Preferred Qualifications: PhD or a PhD. with post-doctoral experience.Experience3+ years of hands-on experience with Genetic Analysis applications including DNAsequencing, Real Time PCR, and/or Microarray technologies. Understanding of:assay design, optimization and validationsample preparationinstrument operation and troubleshootingdata analysis/softwareFamiliarity with data management, computer networking and bioinformaticsExperience with clinical applications is desirablePrior experience in a customer service or support role is desirableKnowledge, Skills, AbilitiesAbility to quickly learn large amounts of new, complex technical informationAptitude for problem solvingAbility to work effectively as part of a teamPositive and assertive attitude towards resolving stressful situationsExcellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to manage multiple prioritiesSome weekend work will be requiredA minimum two-year commitment to Technical Support is required due to the extensiveup-front training needed to fully support our expansive product line.GTSDouble

title: Digital Account Manager
description: Department OverviewIn FALCON, we do not subscribe to the traditional mould of account management. Our account management team are part scientist, part entrepreneur and part artist. You need to become a business partner to the clients, anticipating their business needs and leading the conversations with them. You need to be creative, understand and use data, and have the skills to grow your account and manage campaigns and projects with both internal and external stakeholders.RoleRoleAs a Digital Account Manager, you will be leading and managing clients and campaigns, and be involved in new business pitches. You will handle a wide range of assignments, projects and clients with a high degree of success and independence. You will also provide internal leadership, and report to the Account Director to plan, oversee and execute multi-channel campaigns for several clients.The ResponsibilitiesResponsibilitiesBe the point of contact for all client requests and day-to-day handling of clients and campaigns, ensuring that briefs are met with quality and timeliness.Work with creative, production and digital marketing teams on required deliverables, and manage client expectations by identifying and delivering the best possible digital solutions and client service level. Ensure quality of all works before delivery to clients.Maintain timeline and ensure delivery for key milestones including presentations, approvals and production.Work collaboratively with the internal/external/remote teams to execute campaigns.Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with clients and internal teams.Manage campaign execution to ensure overall strategy is on-point.Ensure high-quality work that is also delivered on budget and on time and manage vendors and invoicing.Build enduring relationship with clients and inspire client confidence in the Agency.Support the New Business Director in pitches and new accounts where required.Identify and pursue growth opportunities and up-sell potentials within existing client base.The RequirementsRequirementsMinimum 3 years of proven digital account management experience in an advertising, media and/or marketing environment.Possesses a good command of English. Ability to speak, read and write other languages is a plus.Proven ability in managing and executing multi-channel social media campaigns is a must, with a solid understanding of content creation, social media analytics and social media buying.Experience in email marketing, search marketing and digital media, including key marketing channels and tools like Facebook, Google Analytics and AdWords etc will be plus points.Experience working on local and regional accounts. Having worked on global MNC accounts would be a plus.Proven ability to solve business challenges creatively and effectively via technology, communication, and marketing.Able to prioritise and efficiently work under pressure, and on tight deadlines while coping with the requirements of a fast-moving environment.Detail-oriented and result-driven team player with an inquisitive mind-set and can-do attitude.Able to prepare decks and confidently present to clients.Is an excellent team player and demonstrates a high level of integrity in his/her approach to work and with all stakeholders ie colleagues, clients and partners/vendors.Able to communicate effectively and confidently, and work with all stakeholders ie colleagues, clients and partners/vendors.Able to ensure smooth day-to-day operation of projects with minimal supervision.Demonstrates leadership qualities, has a solution-first attitude, and is eager-to-learn and willing to pitch in on anything.Be perceived as dependable, with a potential to lead junior team members.

title: Senior Engineer
description: Curiox Biosystems is an exciting and innovative Life Science technology company growing rapidly. Curiox manufactures and sells instruments, automation products, and disposables for cell and protein analysis. The major application of Curiox Laminar Wash™ systems is centrifuge-free sample preparation of cells for Flow Cytometry, Single Cell Genomics, and other emerging cell analysis applications. The Laminar Wash instruments of MINI, HT, and AUTO address unmet needs by enabling affordable, off-the-shelf automation of the current, labor-intensive cell analysis process. Furthermore, the products improve the overall data quality such as cell retention, consistency, and reproducibility. Curiox products are used by customers performing life science research, immunology, immunotherapy, drug discovery diagnostics, vaccine research, and cell therapy research and manufacturing.“There’s this thought among scientists that the only way to prepare suspension cells for analysis is to use centrifugation. Curiox has invented a better way to prepare samples. One that’s good for cells is also good for scientists. We believe sample preparation can be affordable, have a good workflow, be less labor-intensive and reproducible. That’s why we’ve created Laminar Wash technology to help scientists prepare samples in a way that treats their cells gently so as not to introduce further variables into important experiments. If you’re ready to help scientists get better results and break them out of their entrenched ways of sample preparation, Curiox is the right place for you.”Namyong Kim, PhD. Curiox CEOPOSITION OVERVIEW:Curiox is looking for a senior engineer with an electro-mechanical background, preferably with prior experience in designing and maintaining electro-mechanical machinery or instruments. This position will be responsible for continuous improvement of the Curiox line of instruments. This position is located in Singapore.The new hire will participation in new product development, including providing instrument design solution, proof of concept and prototyping. An ideal candidate will be expected to work with:Industrial partners for instrument developmentVendors and contract manufacturers to initiate productionIn-house teams for knowledge transfer and trainingInternal users to provide front-line technical supportESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Maintain and improve existing line of products to improve quality and functionality.Provide innovative design solutions for new instrumentation products.Provide proof of concept and prototypes for new development and other in-house innovation.Work with industrial partners for design and development of instrumentation.Work with vendors and suppliers to secure long-term supply of critical componentsWork with contract manufacturer to ensure attainment of quality requirement.Work with internal production, QA and technical support team to ensure proper knowledge transfer.Provide technical knowledge and support for instrument documentation and certification.Assist technical support team in analyzing and troubleshooting instrument issues.QUALIFICATIONS:B.Eng or better qualification in electrical, mechanical or other relevant engineering field.3+ years of experience in electro-mechanical system or instrument design.Strong inclination for innovative ideas or methods to solve technical problems.Able to work independently with minimum supervision.Proficiency in CAD software, such as Solidworks.Proficiency in programming language such as C# is desired.Strong communication skills with good command of the English language.Excellent interpersonal and organizational skillsAbility to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Self-directed with strong work ethic and initiativePlease come join us and make a difference. Send your resume or inquiry by email to hr@curiox.com . Please address your email “SG22” in the subject. No agencies please. Due to the high volume of applications, only qualified candidates will be contacted.For more information, visit our website at www.curiox.com

title: Senior Digital Account Executive
description: Company OverviewFALCON Agency is a performance-led full-service digital agency in Singapore. Merging creativity and technology with data and strategy, we bring a performance and ROI focus to our digital solutions, because we know that is what clients want from their agencies.We are a team of young, enthusiastic and dynamic members. Led by entrepreneurs, we think less like an agency and more like our clients. We love what we do and the work we do for our clients. We are seeking a highly motivated, creative, and ambitious individual who can embody our 3 FALCON values of PASSION, ENTREPRENEURSHIP and EXCELLENCE.Department OverviewIn FALCON, we do not subscribe to the traditional mould of account management. Our account management team are part scientist, part entrepreneur and part artist. You need to become a business partner to the clients, anticipating their business needs and leading the conversations with them. You need to be creative, understand and use data, and have the skills to grow your account and manage campaigns and projects with both internal and external stakeholders.RoleAs a Senior Digital Account Executive, you will be responsible for the coordination of advertising campaigns and communicating clearly to all who are involved. You will also be involved in new business pitches where required. You will report to the Account Director to plan, oversee and execute multi-channel campaigns for several clients.ResponsibilitiesMeet and liaise with clients to discuss and identify their advertising requirements.Work with agency teams – creative/content, production, product, marketing - on required deliverables, and manage client expectations by identifying and delivering the best possible digital solutions and client service level that meets the clients’ budget. Ensure quality of all works before delivery to clients.Present, alongside the team, the campaign ideas and budget to the client.Work with the various team leads to provide detailed and accurate briefs to media, creative, marketing teams and/or partners/vendors.Be the point of contact, alongside the team leads, for all client requests and day-to-day handling of clients and campaigns, ensuring that briefs are met with quality and timelinessWrite contact reports.Undertake administration tasks such as arrangement of meetings, handling and management of campaign costs, invoices to clients and partners/vendors etc.Build enduring relationships with clients and inspire client confidence in the Agency.Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with clients and internal teams.Support the New Business Director in pitches and new accounts where required.RequirementsMinimum 1 year of proven digital account management experience in an advertising, media and/or marketing environment.Has a Bachelor’s degree in a related field.Possesses a good command of English. Ability to speak, read and write other languages is a plus.Experience with managing and executing multi-channel, TTL campaigns and has a good understanding of social media, content creation, email marketing, search marketing and digital media, including key marketing channels and tools like Facebook, Google Analytics and AdWords etc.Experience working on local and regional accounts. Having worked on global MNC accounts would be a plus.Demonstrates a passion for creative problem solving of business challenges via technology, communication, and marketing.Able to prioritize and efficiently work under pressure, and on tight deadlines while coping with the requirements of a fast-moving environment.Able to work independently, is detail-oriented, smart and resourceful in finding information.Proven to be a result-driven team player with curious and inquisitive mind-set and has an eager-to-learn attitude and is willing to pitch in on anything.Demonstrates a high level of integrity in his/her approach to work and with all stakeholders ie clients, colleagues and partners/vendorsAble to communicate effectively and confidently, and work with all stakeholders ie internally, clients and partners/vendors.Able to ensure smooth day-to-day operation of projects.Able to support in preparation of client presentations.Is perceived as a positive, self-motivating and dependable team member.Our Promise to YouWe will help you grow into an essential member of our experienced, passionate and international team. You will have the opportunity to gain a unique perspective for your personal development and learn about the best practices from international business leaders.We want you!Please submit your application online at: www.falcon-agency.com/hireme . For any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at hiring@falcon-agency.com .

and manufacturing process development specialist in the Hair Care category.Success in this role is to lead the technical and business aspects of formulations development, manufacturing and supply of delivering hair care products formulation and manufacturing process.With exposure to the variety of technologies and techniques, you will build and utilize your technical expertise to meet project Effective collaboration with colleagues and partners.

Backed by more than 40 years of technology leadership, our memory and storage solutions enable disruptive trends, including artificial intelligence, 5G, machine learning and autonomous vehicles, in key market segments like mobile, data center, client, consumer, industrial, graphics, automotive, and networking. title: Scientist / Senior Scientist (Centre for Animal Rehabilitation)
description: The Animal & Veterinary Service (AVS), a cluster of NParks, safeguards the health and welfare of animals through comprehensive and integrated programmes and works closely with partners in the veterinary and animal-related industries to strengthen capacities and enhance competencies in animal health and welfare. It is the main touch-point on animal and veterinary matters in Singapore and the first responder for all animal-related feedback. It also conducts public education and engagement programmes to foster a humane and gracious society for all, where pet owners, communities, and animals co-exist in greater harmony within our City in Nature.Responsibilities:As part of the Centre for Animal Rehabilitation under the Professional and Scientific Services Division, you will be involved in research relating to the behaviour and rehabilitation of animals as well as coordinating research projects in related fields.Your job scope as a researcher and research coordinator includes:Developing, implementing and managing research projects, including protocol design, writing funding proposals, data collection, statistical analysis, and the scientific publication of results. You will also be required to present scientific results at meetings and transfer knowledge to internal and external stakeholders.Coordinate and track research projects led by other researchers in related fields.Provide training, technical support and guidance to staff within NParks.Requirements:PhD in Animal Behaviour or a related field with a focus in behavioural sciences (e.g. Ethology / Behavioural Ecology / Animal Welfare / Zoology / Behavioural Medicine / Comparative Psychology etc.).Relevant experience in behaviour assessments, behaviour modification and animal handling, especially under animal shelter contexts, are desirable.Extensive publication record in peer-reviewed journals, experience with dogs and a keen interest in applied animal behavioural issues is preferable.Independent, self-motivated, meticulous, enthusiastic and passionate about animals.Able to work effectively with others in a team environment.Good written/oral communication and interpersonal skills.Competent in Microsoft Office Applications and statistical analysis.Office Location:Centre for Animal Rehabilitation, 6 Perahu Road Singapore 718827Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Technical Applications Specialist III, Genetic Analysis
description: Thermo Fisher Scientific’s Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer, and the global coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak is a powerful reminder of the importance of that Mission. In fact, Thermo Fisher is at the forefront of the global response to COVID-19. We are working with governments, agencies, industry partners and researchers globally to ensure priority access to instruments, consumables, safety supplies and other products to address the outbreak. Our efforts have been particularly focused in supporting analysis of the virus, diagnosis, personal protection, and ultimately helping in the development of new therapeutics and vaccines.How will you make an impact?The Technical Applications Scientist is responsible for providing remote pre and post sales technical support of Thermo Fisher Scientific products to customers and field personnel, as well as relaying customer feedback to the organization.What will you do?Provide technical support for Thermo Fisher Scientific Genetic Analysis productsAnswer customer technical inquiries, primarily received by telephone and emailProvide timely technical advice with a view to immediate problem resolutionUtilize all available resources to resolve or escalate complex issuesKeep detailed records of customer interactions in appropriate systemsRemain up to date with product and workflow knowledge through continuous learningParticipate in creating, maintaining and improving technical documentation, website information and knowledge databasesPresent internal technical training and updates and contribute to department meetingsAssist sales, marketing and support teams to present technical and product informationduring customer visits and eventsParticipate in additional projects, activities and duties as requiredSome travel may be required for the positionWeekend work will be required to support customers across the globeHow will you get here?EducationMinimum Qualifications: B.S., B.A. or M.S. in life sciences or chemistry or a similar field.Preferred Qualifications: PhD or a PhD. with post-doctoral experience.Experience3+ years of hands-on experience with Genetic Analysis applications including DNAsequencing, Real Time PCR, and/or Microarray technologies. Understanding of:assay design, optimization and validationsample preparationinstrument operation and troubleshootingdata analysis/softwareFamiliarity with data management, computer networking and bioinformaticsExperience with clinical applications is desirablePrior experience in a customer service or support role is desirableKnowledge, Skills, AbilitiesAbility to quickly learn large amounts of new, complex technical informationAptitude for problem solvingAbility to work effectively as part of a teamPositive and assertive attitude towards resolving stressful situationsExcellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to manage multiple prioritiesSome weekend work will be requiredA minimum two-year commitment to Technical Support is required due to the extensiveup-front training needed to fully support our expansive product line.GTSDouble

title: Senior Visual Designer
description: At Huge, the Experience Design Team is a multidisciplinary collective of experts that create groundbreaking products, services, and experiences; with expertise in UX, product, visual, motion, industrial and brand design. We're seeking a Senior Visual Designer (XD) – to drive creative output across a range of innovative projects – with a strong pedigree in visual design and demonstrated expertise in digital experiences.As a Senior Visual Designer (XD), you are a talented and driven designer who partners with technology to make gorgeous, ground-breaking work that solves problems. They're ready for hands-on projects at every stage of the lifecycle, from brainstorming creative concepts with the project team and developing original campaigns, to participating in client presentations and ensuring deadlines are met, all the way to launch. We want you to create kick-ass work, yes, but we also want you to mentor junior designers and help shape their personal skills and design perspective—they're already crazy talented, but we want you to help show them how to keep pushing themselves forward. Huge is a seriously collaborative work environment, so Senior Visual Designers need to collaborate across disciplines on a daily basis, from copywriting to analytics to client services, all while maintaining high standards for original concepts and detailed execution.What we'd like to see:A strong background, with 3-5 years of visual design experience, preferably some in an agency environment.Strong conceptual thinking. We want people who can start a project off from an incredibly strong position and come up with surprising, cool concepts to move forward with.Experience designing new, innovative layouts and designs that scale and flex across different platforms, including web, mobile, kiosks etc.Experience building products, developing component-based design systems and adapting brand guidelines to create scalable systems.A user centric design approach, as evidenced by considerations for accessibility, technology platforms, and contextual storytelling.Illustration skills for UI. You should consider Photoshop and Illustrator to be something like family.Strong leadership and teamwork skills—the ability to work with Art Directors and mentor other Designers as well as the confidence and skill to communicate your ideas clearly.A solid understanding of designing intuitive site functionality, interaction, site architecture, user interfaces, and navigation. You know a product needs more than just a pretty face.A great attitude and a lack of ego. Huge works hard to keep our prima-donna free work zone.About HugeHuge is a global experience agency made up of creatives, designers, technologists, strategists, and data scientists. We help companies elevate the human experience by creating unified brand experiences that people love. We work with clients such as Google, McDonald's, FCA, Brooks Running, P&G, and others, who are as committed to shaping culture and defining the future as we are. Headquartered in Brooklyn, we currently have more than 1,200 employees working across 13 offices in North America, Latin America, Europe, and Asia.

title: Senior Manager, Paid Social (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.Get to Know our Team:The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.In this role, you’ll get to:Manage, develop and motivate a paid social teamTest, analyze and optimize campaigns, deliver data-driven insights in order to maximize performanceOwn marketing spend including strategy, planning and execution of marketing activities in new channelsManage the relationships with partners and marketing channels, including commercial terms, bidding strategies and technical implementationsWork with Agoda website Product Owners to implement new IT developments to improve existing advertising programs or add new advertising programs to the Agoda channel mixDevelop a deep understanding of Agoda’s website offerings and of Agoda’s target markets to create actionable advertising programs, leveraging insightful creatives and best-in-class segmentationWork with our designers and language specialists to create ads for more than 40 languagesConstantly identify growth areas and conduct experiments to prove potential growth areasInnovate to drive improvement by leveraging the latest technologies, analytics and optimization processesWhat you’ll need to succeed:At least 5 years of relevant experience in a high responsibility role in Display / Paid Social / App AdvertisingExperience in managing a team of professionalsStrong analytical abilities, especially with respect to experimental design and analysisExperience with DSPs / RTBs is a plusStrategic thinking and planningExperience in and a passion for projects involving big data and statistical modelsExcellent skills in presenting and analyzing data and creating actionable reportsExcellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to report and persuade different levels, including senior managementAbility to work under pressure in a fast paced / rapidly changing environmentDetail-oriented with strong organizational and time management / prioritization skillsIt’s great if you have:Experience in R studio, data modeling, hypothesis testingEqual Opportunity EmployerAt Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. title: Strategy Director, Strategy & Planning
description: We are looking for a strategy leader who is adept in understanding how brands grow in the digital age. You’ll be amazing at weaving together pitch-winning or award-winning stories and expert in the role of content to form connected big ideas spanning Paid, Owned and Earned channels. You’ll join the strategy Communications Practice, with outputs that blend Digitas capabilities to deliver integrated platform ideas and solutions. The successful candidate will therefore possess a broad spectrum of experience in brand, creative and communications strategy.The Strategy Director is a highly experienced, creative and collaborative individual. Someone that brings natural presence, business acumen and an exceptional track record working with leading brands. Our approach is collegiate and thrives on diversity; Strategists work with client leads, creatives, data scientists, experience designers and solution consultants within Digitas as well as forming Power Of One solution teams across Publicis Groupe. At the inter-section of technology, data and creativity we believe we can offer more meaningful connected experiences between brands and people.The role is responsible for regional and local clients and new business prospecting in Singapore. The Singapore office is an engine for growth for the brand across ASEAN markets, so you may also be asked to support the network from time to time. Sound like you? Then we’d love you to get in touch.Experience we need:✦ At least 8 years of strategy and planning experience in relevant digital and creative agencies – consulting and client-side experience will also be considered✦ An excellent track record for leading strategic engagements and creative outcomes with global client brands in multi-cultural, multi-agency and network teams✦ Exposure to a variety of industry verticals with depth and breadth of expertise in one or two categories: FMCG, Alcohol, Finance, Consumer Electronics✦ Specific strategy experience in brand, creative and communications strategy with added emphasis on content, social and the role of influence.✦ An analytical mind with deep market knowledge, able to make recommendations using various research sources, tools and analytics techniques to uncover insight✦ Strong creative problem solving, both on a conceptual level in defining the strategic vision and a practical level in shaping scopes, plans and operations✦ Up-to-date knowledge of leading marketing technologies (Martech) and digital experience platforms (DXP) popular in APAC✦ Authentic leadership qualities when working within project or pitch teams✦ Bachelor's degree or equivalent.Your responsibilities:✦ Be a role model and champion for strategy and Digitas within the agency✦ Weave together pitch-winning and award-winning stories✦ Strategise the role of content to form connected big ideas across POE channels✦ Be an inspiration and guide for the creatives, project and pitch teams✦ Guide a journey-based ideation process and efforts all the way through to delivery✦ Sell-in new offerings and products to existing clients by identifying strategic gaps✦ Maintain cross-functional relationships and help agency leads in the Groupe✦ Be a champion for effectiveness and how to develop data-driven strategy✦ Build morale and motivation within strategy, coaching and supporting your team✦ Take on the role of thought leader, forming initiatives to develop skills and knowledge✦ Support recruitment activities within strategy aligned to the business plan.

title: Strategy Director, Strategy & Planning
description: Company DescriptionDigitas is a high-energy low hierarchy playground, where brilliant minds come together to make modern, purposeful marketing. Our role is to offer end-to-end expertise designed to orchestrate beautiful data-driven customer experiences. A modern agency process that delivers connected capabilities across Data, Strategy, Technology, Creative and Delivery.We are Digitas. We create Connected Experiences. Where everything connects (a quote from DaVinci). This is important because people feel disconnected. Research has shown that loneliness has gone global. Done right, technology brings us together, such as through a pandemic. Even so, technology has its role in creating a kind of collective anxiety. A sense of something missing. Screen time might be ridding us of ‘boredom’, but it is not freeing our minds to connect creatively. Marketers also struggle to stay in touch, using data in sophisticated ways to execute the same basic advertising. All this leads to a disconnect between brands and people, resulting in an ad-blocked and overloaded world.We pride ourselves on having one of the most innovative strategy teams in the business. Our goal to design the right end-to-end journeys – people are at the centre of everything we do. Data is our fuel. Our clients regularly sing our praises, and who can blame them: from several of the world’s largest banks to household names in travel, shopping, food, and leisure, our work is broad and innovative. We offer more than just best-in-class insights; we strive to offer every employee an amazing career path with a generous helping of fun.Job DescriptionWe are looking for a strategy leader who is adept in understanding how brands grow in the digital age. title: Research Engineer
description: The Company:SunBird Bio is a Singapore start-up focusing on developing innovative molecular diagnostic technologies to empower patient care. Our platform technologies reveal new insights about challenging diseases (think cancers and neurodegenerative diseases), enabling earlier detection and better treatment options. These technologies have received multiple awards and are widely featured in news media for their scientific breakthroughs. At SunBird Bio, we are bringing to market these innovative technologies. We are a passionate team coming together from a wide range of backgrounds to solve complex diagnostics problems and realize transformative solutions. At SunBird Bio, your work matters! You will work with a team of creative, supportive, data-driven scientists and venture capital investors to make our vision of diagnostics in medicine a reality.Job Specification:The Research Engineer will work directly with a team of scientists to design, test and develop new assays. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring project goals are met in a timely manner and to communicate the results.Work with the team to scope the project within requirements and ensure timely execution.Design, fabrication, and optimization of microfluidic chip designs that integrate novel molecular assay workflows.Translate benchtop assays to prototype microfluidic systems.Maintain accurate laboratory records and data.Prepare materials for submission to external partners.Summarize project results and present to research team and external partnersJob Requirement:PhD or Masters qualification in Biomedical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Molecular Biology or related disciplines.Familiar with integrating molecular assays with microfluidics.Experience with prototype microfluidic fabrication systems (e.g. 3D printers, CO2 laser, injection moulding, etc… and characterization tools).Experience with microfluidic setups and subsystems to develop working prototype systems is a plus.Experience in a lab environment, preferably with wet biology or chemistry experience is highly desired.Able to work in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.Able to work independently and also in a collaborative manner with an interdisciplinary team.
skills: ['Biomedical Engineering', 'Chemistry', 'Design', 'Fabrication', 'Market', 'Mechanical Engineering', 'Media', 'Medicine', 'Molecular Biology', 'News', 'Patient Care', 'Platform', 'Research', 'Venture Capiral', 'Venture Capital (VC)']

Business operations in these countries report to Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd, located in Singapore. Bosch has been present in Southeast Asia since 1919, with diversified businesses in the company's four business sectors - Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. Bosch's strategic objective is to improve quality of life with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is “Invented for life.”Job DecsriptionDeveloping new research approaches for sensing applications in consumer electronics and smart constructionEvaluating sensor related technologies, identifying risks and developing alternate solutions for insertion into both fielded and developmental systemsPerforming system and sub-system level test, conducting experiments/data collectionsDesigning and prototyping algorithm/signal processing solutions supporting IoT stackData analysis, Modeling system and sub-system behaviorRequirementMasters or Ph.D. in Mechatronics engineering, Computer Science, Materials Science or PhysicsStrong technical skills related to magnetic, current, resistive sensor technologies, knowledge in MEMS sensor technologies will be an advantageAt least 5 years’ experience with designing, integration, prototyping, evaluating, testing and fielding solutionsKnowledge in signal processing and algorithm development, sensor modeling will be an advantageDomain knowledge in Connected Building Solutions, Indoor Air Quality, Water Quality Management, Waste Management, Sustainable Construction will be an advantage

description: We are looking for a passionate and driven Agile Project Manager to join our fast-growing team in Singapore. The right candidate should also be excited and comfortable collaborating with cross-functional teams that consist of a scrum master, software engineers, product owners, data engineers, UX engineers and data scientists who may be located across different time zones.Job responsibilities include the following:Project ManagementCollaborate with product owners, engineers, operations teams, data analysts team members, and other key stakeholders to define project priorities, requirements, deliverables and dependenciesFacilitate scrum eventsSync up with product owners on the priority of tasksManage/remove distractions for the scrum teamBalancing operational concerns with project delivery and executionBe familiar with each project’s development and historyBe familiar with the relevant changes of each sprint’s releasesDocumentation and managing other project related materialsIncluding (but not limited to) documentation of scrum-related project matters, scrum practices for the product engineering teamComfortable with the use of project collaboration tools such as (but not limited to) Jira and ConfluenceWork with the Agile Scrum Master to build scrum culture in our global organisationCollaborate with the Agile Scrum Master to keep track of sprint’s health and team’s healthCoach team members as needed, including engineering practices, conflict resolution and scrum practicesAddress pain points of scrum team member togetherComfortable managing multiple cross-functional teams that consist of software engineers, product owners, data engineers, UX engineers and data scientistsActive listener with an ability to help the team reflect and establish clarity of thoughtsNeutral yet assertive when neededGood initiative, independent and willing to learnAdaptable to different teams’ practicesStrong people management skillsStrong verbal and written communication skills

title: Research Assistant (Forest-Risk Commodity Supply Chains)
description: The College of Science seeks a diverse and inclusive workforce and is committed to equality of opportunity. We welcome applications from all and recruit on the basis of merit, regardless of age, race, gender, religion, marital status and family responsibilities, or disability.The Asian School of the Environment (ASE) invites applications for the position of Research Assistant who will work with Asst. title: Principal Investigator / Junior Principal Investigator
company: NATIONAL DENTAL CENTRE OF SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
description: The National Dental Research Institute Singapore (NDRIS), the research division of the National Dental Centre Singapore (NDCS), seeks an exceptionally accomplished principal investigator/ junior principal investigator pursuing innovative research in the area of dental and oral epidemiology. NDRIS aims to be a leading institute for oral health research globally, renowned for translating research into practice to improve oral health and general health. NDRIS is part of the SingHealth Duke-NUS Academic Medical Centre (AMC) and the successful candidate will have academic career development opportunities.The successful candidate is expected to obtain national research talent development award (e.g. NMRC Clinical Scientist Award - Investigator), secure competitive international/ national research funding, and direct an extramurally-funded research programme in the field of the dental and oral epidemiology, causal inference, and longitudinal data analyses. NDCS’ strategic interests for this position are to develop a research platform to inform the oral health status of Singaporeans, its linkage to general health and the impact of preventive and interventional programmes that will potentially inform health policies. NCDS has a special interest to strengthen and establish relationships with other centres in order to perform linkage of oral and general health longitudinal data.The candidate is expected to synergize and/or collaborate with existing clinical and research faculty within the SingHealth Duke-NUS AMC, as well as seek new collaborations with other internationally renowned clinicians and researchers. The candidate will have access to core research facilities within the AMC. The candidate is expected to continue to attain exceptional scholarly achievements e.g. publications, grants, patents etc. The candidate will be required to supervise, mentor and guide PhD and Masters students, researchers and/or clinician investigators to hone and develop their research skills.RequirementsPh.D. with a thesis focused on statistics, population health, or epidemiology.Preferably with Bachelor of Dental Surgery (BDS), Master of Dental Surgery (MDS) or equivalent degrees, recognized and/or registrable with the Singapore Dental Council.Relevant and extensive research experience in epidemiology and statistics.Knowledge on the mechanisms underlying the association between systemic and oral diseases will be an advantage.Excellent academic track record in scientific publications, competitive extramural grants, patents, supervision of PhD/ Masters students, etc.Demonstrated ability to attract industry funding will be an advantage.Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills

title: Product Manager #SGUnitedJobs
description: Overview:We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to work with our Lead PM to execute on new product launches end-to-end. We are at the inflection point for growth, and we need strong product people to carry us forward. You should be comfortable in a hands-on, collaborative and flexible environment, with the ability to manage multiple product projects simultaneously while driving towards aggressive goals.You will work closely with a Lead PM, Engineering, CS, Design, and the rest of the product team members to execute high quality delivery of all elements required for your product launches, iterations, and long-term metric achievement. You will be a guiding force for some of the highest-profile initiatives in the company's history, driving significant growth and you'll be held to understandably high standards.Responsibilities:This Product Manager will be the "CEO” of up to 1-2 product releases per quarter executing on the outlined product strategy and coordinating with our Lead PM and Product Designer on some of our key product initiatives in 2021.Understand the ultimate user experience that we want to deliver to our customers, and generate solutions to enhance their experience across the product lines you manageOwn product metrics, analyzing data, and reporting regarding the products you launch. Product discovery is a huge part of our process here with not only metrics but also a deep collection of customer interviews to dive into clear observation and validation of your target persona’s pain points.You should have a knack for both front end UX and back end architecture, though you will also work with world-class engineering resources to supplement your feasibility requirementsAbility to communicate and manage team members along with collaboration of shared resources across the department including Designers, Data Scientists, System Architects, and sales / CS reps who can all help you execute and unravel mysteries.You need to be a constant learner, and someone who can structure product initiatives like Beta tests and segmented roll-outs to maximize learning in order to iterate on the product.You should have context about B2B sales enterprise software, CRM integrations, or a clear path to achieve it rapidly.Qualifications:3+ years of pure Product Management experience in SaaS, digital, B2B, or data related products. We are looking for candidates at multiple seniority levelsA track record of launching innovative products/features in addition to experience in defining a company’s objectives, and launching products with key data-driven tacticsImpeccable written, verbal and presentation skills (English)Ability to think strategically and execute tacticallyExcellent problem-solving, organizational and analytical skillsPrior work experience and/or education in a Computer Science or engineering capacity would be idealTechnical understanding. (A plus!) You won't write code and we don't expect you to, but you do need to understand the implications of the features you're prioritizing and be able to communicate both ways with the engineers.
