title: Assistant Scientist - Biochemistry
description: Under the minimal supervision of the Senior Scientist II – Grain Quality and Nutrition Center, assist in the design of experiment(s), survey(s), and other research studies according to Cluster specific project goals and research objectives. Manage the implementation of defined research activities. Evaluate and validate experimental data and contribute to manuscript for reports and publications as well as presentations/posters for national and international conferences. Supervise, coach and guide scholars, OJTs, researchers and research technicians. Coordinate and prepare training sessions for a variety of people. Design experiments and carry out research on the analysis of rice starch structure using instrumental analyses including but not limited to HPLC and GC-MS. Conduct experiments on the implications of rice grain on consumer nutrition by using biochemical assays such as Total Starch, Resistant Starch, Digestible Starch, Total Sugars, in vitro Glycemic Index analysis, and other nutrient assays for anthocyanins, vitamins and micronutrientsThis position will be based at the IRRI Headquarters, Los Baños, Philippines and may only be filled by permanent citizens of the Philippines.Current IRRI staff are encouraged to apply and will be prioritized.Roles and ResponsibilitiesAssist in designing experiments based on the research outline provided for rice starch structure analysis and grain digestibility, as well as anthocyanins, vitamins and micronutrients in the field of BiochemistryManage the implementation of experiments and other research studies related to the analysis of metabolites in the rice grain using HPLC and other related techniques.Contribute to the development of research proposals including reviewing related literature and providing logistical supportDraft training material using readily available published information (i.e. protocols, methodology); verify suggested methodologies and establish parametersContribute to the preparation of reports, publications, and presentations by summarizing research findings and draft manuscripts for publication in refereed journals, submitting project reports, and preparing posters and papers for presentation at local and international conferencesMaintain smooth conduct of experiment(s) by troubleshooting and fostering a productive teamwork environmentExchange conceptual ideas with collaborating partners (national/international), coordinate on their research requirements, and seek feedbackSupervise the work of Researchers , Students, and Trainees and act as the focal person responsible for the professional development and performance appraisals of Research TechniciansProvide assistance and guidelines/information to scholars and collaborators considering the implementation of experiment(s) including the logisticsAct as resource person for training courses and visitorsSelect adequate research tools and equipment based on employed analytical methods for the implementations of the targeted and untargeted metabolite platforms for the rice grainConsolidate, evaluate, and analyze research data related to primary and secondary metabolites; and their concentration in the grainSummarize and validate data using appropriate advanced statistical tools independently and ensure maintenance of accurate data recording and update database for efficient storage and retrieval of informationAssist in the interpretation of results in relation to biochemical mechanisms and grain quality and drafting conclusions to enable necessary actions or decisionsPrepare necessary supply; identify resource persons to make sure that the logistics are appropriate for defined purposeDevelop standard operating procedures (SOP) related to starch biochemical assays and other nutritional assaysQualificationsBachelor of Science degree in Chemistry and 4 years of relevant work experience in chemical research or rice grain quality, orMaster of Science degree in Chemistry and 1 year relevant work experience in chemical research or rice grain quality.Skills RequiredMandatoryHas proven technical proficiency in conducting research experimentsHas strong oral and written communication skillsHas strong analytical skillsHas some experience with Risk management and quality assuranceHas some experience with Research managementHas good presentation skillsHas knowledge in R or any statistical software for data processing, visualization, and interpretationHas knowledge in rice starch biochemical and metabolite assays and must know how to operate the HPLC equipmentPreferredHas some experience supervising or overseeing the work of staffHas capability to coordinate and implement safety-related activities in the laboratoryIRRI offers a highly extensive employee benefits package inclusive of globally-covered medical insurance, retirement plan, life and accident insurance and other allowances. description: About IRRIThe International Rice Research Institute (IRRI) is the world’s premier research organization dedicated to reducing poverty and hunger through rice science; improving the health and welfare of rice farmers and consumers; and protecting the rice-growing environment for future generations. IRRI is an independent, nonprofit, research and educational institute, founded in 1960 by the Ford and Rockefeller foundations with support from the Philippine government. The institute, headquartered in Los Baños, Philippines, has offices in 17 rice-growing countries in Asia and Africa, and over 1,000 staff.Working with in-country partners, IRRI develops advanced rice varieties that yield more grain and better withstand pests and disease as well as flooding, drought, and other harmful effects of climate change.Job PurposeUnder the minimal supervision of the Senior Scientist II – Grain Quality and Nutrition Center, assist in the design of experiment(s), survey(s), and other research studies according to Cluster specific project goals and research objectives. description: About IRRIThe International Rice Research Institute (IRRI) is the world’s premier research organization dedicated to reducing poverty and hunger through rice science; improving the health and welfare of rice farmers and consumers; and protecting the rice-growing environment for future generations. IRRI is an independent, nonprofit, research and educational institute, founded in 1960 by the Ford and Rockefeller foundations with support from the Philippine government. The institute, headquartered in Los Baños, Philippines, has offices in 17 rice-growing countries in Asia and Africa, and over 1,000 staff.Working with in-country partners, IRRI develops advanced rice varieties that yield more grain and better withstand pests and disease as well as flooding, drought, and other harmful effects of climate change. More than half of the rice area in Asia is planted to IRRI-bred varieties or their progenies. The institute develops new and improved methods and technologies that enable farmers to manage their farms profitably and sustainably, and recommends rice varieties and agricultural practices suitable to particular farm conditions as well as consumer preferences. title: Postdoctoral Associate
company: Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology
description: The Disruptive & Sustainable Technologies for Agricultura Precision (DiSTAP) interdisciplinary research group aims to revolutionize how food is produced to meet the demands of a growing population in an increasingly resource constrained world. While this technology and science facilitates Singapore’s agricultural independence and ensures access to high-quality foods for the future, this technology can also be applied around the world – making Singapore a leader in precision agriculture and urban farming.DiSTAP is using nanotechnology, microelectronics and biomaterials to create new technologies that can (1) measure, in real-time, the flow of nutrients and hormones within plants; (2) leverage on these knowledge and tools to select and develop plant varieties that are richer in nutrients and can grow in high density; and (3) influence plant metabolism and plant health by precise delivery of bioactive payloads.This interdisciplinary team comprises engineers, biologists, plant scientists, food scientists, and data analytics experts from multiple MIT academic units, and multiple Singapore-based universities and research centres of excellence.All postdoctoral associates (PDAs) in SMART DiSTAP based in Singapore will work in a diverse team of experts including several principal investigators (PIs) and PDAs, and receive direct mentorship from mentors both based in Singapore and at MIT. PDAs with a strong inclination for faculty position and/or enterpreneurship will strongly benefit from the vibrant community of academics and enterpreneurs that gravitate around the DiSTAP ecosystem and from the opportunities offered by SMART.The proposed research project is based on the development of new delivery systems that can impact plant metabolism, with the ultimate goal of studying plant metabolism, boost crop production, and mitigate environmental stressors.Job ResponsibilitiesFocus on developing biomaterials and nanotechnologies that can be interfaced with plants and food.Employ a multidisciplinary approach to this investigation with a focus on biomaterial synthesis and fabrication as well as drug delivery.Collaborate closely with other DiSTAP team members who are developing technologies to be delivered in plants and food.Develop a workflow for micro and nanofabrication of biomaterials that can be rapidly scaled up and translated in a GMP production environment.Perform experiments to assess the entrapment of cargo molecules in biomaterials, their preservation and deployment in plant tissues using standard as well as newly developed protocols.Interfacing with the greater biomaterials and food community in Singapore, which includes other researchers, enterpreneurs and regulatory science experts in SMART, NUS, NTU.Job RequirementsPh.D in biological/biomedical engineering, materials science, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering or a related field is required.Applicants with a general background in plants and food science are strongly encouraged to apply. An interdisciplinary research background in biomaterials, micro/nanofabrication, materials characterization, drug delivery and biology is an asset.Knowledge and demonstrated skill set in biomaterials, drug delivery, bio/molecular assays and experimental techniques including microscopy (confocal), FTIR/Raman, qPCR/RNAseq, etc.Experience with plantal handling and experimentation is desired but not requiredExperience with food is desired but not required.Experience with synthetic biology is desired but not required.Able to work well and communicate ideas effectively in a multidisciplinary team of researchers with different training backgroundsGood track record of publications and scientific outputSelf-motivated, independent, with superior organizational and analytical skillsGood writing skillsAble and committed to work in SingaporeInterested applicants are invited to send in their full CV/resume, cover letter and list of three references (to include reference names and contact information). We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Application Technician Functional Food Ingredients
description: At Corbion, we exist to champion preservation in all its forms, preserving food and food production, health, and our planet.Corbion's R&D Sustainable Food Solutions (SFS) develops functional ingredients which enhance shelf life, food safety, texture, flavor and overall performance of food stuff. What makes us special is that all our ingredient solutions are based on natural and sustainable resources. We closely work together with our customers in co-developing innovative solutions. We have multi-disciplinary approach towards innovation together with marketing and sales. This is how we contribute to reducing food waste and improving food safety.As our Food Application Technologist, you will be based out of our business hub in Singapore. You report to the Senior Food Scientist.ResponsibilitiesApplication developmentDevelop food recipes with Corbion ingredients to compare to substitutes & competitive alternatives.Perform & Report applications trialsAnalyse the foods (chemical, microbiological and sensorial (e.g. taste, texture, color))Assure that the generated data can be used by the sales organization for their discussions with distributors & customers.Develop prototype foods for customer showingTechnical support to sales, distributors & customersPromote the use of Corbion’s ingredients in food applications in agreement with Sales & Business Development in APACAttend to customer queries with regards to technical issues of Corbion ingredients in the food (do trials, use literature, use databases)Training of the sales organization, distributors and/or customers.Collaborate with the application team to assure a fully functional kitchen & food lab (e.g. maintain analytical equipment, food processing equipment, maintain stock levels of used food ingredients)Care for a Safe & Hygienic environment in the Kitchen & Food laboratoryRequirementsBachelor or Master’s Degree in Food Science & Technology or equivalent combined with preferably 2-5 years of relevant experience in the Asian food (ingredients) industry.Experience preferably in the Meat, Meat alternatives, Seafood and/or Savory industryTechnically initiativeBe able to work individually without supervisionFluent in EnglishWillingness to travel up to 15%, mostly in the APAC regionYou may participate in sensory evaluations of a variety of lab-made and commercial foods, including, but not limited to meat (beef, pork, poultry), seafood, confectionery, bakery, eggs and dairy.About CorbionWhat makes Corbion truly special is our talented global team of people, who are consciously dedicated to connecting the work we do together with the difference it makes in the lives of consumers, including our own friends and families. At Corbion, innovation is in our DNA; we explore, we discover, we create, and then we do it all over again, finding ever-better ways to help the world solve some of its most pressing challenges. When you come to Corbion, you will find that for us, sustainability is not simply a corporate program, it is at the very heart of our business, giving direction to our work, our investments and our creativity. We exist to preserve what matters.As a company where day-to-day priorities and decisions are shaped by a shared purpose and vision, we enjoy a working environment energized by empowerment and opportunity. By joining Corbion, you can be part of :A culture open to great ideas wherever they come from, and where your work can make a real difference in the worldAn organization that values diversity of thought, background and experienceA company ready to invest in you, helping you grow toward your personal ambitionsA workplace that’s friendly and informal, while being focused and professionalAn international team small enough to stay agile, but large and talented enough to make an impact today, and for future generationsOur corporate values – Collaboration, Care, Courage and Commitment – define what it takes to overcome obstacles and create the sustainable breakthroughs the world sorely needs. As a member of the Corbion team, you’ll see these values put into action every day, and you’ll have the chance to make your own unique contribution to our collective achievements.

title: Information Technology - Strategic Data Consultant
description: [CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE WORK PASSES NEED NOT APPLY]Job DescriptionWe are looking for strategic data consultant as part of our cross-functional digital accelerator team working with business and IT teams to tackle the most challenging and transversal business problems in all aspect of our business – sales and marketing, customer services, airline operations and back office functions.You are a T-shaped person who understands technologies and has strong business acumen with deep yearning on how data analytics can be applied on real business problems, where completeness of data is often first challenge and actionable insights can be less obvious. title: Imminent Risk Project Manager, APAC
description: The Imminent Risk team seeks to identify and prioritize imminent risks to Facebook and its users. We identify trends from external industry events and track key public affairs issues to evaluate risks, deliver action-oriented assessments to mitigate risk and provide critical insights to our internal partners. We're seeking a strong problem-solver who can drive across a number of risk vectors, manage multiple internal stakeholders, balance differing opinions and perspectives, and weigh risks in order to provide effective operational mitigation strategies as they relate to risks across the Asia-Pacific region (APAC). Successful candidates will be excellent communicators who can articulate complex issues clearly in writing and verbally, in a multi-tasking and fast paced environment. Candidates must be able to make difficult decisions under pressure, use critical thinking skills and demonstrate strong leadership and interpersonal skills to organize and build relationships with teams across the company.Drive risk analysis, strategy, and mitigation as it relates to APAC integrity issues across product, policy and enforcementLeverage critical and adversarial thinking to effectively prioritize a variety of known and unknown potential risk vectorsDevelop & coordinate the cross-functional preparation and response efforts to address imminent threats on the Facebook family of appsServe as team liaison to key local XFNs and partner closely with internal stakeholders around APAC issues, including Strategic Response, Public Policy and Comms, identifying clear roles and responsibilities, and creating accountability across contributors to achieve goals mentioned aboveEffectively educate and influence leaders and partners on the risk landscape to gain alignment and establish consensusUtilize internal resources and tools to understand content risk and inform how they can best contribute to risk mitigation execution strategiesBachelor’s degree6+ years work experience in program/project management, consulting, investigations, online ads, public policy, press management, internet safety and political campaigning/consulting in public policy, legal, political science, risk management, or related disciplineStrategic thinker with analytical problem-solving skillsWorking knowledge of policy issues affecting technology companiesEffective at consensus-building, and communicating with internal and external audiencesLeadership and interpersonal skills with a proven track record of building relationships with cross-functional teamsExperience communicating to a variety of audiences, including Engineers, Data Scientists, Product Managers, Public Policy Directors, and other leadershipAdvanced-level DegreeExperience in coaching, mentoring, or managementExperience in Crisis Management2+ years of work experience or knowledge in international internet/social media issuesFacebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

title: Project Manager
description: Founded in 2010, Lynx Analytics is a predictive analytics company run by world-class quantitative marketing scientists and industry-experienced data scientists. Our focus is to become the world's leading telecom analytics solution provider, whilst advancing graph analytics technology.This is a newly created opportunity for an experienced Project Manager to oversee our commercial projects throughout Asia or Europe, from conception through to implementation. The successful incumbent will be responsible for the full project cycle, including the definition of milestones, resource planning, task allocation, mapping of dependencies and managing timely delivery.This is a unique role, combining multiple disciplines of project delivery, account management and business development. Customer centricity and innovation is key to our sustained growth and Project Managers are expected to bring together and catalyse the performance of multi-skilled global team members from different backgrounds. At the forefront of client engagement, they are driving initiatives across multiple functionals including marketing and customer operations, and are often best positioned to notice new business opportunities. Project Managers also play a critical role in significantly improving existing solutions and in contributing to new solution development.Key responsibilities will include:Accountability for an end to end project delivery including commercial KPIs such as (delivered on time, within budget, at margin)Leading all project stages including - contracting, scoping & kick-off, execution and post-implementation reviews working closely with legal, business development, product and technical teams to ensure seamless execution. Specifically:Drive contracting phase of a new or amended project, working closely with the Legal and Business Development teams to help a contract through its approval stages at the clientDefine project scope, involving all relevant stakeholders as required (i.e. the Account Lead, CSO and the client) and ensuring commercial and technical feasibilityCreate a robust governance framework for continuous monitoring and measurement of project performance, risks, dependencies and impact on timelines with both internal and client teamsManage and lead the project team (typically three to five people) to ensure milestones, deadlines and quality standards are being met.Translate project requirements for internal technical teams and work closely with key stakeholders to implement updates and improvements as required.Building a strong relationship of trust and credibility with relevant client stakeholders both for the project and for Lynx as a company. Specifically:Regular client engagement as part of ongoing project governance and delivery to ensure transparency in committed deliveryGain a deep understanding of the client's business needs and pain points (as feasible) with feedback and understand their needs, requirements, and/or issuesActively identify new business opportunities for the company clients you are interacting with, and liaise with the Business Development team to pursue themBuild a motivating and collegiate working environment with the team aligned to our company's core values.Willingness to undertake travel as required (approximately 50%, within the region)To succeed in this role, you will need:Degree qualified, preferably in a business disciplineAt least 3+ years of experience in a project management (or similar) role, ideally in the telecommunications or financial services sectorsClient management experience and consulting experience a plusExperience with senior stakeholder management (including the ability to liaise with to C-suite executives and building sustainable client relationships)Outstanding communication and presentation skills with strong negotiation and influencing abilitiesKnowledge of predictive analytics and Big Data technology is preferred, but not essentialSolid leadership skills and a proven ability to build great teamsProven ability to liaise with internal software development teams and translate client requirements into technical specificationsHighly organised and disciplined with the ability to work autonomously and be self-managingInitiative and proactivity with an energetic and enthusiastic approachAdditional language abilities appropriate to the region would be advantageous but are not essential.In return, we offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working hours, stock options for employees and travel opportunities throughout SE Asia and Europe.

Siemens Advanta Consulting navigates companies through their unique digitalization journey - from strategy to prototypes and operations. We combine deep industry expertise with business and digital proficiency, going way beyond the classical consulting. We strive to solve complex problems in domains ranging from industry, mobility and buildings to smart cities by applying methods and principles of design thinking, data analytics, artificial intelligence, and interactive visualization. We are uniquely positioned to help our customers build, transform and grow their businesses as well as to realize their digital vision from strategy to blueprint.Siemens Advanta Singapore is integral part of the first fully-integrated major Digital Hub for Siemens in the world. title: Postdoctoral Associate (Ref: IRG_DiSTAP_2021_001)
company: SINGAPORE-MIT ALLIANCE FOR RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY...
description: [CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE WORK PASSES NEED NOT APPLY]Project OverviewThe Disruptive & Sustainable Technologies for Agricultura Precision (DiSTAP) interdisciplinary research group aims to revolutionize how food is produced to meet the demands of a growing population in an increasingly resource constrained world. While this technology and science facilitates Singapore’s agricultural independence and ensures access to high-quality foods for the future, this technology can also be applied around the world – making Singapore a leader in precision agriculture and urban farming.DiSTAP is using nanotechnology, microelectronics and biomaterials to create new technologies that can (1) measure, in real-time, the flow of nutrients and hormones within plants; (2) leverage on these knowledge and tools to select and develop plant varieties that are richer in nutrients and can grow in high density; and (3) influence plant metabolism and plant health by precise delivery of bioactive payloads.This interdisciplinary team comprises engineers, biologists, plant scientists, food scientists, and data analytics experts from multiple MIT academic units, and multiple Singapore-based universities and research centres of excellence.All postdoctoral associates (PDAs) in SMART DiSTAP based in Singapore will work in a diverse team of experts including several principal investigators (PIs) and PDAs, and receive direct mentorship from mentors both based in Singapore and at MIT. PDAs with a strong inclination for faculty position and/or enterpreneurship will strongly benefit from the vibrant community of academics and enterpreneurs that gravitate around the DiSTAP ecosystem and from the opportunities offered by SMART.The proposed research project is based on the development of new technologies that can impact plant metabolism, with the ultimate goal of boosting crop production, mitigating the effect of environmental stressors and minimizing agricultural input.Job ResponsibilitiesFocus on developing biomaterials that can be micro/nano-fabricated to be interfaced with plants and food.Employ a multidisciplinary approach to this vestigation with a focus on biomaterial synthesis and fabrication as well as drug delivery.Collaborate closely with other DiSTAP team members who are developing technologies to be delivered in plants and food.Develop a workflow for micro and nanofabrication of biomaterials that can be rapidly scaled up and translated in a GMP production environment.Perform experiments to assess the deployment of cargo molecules in plants and food using standard as well as newly developed protocols.Interfacing with the greater biomaterials and food community in Singapore, which includes other researchers, enterpreneurs and regulatory science experts in SMART, NUS, NTU.Job RequirementsPhD in biological/biomedical engineering, materials science, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering or a related field is required.Applicants with a general background in plants and food science are strongly encouraged to apply. An interdisciplinary research background in biomaterials, micro/nanofabrication, materials characterization, drug delivery and biology is an asset.Knowledge and demonstrated skill set in biomaterials, drug delivery, bio/molecular assays and experimental techniques including microscopy (confocal, high-content), FTIR/Raman, qPCR/RNAseq, etc.Experience with plantal handling and experimentation is desired but not requiredExperience with food is desired but not required.Able to work well and communicate ideas effectively in a multidisciplinary team of researchers with different training backgroundsGood track record of publications and scientific outputSelf-motivated, independent, with superior organizational and analytical skillsGood writing skillsAble and committed to work in SingaporeInterested applicants are invited to send in their full CV/resume, cover letter and list of three references (to include reference names and contact information). We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Chuyên viên cao cấp Phát triển sản phẩm khách hàng doanh nghiệp
description: PHÚC LỢIBảo hiểmDu LịchThưởngChăm sóc sức khỏeĐào tạoTăng lươngMÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC1. Thiết kế sản phẩm, xây dựng mô hình kinh doanh cho các khách hàng Thương mại:Thu thập dữ liệu thị trường; nghiên cứu và phân tích dữ liệu thị trường/ khách hàng, đối thủ cạnh tranh (data scientist).Xây dựng chân dung khách hàng mục tiêu trên các nội dung bao gồm: hồ sơ (Profile) khách hàng, chu trình hoạt động, và nhu cầu, động lực, hành vi, rủi ro theo từng giai đoạn theo chu trình hoạt động và giai đoạn phát triển của khách hàng.Xây dựng định vị giá trị khách hàng của MSB đối với phân khúc khách hàng Thương mại dựa trên kết quả nghiên cứu chân dung khách hàng, đối thủ cạnh tranh và mục tiêu của MSB.Xác định giá trị định vị ưu tiên cần triển khai khác biệt trong các giá trị định vị.Xây dựng định hướng chính sách khách hàng phù hợp với định vị giá trị khách hàng.Xây dựng mô hình kinh doanh phù hợp với định hướng chính sách khách hàng.Quản lý, điều phối việc triển khai mô hình kinh doanh phân khúc khách hàng bao gồm việc xây dựng giải pháp, mô hình dịch vụ, kênh bán hàng, chính sách khuyến khích, mô hình rủi ro, giá, các hành động/sáng kiến cần triển khai, kết quả kinh doanh cần đạt được.2. Quản lý hiệu quả hoạt động của các khách hàng Thương mại:Xây dựng kế hoạch kinh doanh và quản lý PnL cho các khách hàng theo từng năm hoạt động.Tối ưu hóa danh mục khách hàng: tối đa doanh thu trên khách hàng hiện hữu (upsale), tái tục, giảm tỷ lệ khách hàng rời bỏ.Đưa ra các yêu cầu, khuyến nghị về sản phẩm/kênh bán hàng/khuyến mại dành cho từng tiểu phân khúc trọng tâm, từng thời điểm.Giám sát việc thực hiện mô hình kinh doanh cho các khách hàng và đưa ra các chính sách nhằm nâng cao trải nghiệm của Khách hàng trên toàn bộ hành trình.3. Các nhiệm vụ khác được giao.YÊU CẦU CÔNG VIỆC1. Trình độ:Học vấn: Đại học/ Thạc sỹ trở lên, chuyên ngành kinh tế, tài chính, ngân hàng.Ngoại ngữ: Tiếng Anh (TOEIC 550 hoặc các chứng chỉ tương đương).Tin học: Tin học văn phòng, sử dụng thành thạo Word, Excel, PowerPoint.2. Kinh nghiệm:Tối thiểu 05 năm ở lĩnh vực ngân hàng; trong đó tối thiểu 03 năm kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực phát triển sản phẩm cho Khách hàng Doanh nghiệp.Thuần thục các kỹ năng phân tích thị trường, phân tích khách hàng.3. Kiến thức:Kiến thức chung:Am hiểu lĩnh vực Ngân hàng: Các chính sách và quy định quan trọng của NHNN Việt Nam; am hiểu hệ thống ngân hàng.Am hiểu lĩnh vực Thương mại , am hiểu về kinh tế Việt Nam; có nền tảng kiến thức và hiểu biết về kinh tế, tài chính, ngân hàng, thị trường; kiến thức chuyên môn về phân khúc khách hàng và hiểu rõ hành vi, nhu cầu KHDN.Kiến thức chuyên môn:Am hiểu chính sách, quy trình, quy định trong đơn vị: Am hiểu về hệ thống chính sách, quy trình, quy định liên quan đến KHDN.Am hiểu sản phẩm, dịch vụ của đơn vị: Am hiểu về hệ thống sản phẩm dịch vụ cơ bản và chuyên sâu của ngân hàng thương mại, đặc biệt các sản phẩm dịch vụ cung cấp cho KHDN.4. Năng lực:Năng lực hành vi/ Thái độ: Tinh thần trách nhiệm; khả năng chủ động trong công việc, tuân thủ quy định.Năng lực chung:Khả năng sáng tạo và liên tục cải thiện.Khả năng phân tích và định lượng.Khả năng tiếp thị, điều tra và dự báo thị trường.Năng lực quản lý/lãnh đạo: Khả năng quản lý quá trình triển khai công việc.Năng lực chuyên môn:Khả năng cấu trúc rủi ro.Khả năng tổng hợp, xử lý và đưa ra giải pháp.Khả năng phân tích quản trị danh mục.Khả năng truyền đạt thông tin mục tiêu.Job tags: Chuyên viên cao cấp Phát triển sản phẩm khách hàng doanh nghiệp lĩnh vực Thương mại - EB - MSB - M

title: Scientist
description: Position Summary:As a Scientist 1 within Illumina’s Research and Technology Development team, you will work as part of a multi-disciplinary research team to help create new sequencing methods. You will play an important role in the research and development of sequencing reagents and consumables with the world-class performance, stability and robustness characteristics that our customers require.You will be responsible for developing cutting edge technologies and related assays by designing and executing experiments, collecting data, performing analysis, drawing conclusions and presenting to key stakeholders.Position Responsibilities:Design and perform experiments, communicate results and conclusions to aid in team decision-makingContribute to ongoing research projects in a fast-paced environmentKeep detailed lab notebooks, prepare reports, updates, and summaries for managers and teamsUpkeep of lab equipment, laboratory supplies and good housekeepingListed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.Position Requirements:Excellent skills in synthetic organic chemistry, small molecule synthesis, biomolecular bioconjugation.Experienced in analytical techniques such as NMR, HPLC and MSExcellent laboratory, experimental and organizational skillsProven track record of innovation and scientific creativityPassionate about research and goal-drivenDesign and execute experiments with limited instructionAbility to effectively troubleshoot, propose and prioritize next steps or suggest alternate strategiesPerform data analysis; write reports and present results to the project team, draw conclusion and propose next stepsAttention to detail and the ability to communicate effectively, taking initiativeAnalytical, organized, efficient, problem solver, easily adaptable, self-motivated, independent but also works well in a teamA self-starter, positive, and driven with a “can do” attitude.Excellent verbal/written communication skillsAll listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.Preferred Experience/Education/Skills:PhD degree in chemistry or materials science orBSc or Masters degree in chemistry or materials science with 6+ years of industrial experienceExperience in nucleotide chemistry and various chromatography purification techniques preferredIndustrial experience is highly desirable.Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.
skills: ['Analytical', 'Data Analysis', 'Design', 'Innovation', 'Materials Science', 'Organic Chemistry', 'Organizational Skill', 'Play', 'Research and Development (R&D)', 'Written Communication']

title: Engr, Assoc Test 1
description: Company OverviewKLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and in 2019 we invested 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.Group/DivisionKLA has manufacturing sites across the globe, including Belgium, China, Germany, Israel, Singapore and Milpitas (CA). The Global Operations (GOPS) team, comprised of Manufacturing, Supply Chain Management, Manufacturing Engineering, Installation, and Quality, is responsible for manufacturing our leading-edge technology. We partner with our world-wide supply base and our design engineering teams to bring new products to market. The GOPS team is continuously working to build our products Better, Faster, Cheaper.Performs the set-up, calibration, testing and troubleshooting of circuits, components, instruments and mechanical assembliesDetermines and may develop test specifications, methods and procedures from blueprints, drawings and diagrams.Tests and troubleshoots assemblies and/or final systems. May complete rework on assemblies and/or systems as a result of testing.Prepares technical reports summarizing findings and recommending solutions to technical problems.May assist in the selection and set-up of specialized test equipment.We offer a competitive, family friendly total rewards package. We design our programs to reflect our commitment to an inclusive environment, while ensuring we provide benefits that meet the diverse needs of our employees.KLA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer
skills: ['Change Management', 'Electronics', 'German', 'Innovation', 'Integrated Circuit', 'Manufacturing Engineering', 'Market', 'Printed Circuit Board', 'Rally', 'Research and Development (R&D)', 'Sales', 'Selection', 'Semiconductors', 'Supply Chain Management', 'Supply Chain Risk Management', 'TestNG', 'Testing', 'Virtual Reality (VR)', 'Web Design']

title: Associate Manager - Business Analytics (Healthcare Solutions)
description: A very exciting Associate Manager - Business Analytics (Healthcare Solutions) job opportunity has become available at one of the biggest global healthcare solutions in the world.About the Associate Manager - Business Analytics (Healthcare Solutions) Role:The focus of this role is to be the Associate Manager for business reporting and analytics focusing more on the instrumental in leading a team of analysts, architects and data scientists. The individual will be a thought leader in critical aspects of information technology and must have the ability to influence senior leadership.Key Responsibilities:Work with stakeholders to meet defined project deliverables including but not limited to requirements gathering, design, system configuration, data modelling and report development, maintenance and supportDeliver new tools and systems that will help the company accomplish the organisation's goalsOwn the data management and analytics roadmap of the SP COE team and provide prioritisation feedback to the technology team and senior managementCommunicate all issues to the assigned team leaderAct as a subject-matter expert in the implementation of new approaches, identifying the optimal blend of measurement and analytic techniques. Present data and analysis clearly and articulately to all levels of the organisationImprove reporting efficiency; standardisation and develop a governance model for analytics and reporting to drive standards and standardisation in decision-making tools and reportingUnderstand and evaluate business requirements and translate into specific analytics solutionsAnalyse complex data systems and document data elements, data flow, relationships and dependenciesDevelop automated and reusable routines for extracting information from various source applicationsBuild and manage data sets for reporting integration, dashboards, data visualisation, data mining, and predictive analyticsConstantly monitor data science trends, emerging tools and technologies to continually improving frameworks, processes and best practices for predictive modelsDevelop and implement an end-user self-service reporting and analytics strategy (data models, reporting tools, training, testing and review, and retirement of abandoned reports)To succeed in this Associate Manager - Business Analytics (Healthcare Solutions) role, you will need to work hand in hand with the business excellence and transformation team.Key Requirements:10 or more years of experience developing, configuring, and implementing database management solutionsStrong interest and intellectual curiosity about data, databases and analytical modellingStrong business acumen, and superior written, verbal and presentation skillsBS/MS degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, information technology or equivalent/related degree. title: Senior Content QA
description: The OpportunityWe are looking for a talented SQA to join our team as Content QA. By taking this role, you will collaborate closely with our scientific content creator, developer, and art team who creates engaging and innovative solutions that will significantly improve science education. Your main accountability would be making sure the high quality of our simulations (virtual laboratories).NOTE:For the location: Bali (Indonesia). This is a role with starting date in Q2 2021, a 1-year contract, with the possibility to be a permanent employee. Bali office location. Due to the pandemic, working remotely is allowed until the situation is under control.Responsibilities:Performing excellent testing execution of our simulations based on our testing strategy.Proactively giving feedback/recommendations on functionality, non-functionality, and user experience of our simulations.Preparing and/or administering the detailed test plan and test cases to support testing execution.Planning testing schedules and/or strategies in accordance with testing scope and delivery dates.Establishing and nurturing continuous improvement of scalable testing strategy, tools, and processes.Contributing to the improvement of our automatic testing tool.Exercising data-driven in improving the quality of our simulation.Collaborating well with all stakeholders by performing great communication and task management.Competencies:Professional experience in software testing, specifically in the edtech or gaming industry (min. 8 years).Applied knowledge of best practices in test framework and test case design i.e. creating test plan and test cases, etc.Solid understanding of bug life cycle and reporting.High attention to detail and willingness to do repeatable action refer to game-testing.Experience in various platform testing, such as mobile application testing.Experience in automation testing and non-functional test.Experience working in an Agile (Scrum and/or Kanban) development environment.Experience in establishing testing best practices/strategies.Passion for user experience and game design.Ability to make decisions and/or improvement based on data (data-driven).Ability to work independently, multi-task, and work in a fast-paced team environment.Fluent in written and spoken English.What do we offer?Attractive salary and benefits package (health insurance, development plan, etc.)A fun opportunity to work for an exciting company with NO DULL CORPORATE LIFESTYLE.You will have the opportunity to work with cutting edge technology and take part in very exciting projects working for a company with a noble vision.About LabsterAt Labster we are dedicated to empowering the next generation of scientists to change the world. Our mission is to develop fully interactive software that makes learning both fun, engaging, and effective, and to make it accessible to as many science students as possible (see the short trailer here). Since 2012, our simulations were played over 4,000,000 times, and each semester more than 4,000 universities, high schools, and other institutions around the globe are using them to enhance their teaching programs.We govern ourselves by using a flat-hierarchy system called Holacracy that is focused on roles, collaboration, and distributed leadership. We believe in flexible work hours and a good work-life balance, and while we love to achieve great things via concentrated work, it’s incredibly important for us to have happy and engaged team members.Labster Vision: Empower the Next Generation of Scientists to Change the WorldFor more information on our company vision to empower the next generation of scientists to change the world, please see the video links below:BBC News: https://www.bbc.com/news/av/te...Techcrunch: https://techcrunch.com/2020/08...TED Talk: see our founder's TED talk here

title: Senior Executive (Talent Attraction and Outreach)
description: ResponsibilitiesDSO National Laboratories (DSO) is Singapore's largest defence research and development (R&D) organisation, with the critical mission to develop technological solutions to sharpen the cutting edge of Singapore's national security. At DSO, you will develop more than just a career. This is where you will make a real impact and shape the future of defence across the spectrum of air, land, sea, space and cyberspace.Our mission in HR is to find and retain like-minded individuals who are passionate about innovating new solutions and pushing technological boundaries. In DSO today, we see every staff as a leader. We identify them, nurture and develop them to their fullest potential - to become leaders in their own domains. We provide a conducive environment so that our people can focus on their work. We recognise and reward them. In HR, we are constantly finding ways to inspire our staff to achieve their aspirations.People are DSO’s greatest asset. You will get to realise your career aspirations and develop your own niche either as a deep technical expert or a leader in the team. With frequent career dialogues and a robust training and development framework, we will provide you with the necessary development tools for you to reach your potential. You will also be recognised and rewarded through competitive remuneration packages and scholarship opportunities.Senior Executive (Talent Attraction and Outreach)In the TA & OR team, we aim to enhance the DSO brand to ensure continual access to talent, and build a talent pipeline of Research Scientists and Engineers for DSO.In this role, you will:Administer the DSO Internship Programme from collation of requests right through to off-boarding of interns.Involve in the planning and execution of outreach events and engagement initiatives to increase the uptake of DSO Internships and build the talent pipeline for DSO.Build and maintain good relations with educational institutions to facilitate the implementation of outreach events.Maintain and prepare data for reporting and analysis.Brainstorm, propose and implement new ideas to enhance our suite of outreach programmes and initiatives.RequirementsExperience in internship administration and event management will be advantageousIndependent, resourceful and a good team playerStrong administration skills with attention to detailsStrong verbal and written communications skillsProficient in Microsoft Excel and tech savvy

title: Engr, Mfg Design 3
description: Company OverviewKLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and in 2019 we invested 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.Group/DivisionKLA has manufacturing sites across the globe, including Belgium, China, Germany, Israel, Singapore and Milpitas (CA). The Global Operations (GOPS) team, comprised of Manufacturing, Supply Chain Management, Manufacturing Engineering, Installation, and Quality, is responsible for manufacturing our leading-edge technology. We partner with our world-wide supply base and our design engineering teams to bring new products to market. The GOPS team is continuously working to build our products Better, Faster, Cheaper.Responsibilities:Solve complex system interaction issues on an advanced scanning electron microscopy instrument.Develop product specifications using the appropriate statistical methods and modeling.Provide manufacturability design requirements to designers.Develop, implement, and maintain processes in the manufacture or fabrication of parts, components, sub-assemblies, and final assemblies.Create ECO’s to implement new design BOM structures to meet the procurement and build requirements.Provide fly and fix support on field escalations for analysis/resolution on issues requiring in-depth product design know-how and support beta testing at customer sites.Supplier management including specification agreements, cost reduction, ramp readiness, quality, and failure analysis.Travel up to 25%.Preferred experience:Experience in dealing with Parts obsolescence/End of life and regulatoryExperience in Semiconductor equipmentRequirements:Masters/Bachelors Degree in Electronics/Electrical Engineering or equivalent3 to 5 years of product development and/or systems engineering experienceExperience in testing electrical subsystems and cable assembliesPossess strong troubleshooting and analytical skills to support technical issues, set-up experiments, and perform data analysis.Ability to lead a team in defining solutions for complex issues.Ability to champion his/her technical solutions to manufacturability issues found with the design.We offer a competitive, family friendly total rewards package. We design our programs to reflect our commitment to an inclusive environment, while ensuring we provide benefits that meet the diverse needs of our employees.KLA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer

description: Business FunctionAs the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.ResponsibilitiesThe Consumer Brand Team Marketing function will be accountable for achieving business objectives across paid, earned and owned channels through marketing campaigns, events and sponsorships. The team is also accountable for building and shaping brand perception across the various initiatives.The key responsibilities of the Marketing Manager will be to:Develop innovative and disruptive marketing and communication strategies and execute plans to succeed in the above objectives.Delight existing consumers while attracting new prospects through contextual and hyper personalized marketing, new engagement and advocacy campaigns, exploring novel touchpoints and inventive ways of marketing.Analyze data and create valuable insights to drive digital ATE, build segment knowledge and expertise, and identify opportunities to better connect with our audiences.The Marketing Manager will work closely with various key stakeholders, including internal and cross-functional teams, as well as external partners such as media and creative agencies; identify and foster key partnerships with relevant brands, advocates and influencers.The Marketing Manager will define KPIs, identify key drivers and initiatives, and work out a dashboard to measure the success of the marketing initiatives, laddering back up to bank's objectives, and provide regular updates along with recommendations to refine overall strategy and improve results. Knowledge of MarTech and data analysis is expected.RequirementsThe ideal candidate should:Be a marketer and inner data scientist.Be deeply embedded and relentlessly curious to the digital space from gaming, mobile, social networking, IOT, AI and everything in-between.Be a fast learner and thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment and demonstrate strong judgment and a solution-driven mindset.Be a thought-leader with a fascination in brand-building and delivering business results.Be able to “connect the dots” and see the big picture.Be a multi-tasker, but with clear time management and prioritization skills. Experience in agile marketing is ideal.Be open to candid feedback about your performance and seek constructive real-time points as a great way to grow.Be able to work both independently and in close collaboration with a wide array of stakeholders.Be a team player and a selfless, collaborative Marketing professional who will naturally go beyond roles and titles to get great work done.A mastery of verbal and written communication as well as presentation skills, a strong sense of EQ and empathy towards others, and an editorial perspective on building a brand’s social presence with an accessible tone of voice, goes without saying.Apply NowWe offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.Primary Location: Singapore-DBS Asia CentralJob: Marketing and CommunicationsSchedule: RegularEmployee Status: Full-time:Job Posting: Feb 9, 2021, 12:55:06 AM

title: Regional Ethics & Legal Compliance Managing Counsel
description: Company OverviewKLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and in 2019 we invested 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.Group/DivisionThe Legal Compliance Organization (LCO) team headquartered in Milpitas, CA provides legal guidance to further KLA’s strategic objectives and protect and preserve the legal, ethical and financial integrity and reputation of the Company. With specific expertise in the areas of corporate law, commercial law, employment law, and intellectual property; the LCO offers strategic legal counsel that is informed by a clear understanding of the company’s business objectives and expertise in the laws and regulations relevant to the business worldwide.KLA is seeking a highly motivated and experienced ethics & legal compliance managing counsel (attorney) to join its growing Ethics & Legal Compliance Group as a Regional Ethics & Legal Compliance & Investigation Managing Counsel. This position will report directly to KLA's Vice President & Chief Compliance Officer and be based in Singapore.. The individual must have a passion for ethics & compliance issues and have uncompromising integrity.The successful candidate will be responsible for, among other things,Directly managing KLA’s ethics & legal compliance issues in the South/Southeast Asia region, including Singapore, Malaysia, Vietnam, India, Thailand, Philippines, among other countries, and overseeing ethics & compliance issues in China, Taiwan, and Hong KongPrimary responsibility for managing and leading ethics & legal compliance investigations, and coordinating with other investigation groups in establishing and maintaining a worldwide investigation processManaging other team members with primary responsibility for KLA's anti-corruption and conflicts of interest programsDeveloping and delivering training on anti-corruption, privacy, antitrust, trade compliance, conflicts of interest, raising issues, and other ethics & compliance topicsConducting regional and country by country risk assessmentsIn general, assisting with developing processes & procedures for ethics & compliance programsBusiness Insight, Communication, Courage, Customer Focus, Doctor of Philosophy or Juris Doctor (Doctorate), Drives Results, Drive Vision & Purpose, KLA Values, Manages Ambiguity, Strategic Mindset, Technical / FunctionalWe offer a competitive, family friendly total rewards package. title: Business Development Lead, - Digital Intelligence - APAC
description: Job DescriptionABOUT THIS JOBDigital Intelligence is an agile startup within NielsenIQ that provides high end solutions using social media and consumer data. We are a global unit, and our customers are the largest consumer companies in the world.The center of excellence is a team of social media experts, insights consultants, data scientists, and technologists.This role will be part of the Sales and client development team – This will play a key role in announcing and establishing NielsenIQ’s presence in the Digital Intelligence solutions space across the globe. This team will ensure a steady sales pipeline and help the Digital Intelligence unit achieve its revenue targets.RESPONSIBILITIESOwn a revenue targetProspect, identify, and generate new opportunities to build a pipeline of targeted prospects for the NielsenIQ Digital Intelligence suite of offeringsHave a thorough understanding of where and how the need for digital intelligence originates in the client organization, where does it fit in within the market research/ insights industry, and lastly, how does the NielsenIQ offering meet that needHave a strong rigor of collecting market intelligence about prospective clients - services and products used, key stakeholders within, presence of competition, and so on.Manage sales pipeline through sequential states of the sales process: prospect, initial outreach, Service offering pitch and product demo, generating an RFP ( Request for Proposal), building a proposal, consultative selling, price negotiation, and closeDevelop existing clients – Engage and upsellMonitor and report market intelligence and sales progressRefine the pricing process, basis experience/inputs from ClientsHave the ability to engage across levels at the Client-side - tactical and agile with operation focussed executives and consultative partnering with C-suite executivesEstablish a “trusted advisor” relationship to determine needs, build value, and create engagement with the NDIWork with local Nielsen commercial teams – Domain training, Joint prospecting, Scoping, and sellingTrack closely publications/ blogs/ articles on the digital Intelligence/ Social listening industry – regular feedback and education of internal teams on latest developments, trends, competitor activities including large wins and new product launches.A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOUAre you a hunter with a passion for sales and delighting clients? You will lead to strong commercial conversations and negotiations with C Suite Stakeholders. A self-starter who knows how to manage a sales pipeline and most importantly generate leads. A strong storyteller who is comfortable in presenting and pitching to senior stakeholders. Strong commitment to business growth with strong influencing, persuading, sales skills with excellent analytical skills. We are looking for passionate leaders, who can work with agility, flexibility and creative ways of thinking, to disrupt a fragmented social media intelligence market.Qualifications8-10 years of sales/business development experience with selling social media tools/solutionsStrong experience, knowledge, and relationships with clients in the Asia Pacific region specifically in the social listening industryExcellent consultative proposal writing skillsStrong track record of sales performance in Social listening/ digitalFamiliarity with social media tools such as Brandwatch, Talkwalker, Synthesio, NetbaseHave interacted with C-level executives in Client organizationsStrong executive presence with excellent verbal and written communication skillsTeam player mentality with the ability to work independentlyExcellent organizational skills including prioritization, scheduling and time managementKnowledge of the Thai/ Japanese/ Korean language a huge plusAdditional InformationAbout NielsenIQNielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.About NielsenIQNielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. title: Associate Scientist
description: Curiox Biosystems is an exciting and innovative Life Science technology company that is growing rapidly. Curiox manufactures and sells instruments, automation products, and disposables for cell and protein analysis. The major application of Curiox Laminar Wash™ systems is centrifuge-free sample preparation of cells for Flow Cytometry, Single Cell Genomics, and other emerging cell analysis applications. The Laminar Wash instruments of MINI, HT, and AUTO address unmet needs by enabling affordable, off-the-shelf automation of the current, labor-intensive cell analysis process. Furthermore, the products improve the overall data quality such as cell retention, consistency, and reproducibility. Curiox products are used by customers performing life science research, immunology, immunotherapy, drug discovery diagnostics, vaccine research, and cell therapy research and manufacturing.“There’s this thought among scientists that the only way to prepare suspension cells for analysis is to use centrifugation. Curiox has invented a better way to prepare samples. One that’s good for cells is also good for scientists. We believe sample preparation can be affordable, have a good workflow, be less labor-intensive and reproducible. That’s why we’ve created Laminar Wash technology to help scientists prepare samples in a way that treats their cells gently so as not to introduce further variables into important experiments. If you’re ready to help scientists get better results and break them out of their entrenched ways of sample preparation, Curiox is the right place for you.” –Namyong Kim, PhD. Curiox CEOPOSITION OVERVIEW:Curiox is seeking an enthusiastic and inquisitive mind to conduct exciting research in-house and in collaboration with our scientific partners in immunooncology and innate immunity.The successful candidate must be independent, self-motivated and interested to learn new technologies.Candidates are encouraged to apply who have the motivation, experience, and skills to work in a startup culture, continuing Curiox’s rapid expansion to levels that exceed expectations. An attractive base salary is provided in this key position.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Active interest in inter-disciplinary research workDesign and perform experiments in the development of Laminar Wash and accessories which automate washing of suspension cells by an innovative centrifuge-less method in preparing cells for flow cytometry analysisDemonstrate a strong working knowledge of the capabilities of the Curiox technology and have the ability to discuss related applicationsPrimarily work in the biological lab space of Curiox located in Buona Vista areaMaintain the highest level of integrity with internal and external stakeholdersREQUIREMENTS:Experience working in a laboratory environment preferredExperience with flow cytometry techniques desired, but not requiredAbility to work independently and in a team, and have an investigative nature and attention to details.Must be self-motivated, enthusiastic with a desire to learn new techniques and approaches, and be able to work under tight deadlines.Detail-oriented with excellent record-keeping, as well as written and oral communication skills.Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, including flexibility with schedule and functionExcellent written and verbal communications skillsFamiliarity with laboratory safety protocols including chemical, biological and fire safety related to operations of a research laboratory.Bachelors of Science in the field of biology and/or life sciences requiredPlease come join us and make a difference. Send your resume or inquiry by email to hr@curiox.com. Please address your email “SG23” in the subject. No agencies please. Due to the high volume of applications, only qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: Scientist (Molecular) - Biosafety Testing
description: A career at our company is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 57,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in healthcare, life science and performance materials. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others.Who we are: We are a leading science and technology company. Its life science business offers a broad range of innovative products and services to biotech and pharmaceutical drug therapies businesses. Through dedicated collaboration with the scientific and engineering communities, and as one of the top three R&D investors in the life science tools industry, the brand serves as a strategic partner to customers and helps advance the promise of life science.Your role:The Scientist will have scientific expertise in biologics safety testing focused on Lot Release Testing (Focusing in molecular biology, Virology and cell biology). The Scientist will ensure projects are carried out with the appropriate scientific and regulatory compliance oversight. Timely provide their scientific expertise to support investigations and client meetings. The post holder will have the technical expertise to advice and support GMP and/or GLP operations. Responsibilities include overall conduct of GMP and/or GLP studies as required, reviewing assay testing proposals, acting as Responsible Scientist or Study Director for routine GMP or GLP studies, lead complex technical projects, respond to routine assay enquiries from commercial , reviewing and monitoring assay performance and lead scientific troubleshooting discussion for investigations. Maintain an in-depth understanding of BioReliance® BioSafety Testing Services and technical principles as well as advances in the field. The ability to maintain effective working relationships with development services, laboratory personnel and commercial team will be critical for success in the role.The post holder will be able to perform the following functions independently, with minimal guidance.Brief role description:Acts as a Study Director or Responsible Scientist for routine and complex assays and as such holds title: Laboratory Assistant
description: Curiox Biosystems is an exciting and innovative Life Science technology company that is growing rapidly. Curiox manufactures and sells instruments, automation products, and disposables for cell and protein analysis. The major application of Curiox Laminar Wash™ systems is centrifuge-free sample preparation of cells for Flow Cytometry, Single Cell Genomics, and other emerging cell analysis applications. The Laminar Wash instruments of MINI, HT, and AUTO address unmet needs by enabling affordable, off-the-shelf automation of the current, labor-intensive cell analysis process. Furthermore, the products improve the overall data quality such as cell retention, consistency, and reproducibility. Curiox products are used by customers performing life science research, immunology, immunotherapy, drug discovery diagnostics, vaccine research, and cell therapy research and manufacturing.“There’s this thought among scientists that the only way to prepare suspension cells for analysis is to use centrifugation. Curiox has invented a better way to prepare samples. One that’s good for cells is also good for scientists. We believe sample preparation can be affordable, have a good workflow, be less labor-intensive and reproducible. That’s why we’ve created Laminar Wash technology to help scientists prepare samples in a way that treats their cells gently so as not to introduce further variables into important experiments. If you’re ready to help scientists get better results and break them out of their entrenched ways of sample preparation, Curiox is the right place for you.” –Namyong Kim, PhD. Curiox CEOPOSITION OVERVIEW:Curiox is seeking an enthusiastic and inquisitive mind to conduct exciting in-house application and development research.The successful candidate must be independent, self-motivated and interested to learn new technologies.Candidates are encouraged to apply who have the motivation, experience, and skills to work in a startup culture, continuing Curiox’s rapid expansion to levels that exceed expectations. An attractive base salary is provided in this key position.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Active interest in inter-disciplinary research work spanning bioapplications and engineeringPerform experiments in the development of Laminar Wash and accessories which automate washing of suspension cells by an innovative centrifuge-less method in preparing cells for flow cytometry analysisInventory maintenance of routine laboratory consumables, ordering and overall labmaintenancePrimarily work in the development lab space of Curiox located in Sembawang areaMaintain the highest level of integrity with internal and external stakeholdersREQUIREMENTS:Experience working in a laboratory environment preferred, but not requiredAbility to work independently and in a team, and have an investigative nature and attention to details.Must be self-motivated, enthusiastic with a desire to learn new techniques and approaches, and be able to work under tight deadlines.Detail-oriented with good record-keeping, as well as written and oral communication skills.Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, including flexibility with schedule and functionGood written and verbal communications skillsDiploma in the field of biology, life sciences or bioengineering requiredPlease come join us and make a difference. Send your resume or inquiry by email to hr@curiox.com. Please address your email “SG23” in the subject. No agencies please. Due to the high volume of applications, only qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: Strategic Presales
description: Strategic Presales (Handle Data Scientist)job descMengidentifikasi masalah penganalisisan data yang bisa menjadi peluang besar bagi perusahaan seperti membuat rangkaian data permasalahaan, dan menjelaskan data dengan cara yang mudah untuk dikomunikasikan kepada perusahaan dan ditindaklanjuti.Melakukan penelitian , mendesain, dan menganalisis berbagai sumber data dengan tujuan mengetahui apakah data yang akan digunakan untuk penelitian bersifat valid dan reliabel.Menentukan set data dan variabel yang benar seperti menentukan variabel- variabel yang mempengaruhi atau yang berhubungan untuk menemukan pokok permasalahan.Memvalidasi data untuk memastikan apakah data yang didapat lengkap dan akurat.Menganalisis data untuk mengidentifikasi pola dan tren. Contohnya: apakah solusi yang diberikan sesuai dengan pola dan tren saat ini.Menafsirkan data untuk menemukan solusi dan peluang dengan membuat pemetaan, visualisasi dan prototype terhadap prediksi- prediksi yang akan dihadapi perusahaan.

title: Business Development Lead, - Digital Intelligence - APAC
description: Job DescriptionABOUT THIS JOBDigital Intelligence is an agile startup within NielsenIQ that provides high end solutions using social media and consumer data. We are a global unit, and our customers are the largest consumer companies in the world.The center of excellence is a team of social media experts, insights consultants, data scientists, and technologists.This role will be part of the Sales and client development team – This will play a key role in announcing and establishing NielsenIQ’s presence in the Digital Intelligence solutions space across the globe. We are looking for passionate leaders, who can work with agility, flexibility and creative ways of thinking, to disrupt a fragmented social media intelligence market.Qualifications8-10 years of sales/business development experience with selling social media tools/solutionsStrong experience, knowledge, and relationships with clients in the Asia Pacific region specifically in the social listening industryExcellent consultative proposal writing skillsStrong track record of sales performance in Social listening/ digitalFamiliarity with social media tools such as Brandwatch, Talkwalker, Synthesio, NetbaseHave interacted with C-level executives in Client organizationsStrong executive presence with excellent verbal and written communication skillsTeam player mentality with the ability to work independentlyExcellent organizational skills including prioritization, scheduling and time managementKnowledge of the Thai/ Japanese/ Korean language a huge plusAdditional InformationAbout NielsenIQNielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.
