title: Application Technologist Food Microbiology
description: At Corbion, we exist to champion preservation in all its forms, preserving food and food production, health, and our planet.Corbion's R&D Sustainable Food Solutions (SFS) develops functional ingredients which enhance shelf life, food safety, texture, flavor and overall performance of food stuff. What makes us special is that all our ingredient solutions are based on natural and sustainable resources. We closely work together with our customers in co-developing innovative solutions. We have multi-disciplinary approach towards innovation together with marketing and sales. This is how we contribute to reducing food waste and improving food safety.As our Food Application Technologist, you will be based out of our business hub in Singapore. You report to the Senior Food Scientist.ResponsibilitiesApplication development and shelf-life testing:Develop food recipes to compare the performance of Corbion ingredients to substitutes & competitive alternativesPlan, design, set up and perform microbiological tests including but not limited to shelf-life tests and challenge testsAnalyse food samples for chemical, microbiological and sensorial qualities (e.g. taste, texture, color)Prepare trial reports for internal and external customersAnalyse, interpret and explain application data for the sales organization for their discussions with distributors & customersWork with the application team to develop and prepare prototype foods for customer showingTechnical support to sales, distributors & customersPromote the use of Corbion’s ingredients in food applications in agreement with Sales & Business Development in APACAttend to customer queries with regards to microbiological background and technical issues of Corbion ingredients in food (do trials, use literature, use databases)Training of the sales organization, distributors and/or customersWork together with the application team to assure a fully functional kitchen & food lab (e.g. maintain analytical equipment, food processing equipment, maintain stock levels of used food ingredients)Assure a Safe & Hygienic environment in the Kitchen & Food laboratoryRequirementsBachelor or Master Degree in Food Science & Technology, with a focus on food microbiologyAt least 4 years of relevant experience in the Asian food (ingredients) industry. Experience in microbiology testing roles would be advantageous.Experience in meat, meat alternatives, seafood or savory industry is preferred.Technically skilled with a creative mindset to overcome application challengesWillingness to perform food trials & chemical/microbiological analysis in the lab 50-75% of the timeA commercial drive combined with creativity, passion, and performance orientationA sensitive & flexible team-player with strong communication and presentation skillsSelf-confident and self-managing, pro-active and taking initiativeBe able to work individually without supervisionFluent in EnglishWillingness to travel up to 15%, mostly in the APAC regionYou may participate in development & sensory evaluations of a variety of lab-made and commercial foods, including, but not limited to meat (beef, pork, poultry), seafood, confectionery, bakery, eggs and dairy.About CorbionWhat makes Corbion truly special is our talented global team of people, who are consciously dedicated to connecting the work we do together with the difference it makes in the lives of consumers, including our own friends and families. At Corbion, innovation is in our DNA; we explore, we discover, we create, and then we do it all over again, finding ever-better ways to help the world solve some of its most pressing challenges. When you come to Corbion, you will find that for us, sustainability is not simply a corporate program, it is at the very heart of our business, giving direction to our work, our investments and our creativity. We exist to preserve what matters.As a company where day-to-day priorities and decisions are shaped by a shared purpose and vision, we enjoy a working environment energized by empowerment and opportunity. By joining Corbion, you can be part of :A culture open to great ideas wherever they come from, and where your work can make a real difference in the worldAn organization that values diversity of thought, background and experienceA company ready to invest in you, helping you grow toward your personal ambitionsA workplace that’s friendly and informal, while being focused and professionalAn international team small enough to stay agile, but large and talented enough to make an impact today, and for future generationsOur corporate values – Collaboration, Care, Courage and Commitment – define what it takes to overcome obstacles and create the sustainable breakthroughs the world sorely needs. As a member of the Corbion team, you’ll see these values put into action every day, and you’ll have the chance to make your own unique contribution to our collective achievements.Corbion does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to hiring managers. All candidates must be submitted by approved Corbion vendors who have been expressly requested to make a submission by our Talent Acquisition team for a specific job opening. No placement fees will be paid to any firm unless such a request has been made by the Corbion Talent Acquisition team and such candidate was submitted to the Corbion Talent Acquisition Team.

description: Help us improve access to life-changing therapies that can transform human healthWe are Cytiva, a global provider of technologies and services that advance and accelerate the development and manufacture of therapeutics. Formerly part of GE Healthcare, we have a rich heritage tracing back hundreds of years, and a fresh beginning since 2020.Our customers undertake life-saving activities. These range from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, biologic drugs, and novel cell and gene therapies. Our job is to supply the tools and services - the pots, pans, soups and sauces - they need to work better, faster and safer, leading to better patient outcomes.We are looking for a Marketing Strategy & Operations Leader to work with our team of 7000 employees across the world. Do you have a passion for Marketing ? Then we would love to hear from you.What you’ll doBe able to identify regional growth opportunities with robust analysis and insightsWork with multifunctional teams to develop business strategies and plan execution to deliver targets and drive incremental growth and harmoniesDrive consistent segmentation approaches across the Asian region.Develop economic models to drive customer insightsEstablish and coordinate implementation of return on investment driven scalable marketing process across Asia in coordination with the global teams.Manage and mentor marketing team to help execute projects to timelines and scope.Demonstrate good combination of IT and eye for business to drive various marketing and commercial programs. title: Associate Director, Strategy and Planning
description: We are looking for a seasoned strategy expert who is adept in understanding how brands win in the platform world. You’ll be amazing at weaving together client- and pitching-winning media strategies, demonstrating an intimate understanding of how consumers interact with channels, digital publisher and engagement platforms. You’ll join the strategy Communications Practice, with outputs that blend Digitas capabilities to deliver integrated platform ideas and connected campaigns. The successful candidate will therefore possess a broad spectrum of experience in communications, media and engagement strategy.The Associate Director is a 360° thinker and effectiveness champion, who focuses on how to most effectively solve clients' business challenges through an orchestrated system of paid, owned and earned touchpoints. Digitas’ approach is collegiate and thrives on diversity; Strategists work with client leads, creatives, data scientists, experience designers and solution consultants within Digitas as well as forming Power Of One solution teams across Publicis Groupe. At the inter-section of technology, data and creativity we believe we can offer more meaningful connected experiences between brands and people.The Associate Director will spend half their time within a key Groupe regional media account, and the rest on Digitas clients and business development in Singapore. Digitas Singapore is an engine for growth for the brand across SEA, so you may also be asked to support other markets from time to time. Sound like you? Then we’d love you to get in touch.Your responsibilities:✦ Analysing a variety of data-centric resources to develop multi-faceted insights into consumers' media consumption and audience development that fuels decision-making and guides the development of a coherent and effective media plan.✦ Applying extensive platform expertise spanning publishers, mobile, social, native, entertainment (etc) to map consumer experience journeys and identify high impact moments for brands to connect through media-fuelled creativity.✦ Crafting stories based on how consumers are interacting with their devices and other technology to reveal how brands can better connect with their consumers✦ Translating top-down global strategies to consider regional nuances, as well as defining bottoms-up approaches and playbooks that influence global go-to-market.✦ Partnering with relationship leads, creative strategists, and other cross-capability teams to translate the holistic communications plan into innovative ideas and programs, resulting in smartly-mapped marketing tactics that deliver on stated goals.✦ Supporting the performance manager with media planning outputs, ensuring they align with strategic recommendations and represent consistently high standards/✦ Actively engaging with the Singapore strategy community, forming initiatives to develop, products, IP, skills and knowledge.✦ Supporting recruitment activities within strategy aligned to the business plan.
